reviewDescription: Having read most of the negative reviews of these shirts most being the fact that they were made of very thin material I decided to try them anyway because Summer shirts need to be light weight. I did take into account that the shirts are all 90% to 100% cotton and ordered one size larger for shrinkage( I wear a Men's Large so I ordered and Extra Large. I washed the shirts in warm water and dried in the dryer on low removing them immediately to hangers to prevent wrinkles. The shirts did indeed shrink, just about 1/2 size but I expect that they will shrink a little more over time so they should fit perfect after one more washing. They seem well made with all seams intact and no loose threads, the Black didn't fade like some reviews said and they shrank more in length than in width but the shirts have extra long tails so that isn't an issue for me. Over all this bundle of shirts is a great deal, 5 quality shirts for $20 where else are you going to find a deal like that these days. I recommend these Gildan T-shirts in this bundle, overall great shirts, Great value.

reviewDescription: Wow … totally surprised by this purchase.  There is such a difference in shrinkage depending on whether the shirt is SOLID color or HEATHERED.  I have only known GILDAN brand t-shirts that were 100% cotton. When I looked at description of material, I saw the first shirt listed was 100% cotton and didn’t think to look further.  I did not realize that the colored t-shirt sets have different % cotton.  Therefore when washed, some will shrink a full size easily and others will slightly shrink and others will shrink some but not enough to be considered a full size smaller depending on the % blend of polyester.  SO BUYER BEWARE AND READ % cotton for each color! Who knew ?!?  The 100% cotton ones are nice and durable while the blends tend to be lighter fabric.  Thankfully, I don’t mind sleeping in t-shirts that are too large so I get to keep the ones that have not shrunk enough to fit my husband properly.  We purchased L to account for shrinkage when dried on Medium or High heat.  My husband wears M so the shirts with the poly blend are mine and he has the rest.  It’s a shame the seller does NOT IDENTIFY the material discrepancy upfront—better yet, sell the t-shirts per material content and not mixed.  GILDAN is a nice brand and the 100% cotton have always been a favorite so I tossed the shirts in the wash immediately when received.  Not realizing the material differences when I washed them, I will now get to learn what the poly blends are like but I am guessing I will always prefer the 100% cotton.  I would have given 5-stars if seller would have been up front with the varied material for the colored sets.  Honestly, we are a bit disappointed to discover the material difference in the sets AFTER THE FACT.  Hope this helps anyone wondering about why such mixed reviews for size and material.
reviewTitle: Nice shirts but BUYER BEWARE and 👀 read % cotton per color of shirt 👀 …
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2025
variant: Number of Items: 5, Color: Navy/Heather Navy/Indigo Blue (5-pack), Size: Large

reviewDescription: I’m writing this after having used my original pair for over a year now so I feel like I have a good idea of who this product works! I’ve never in my life had a pair of nipples stickies that have performed so well. They truly stick until you take them off at the end of the night, even it hot and humid weather (I live in FL). They are seamless under the most thin fabrics, they don’t irritate my skin at all, and they are very comfortable to wear.Some points to consider-I’m a B cup and I ended up getting the size 2 covers (for larger breasts) because I felt like the smaller size left a little bit of an indent under my shirts so you could see the edges more easily. The bigger size took care of that!After about a year the stickiness around the edges is starting to wear off. Not so badly that I cannot wear them anymore, but unless it’s a tighter top I won’t be using them just because I don’t want there to be a chance I’ll lose one!I do want to point out though that these babies have had very regular use! Like at least 3-4 times a week and for long durations. I also will say that I didn't always clean them and store them properly right after wearing and I think letting them sit out could have dried up some of the adhesive a bit. Next time I will be sure to be more diligent!Anyways, to me it was worth every penny and I’m on my way to buying a fresh pair for the summer right now!

reviewDescription: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Discreet, Comfortable, and Reusable – Total Game Changer!I’ve tried several types of nipple covers over the years, but Nippies are hands-down the best. The silicone feels super soft and natural against the skin, and they’re just the right thickness to smooth everything out without looking bulky or obvious. I wore them under a tight dress at a wedding, danced all night, and they did not budge. Total lifesaver.The adhesive is strong but gentle—I’ve had no irritation at all, and they peel off cleanly every time. Bonus points for being washable and reusable. I’ve gotten at least 10 wears out of one pair so far, and they’re still going strong. Just make sure to follow the care instructions and store them in the original case.Whether you’re going braless for a backless dress or just want some extra coverage, these are a must-have. A bit pricier than drugstore versions, but 100% worth it for the quality and comfort.

reviewDescription: First off I feel very weird writing a review for this product BUT it’s been such a game changer for me that, despite feeling awkward, I wanted to write a review. I have a ridiculously small chest, I wear a 32AA but if the size existed I’d honestly fit better in a 28-30AA. Therefore I have an EXTREMELY hard time finding any real bra that fits me well and what does fit the best is sports bras. Unfortunately most sports bras don’t really have enough padding to conceal the outlines of this part of the breast (unfortunately with being a very small bust size I feel as though it just makes it even more noticeable) especially with any semi-tight top and there is nothing I hate more than having it show even slightly. For most of my life I’ve just avoided tops that are tighter but with a recent wardrobe change it became unavoidable and I needed some lighter browns which made the whole situation worse. So I decided to give this a try. I am so so so glad I did! It gives me enough coverage that even with a lightly padded sports bra I can still wear a more form fitting lighter colored top. They last all day (even in the height of summer and being outside in the sun all day and being fairly sweaty). I’ve reused the same pair multiple times and the adhesive despite numerous times hand washing. To ensure a good firm stick I do take a witch hazel toner over the area to remove any lotion, I’m not sure it is necessary to do that but I just want to make sure they stay put. I have very sensitive skin and despite the great grip it never bothers me! The only thing I kind of dislike is that if you sweat when you remove these there will be a dampness to the skin and covers BUT the dampness never ever leaks or shows and it never causes any kind of a rash or reaction on me. In fact the first time I used these was on a 90° day and after 6 hours outside and being hot dressed up in my Ren Faire clothes I was completely taken by surprise when I did remove them and discovered it was slightly damp, so you really can’t tell. I’m personally not a person that sweats much so my sweating in those conditions is much less than most people so perhaps someone else would have a different experience with these. The lack of sweating also means body odor really isn’t something I really worry about (I mean I use deodorant because you should not because I actually need to and that’s about the extent of my worry) but even with that dampness there was no odor. So for me that one things I’m not fond of is totally endurable because this product allows me to wear so many more tops with less self-consciousness! I have no idea if these are better or the same as cheaper brands because this was the first I tried and it worked so well I don’t plan on switching! I even swam with these once and they stayed on all day. I play volleyball, catch, frisbee, etc in the pool and don’t often dunk and swim a ton so if you swam submerged for hours I have no idea if they’d stay but for my activity that includes some dunking these things didn’t budge! I only got to try them once but this is going to allow me to wear a lot of bikini tops I would have avoided before! Seriously, life changing!

reviewDescription: I’m 6'2" and usually wear an XL because Large shirts betray me by being too short. XLs give me the length, but then I look like I’m wearing a parachute. This shirt? Nailed it. It’s labeled Loose Fit—and they weren’t kidding. A Large fits like an XL, but without the “is he hiding snacks under there?” vibe.Now, it’s 100% cotton, which usually makes me think “swampy armpits,” but this one? Nope. Lightweight, breathable, and surprisingly comfy. I’m an athletic trainer on a construction site in Phoenix. If this shirt can survive that heat, it can handle your backyard barbecue.I saw it's a frequently returned item, and honestly, I don’t get it. I’m super picky with t-shirts (like, "Feel a shirt in my closet I've worn a hundred times but suddenly it gives me the ick" picky), and I’m keeping this one. If you like your shirts roomy but not ridiculous, it’s a win.TL;DR – Loose Fit means loose, so size down if you’re between. Doesn’t suffocate you. Surprisingly breathable for cotton. Not bad at all.

reviewDescription: I finally made the switch from briefs to boxers. These are the second pack of boxer briefs that I've tried.I find briefs are good at holding the equipment comfortably, but restrict the air and blood flow.Boxers allow the equipment to hang free, but also allow the occasional dribble down the leg, and ride up.These boxer briefs are a great compromise incorporating the best of both worlds, whilst eliminating the worst of both worlds.They are comfortable to wear. They allow the equipment freedom to move, but the tighter leg fit prevents dribbles and don't ride up or wrap around as loose boxers do.Overall I am very pleased with my purchase. reviewDescription: What can I say, who doesn't love a new pair of Crocs? My 12yo daughters favorite shoes, I wish it wasn't so, but it is. She will wear no others. She loves them because they are quick to put on, go with pants, shots and even summer dresses. We love them because the Croc brand is the most durable. It is the only brand we buy now after, trying many others. Also only brand we and anyone we know who has children buy. If you want to know why keep reading: Crocs brand has the best quality and durability. All of the children I know who wear this style shoe (I know 6 or 7) use the ankle strap everytime they wear the shoes (we call it wearing the shoe in Sport mode). My daughter has 1-2 pair of Crocs at any given time and its the only shoe she ever wears and always wears them in Sport mode (ankle strap engaged around ankle). Other brands, and all the kids I know have tried others, something always seems to go wrong with the ankle strap. Because all the kids I know use the ankle strap everytime they wear the shoe, once the ankle strap goes bad, the shoe is useless to the children. I buy my 12yo daughter a new pair of Crocs either through Amazon or the local shoe store, about every 6 months, and only because they are so stained the shoe is ugly; she wears the design off; or she outgrows them, but never once have we had to replace the Croc brand because the ankle strap broke. Other brands we have tried, the ankle strap breaks after 1 or 2 wears. My daughter has a very high activity level for a 12yo. She plays in the woods just about daily, goes to school 5 days a week, rides a bike in the summer, and sometimes goes to the park to run around. For us the durability and quality cannot be beat, and we will spend the little extra for that.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2025

reviewDescription: I’ve been a long-time fan of Crocs, but these yellow ones have truly won me over for both their comfort and style. I’ve worn them on multiple occasions, from casual outings to quick trips around the house, and they’ve held up beautifully while keeping my feet happy the whole time.The comfort is unbeatable. The Croslite foam construction offers soft cushioning with every step, making these perfect for extended wear. Whether I’m running errands or standing for long periods, my feet never feel fatigued. The adjustable strap in the back allows for a custom fit, keeping them securely on my feet without feeling too tight. The arch support is surprisingly good for a casual shoe, which is a huge plus.Despite being made of lightweight material, these Crocs are incredibly durable. I’ve worn them in various environments—wet and dry—and they still look brand new. They’re easy to clean (a quick rinse with water and they’re good to go), and the soles offer excellent traction, making them suitable for both indoor and outdoor use. They’ve handled everything from beach trips to quick walks without showing any signs of wear.The bright yellow color is a fun, bold choice. While Crocs are known for their quirky style, I find the yellow to be surprisingly versatile. It’s a cheerful pop of color that can complement a casual summer outfit, or just add a bit of flair to a laid-back day around the house. They’re perfect for anyone who wants to stand out with something more playful and vibrant.These yellow Crocs are more than just a fashion statement; they combine comfort, durability, and style in one easy-to-wear shoe. Whether you’re lounging at home, heading to the beach, or running errands, they’re the perfect footwear for effortless, all-day comfort. I couldn’t be happier with my purchase and would highly recommend them to anyone who values comfort and a bit of fun in their footwear!
reviewTitle: Comfort, Durability, and Style – Yellow Crocs are a Game-Changer!

reviewDescription: The Nespresso Vertuo Double Espresso Scuro delivers a deep, dark roast with rich cocoa and subtle spice notes. reviewDescription: These pods have changed my life! Haha that’s a bit extreme but they have changed my mornings and I look forward to coffee time everyday! Perfect coffee flavor. I mix with some vanilla syrup and frothed oatmilk for the perfect latte.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2025

reviewDescription: A sampler came with the purchase of my Nespresso, and I identified the Chiaro as a favorite immediately. I know i like a dark roast and gravitated towards those options in the sampler. They were all tasty, but chiaro was a clear favorite. I'm not good with notes but I will say it's robust, bold and smooth, producing a delightful crema and providing me with a nice wake up in the morning. It's so tasty, i use some steamed oatmilk, a dash of splenda, and Starbucks hasn't seen a dime from me in over 2 weeks!I also sought out reviews when choosing which flavor of nespresso capsules to purchase first. Most are sold in groups of 30, that being one of the better values anyway on amazon. Chiaro was one of the most highly rated amongst reviews of dark roast capsules! It was a clear choice for me after tasting the one sample that came in the sampler pack. I also really enjoyed the Dioppio Blanco, and Fortada, both dark roasts and espresso options. I am already on my 2nd order of 30 capsules...i have to remind myself these are double shots and to pace myself so as to keep my caffeine intake in check...it's that good!I highly recommend this flavor of capsule. It hits all the right spots. I'm not well versed in coffee, I don't quite understand notes but I do know I like a good dark roast, and I certaintly like certain brands and flavors of coffee from popular brands like Peets, Starbucks, Green Mountain and a few smaller local brands. As someone who used to frequent Starbucks, Peets Coffee or other barista almost daily, the Chiaro has made my switch to homemade espresso beverages so easy and delightful! I look forward to my morning coffee ritual  so much, it smells like my very own coffee house every morning! The espresso brews quickly, in about 40 seconds or less.I did see some mention in reviews for this capsule, or the Nespresso itself about the size of the output this capsule makes. On the sampler package, there was an informative diagram on the back that broke down the flavors into categories of type of beverage. Some categories were espresso,double espresso, coffee and one other. There was also included volume amounts in ounces. The espressos make about 1 ounce where the double espressos makes about about 2 ounces, double the size of an espresso.  The capsules meant for coffee beverages made 5-7 ounces of coffee. Whomever left those reviews didn't understand that and thought there was something wrong. The beverage is meant to be enjoyed wirh extra liquid, either milk or water (if making an americano). As I stated, I made a latte, using about 6 oz of steamed oatmilk. The chiaro double espresso and oatmilk together produce a strong, smooth coffee beverage totalling about 8 ounces, closer to the expected size.I do plan to branch out and expand my experience with other flavors I tried in the sampler. Another feature of the diagram on the sample packsging were included flavors "you may also like" listed below each flvor. So that if you enjoyed one flavor, you were given recommendations on others to try. I've kept that diagram and plan to reference it along with Amazon reviews when selecting my next package of nespreaso capsules. I do suggest you start with chiaro if you like dark roast. This is a good roast you cant really go wrong with.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2024

reviewDescription: One of my favorite nespresso pods. They are not too bold so the coffee taste isn’t super strong in them. They are single cups so if you like double this isn’t for you. Not a variety pack so it is the same flavor. I usually mix with oat milk and a small splash of creamer. Definitely a good and affordable way to save money at home!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2025

reviewDescription: This pod has become a staple in my rotation. It’s smooth, balanced, and has just enough strength to start the day without being too intense or bitter. It definitely leans toward the lighter end of the espresso spectrum—closer to a mellow medium roast than a full-bodied Italian-style shot. Great for people who want a gentle wake-up or a mid-afternoon pick-me-up without the jitters.The crema is rich and consistent (as expected from the Vertuo system), and it brews perfectly every time. It pairs well with milk for lattes or cortados, though the flavor can get a little lost if you use too much.My only reason for knocking off a star is that it’s not as bold or layered as some of the other Vertuo espresso options. If you prefer strong, complex notes or a deeper roast, this might feel a little underwhelming. But if you like your espresso smooth and easygoing, this is a great everyday option.Overall, it’s a high-quality, reliable pod that delivers a mellow but satisfying shot every time. Worth keeping stocked for daily drinkers who prefer balance over bite.
reviewTitle: Smooth, reliable espresso—but not the boldest

reviewDescription: This movie caught my attention the moment it was first announced and I myself,grew up watching Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes. All I can say was 100% not disappointed in the slightest. It has action,thrills,heart,laughs,and best of all,the classic Looney Tunes wackiness that fans have grown to know and love. I love the dynamic between Porky and Daffy. They're like a mix between best friends and brothers and I love it. Petunia played her role perfectly here too. She's as adorable as she is quirky. reviewDescription: If you like looney Tunes you’ll enjoy this. It’s also the first full length Looney Tunes movie with all original animation. It’s not perfect, but you can count the instances of cringey modern humor on one hand. The good definitely outweighs the bad. I genuinely laughed at it way more than I thought. It’s fun, silly, has lots of heart, and dare I say.. Looney. Most love the franchise has gotten in years and the only thing that held it back was the nonexistent advertising. But thankfully it spread through word of mouth thanks to animation nerds. Now thanks to the distributor(Ketchup) we’re getting Coyote vs Acme! Buy this is you want a fun movie and a physical important piece of Looney Tunes history and show WB that love for these characters still exists.

reviewDescription: This movie was a lot of fun and spot on straight to the point, at the time of this movies released, there was a lot of controversy swarming at this movie production and the actor Anthony Mackie. Anthony Mackie and Harrison Ford did a tremendous job doing their part, Sam Wilson’s, Captain America main goal was to clear up Isaiah Bradleys crimes, who was framed by The Leader, meanwhile President Ross was struggling to find peace and unity with all different countries who are all fighting over fighting over Adamantium but over the years he was working with the leader to help him, survive and get through his election and eventually ultimately turning Ross into the Red Hulk. Although Sam is taking up the mantle of Captain America, he does have this song doubt that he doesn’t deserve it but Bucky a.k.a. the winter soldier told him that Steve chose him for a reason because he saw that he was a good man and would see the good in the people, and to give the people to believe in something. reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2025

reviewDescription: I had a blast watching this newest addition to the MCU. Although it wasn’t as hard hitting as Winter Soldier, fresh as The First Avenger or as cameo filled as Civil War, Brave New World opens up the cinematic universe into the realm of “what will happen next!?!”Many complaints about the film are unjustified. No action, boring dialogue and missed opportunities. I disagree on all accounts.The action continues throughout the entirety of its near two hour length, the story reveals itself by way of Cap searching for the real threat and the discovery of a new element has just opened the world up to so much potential.There were a couple of moments that seemed to pander to the audience, but those moments weren’t all that intrusive anyway. There is only one scene during the credits, quite unnecessary in all honesty, and it is by far the weakest part of the whole. Other than that, the movie is fun, lively and makes for a fantastic addition to an already wonderful cinematic universe.Bring on the Thunderbolts!
reviewTitle: Set after Eternals and before Thunderbolts

reviewDescription: Julius Onah’s 2025 film, “Captain America: Brave New World,” follows a screenplay by Onah, Rob Edwards, Malcolm Spellman, Dalan Musson, and Peter Glanx. The film picks up following the events of the Disney+ television series “The Falcon and the Winter Soldier” as well as continuing on from the “Captain America” and “Avengers” films. In the story, Sam Wilson (Anthony Mackie) now works as Captain America and is aided by Joaquin Torres (Danny Ramirez), the new Falcon. They find themselves drawn into a spy game following the election of Thaddeus Ross (Harrison Ford, replacing the late William Hurt) to the Presidency and the geopolitical ramifications of the discovery of adamantium in the Celestial Island left over from the events of Chloé Zhao’s 2021 film, “Eternals.” The film sets up a race for resources with Japan and the United States as the largest players in the contest. President Ross and Cap have their own rocky history, made all the worse when a trigger sets off Isaiah Bradley (Carl Lumbly) at a White House reception, forcing Cap to help capture his old friend while also figuring out what the President is hiding.The film introduces Sidewinder (Giancarlo Esposito) and Copperhead (Jóhannes Haukur Jóhannesson) as members of Serpent, thereby using an early story idea for the third Cap film before it was changed to “Civil War.” While other Marvel projects have hearkened back to Louis Leterrier’s 2008 film, “The Incredible Hulk,” hoping to demonstrate the importance of the second entry in the MCU through cameos in Destin Daniel Cretton’s 2021 film, “Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings,” and Jessica Gao’s 2022 Disney+ series, “She-Hulk: Attorney at Law,” Onah uses “Brave New World” to tie together the most threads from “Incredible Hulk” with Thaddeus Ross’ prominent role, the return of Samuel Sterns (Tim Blake Nelson) who had his brain exposed to gamma in “Incredible Hulk,” and a brief cameo from Betty Ross (Liv Tyler). Just as “Civil War” was both a Cap film and an Iron Man film, “Brave New World” is both a Cap film and a Hulk film.At times, the political thriller elements struggle to hold suspense since the film’s marketing gave away several of the biggest twists. Harrison Ford gives one of his best dramatic performance, imbuing the character with more pathos than William Hurt had been able to do in previous films (not due to a lack on Hurt’s part, but because of how those prior films used the character). For his part, Anthony Mackie continues to demonstrate why he was the right person to take up the shield and become Cap. He shows mercy, compassion, and introspection even as he’s delivers fantastically choreographed and athletic fight scenes. Shira Haas rounds out the cast as Ruth Bat-Seraph, who Onah reimagines as a former Black Widow. Changes to the character’s origin and costume help with some of the controversy surrounding her inclusion given current real-world events. Further, the character’s initial debut in the “Hulk” comics adds to the role of the Hulk mythos in this movie. Unfortunately, the film doesn’t make her a mutant and thus misses the opportunity to use both her inclusion and the appearance of adamantium to further lay the groundwork for the X-Men. Overall, “Brave New World” is an enjoyable film with Anthony Mackie shining as Cap, but the film struggles to balance several subplots and could have used the political thriller elements to greater effect as an allegory for our own political situation. Ford’s portrayal of President Ross and the parallels to “The Manchurian Candidate” work particularly well.This Blu-Ray/4K steelbook is a great way for Cap fans to add this film to their collection. It includes featurettes about Anthony Macke’s portrayal of Sam Wilson over the years, a look at Sam’s greatest foes, a gag reel, deleted scenes, and audio commentary. I do wish there was more about the effects both practical and digital as well as an inclusion of art cards like Marvel has done in the past. The art on the packaging is particularly nice and recalls some of the current posters for John Frankenheimer’s 1962 film, “The Manchurian Candidate.”
reviewTitle: Fun, but Often Balancing Too Many Plot Threads
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2025

reviewDescription: Taylor Sheridan has done it again with his latest masterpiece, the Landman series. From the moment the first episode begins, you’re swept into a world that feels both raw and authentic, a hallmark of Sheridan's storytelling. His ‘Midas touch’ is evident in every frame, from the intricately woven plots to the rich character development that keeps viewers invested.The Landman series is a brilliant exploration of the complexities of land, oil, power, and the human condition. Sheridan has a unique ability to blend intense drama with poignant social commentary, and this series is no exception. Each character is meticulously crafted and the cinematography is nothing short of breathtaking. Each shot is thoughtfully composed, capturing the stark beauty of the landscapes while enhancing the emotional depth of the narrative. Sheridan’s keen eye for detail transforms the setting into a character of its own, adding layers to the story that resonate long after the credits roll.The writing is sharp, witty, and often laced with a deep sense of humanity. Sheridan tackles challenging themes with grace, making the audience reflect on issues that are both timely and timeless. The dialogue crackles with authenticity, and Billy Bob Thornton is stellar in his performance.In the film industry where this is a lot of terrible films somehow getting produced and where storytelling can often feel formulaic, Taylor Sheridan continues to push boundaries and redefine what television can achieve. The Landman series is a testament to his genius, proving once again that he is a master of his craft. This series deserves all the accolades and praise it receives, and I cannot recommend it highly enough. Prepare yourself for an intense and emotional rollercoaster that will leave you craving more!
reviewTitle: Phenomenal! Taylor Sheridan is the GOAT
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2025

reviewDescription: I spent so much time looking at the reviews and photos trying to determine the right size, which were all over the place or missing data with photos that I'm doing this, simply, because in the end, it was true to size in my experience.  I'm very happy it was because I ordered 5, three prints and the white and a black solid.  Thank you to those who shared the same experience.  I'm in Texas, so it is hot much of the year.  I like the thinness of the fabric.  It doesn't look cheap, and it doesn't look expensive. It looks good. Maybe a print looks cheap...ok, pick a better print, material is good.  It's perfect to be dressed up or down.  Mine look great and are cool and breezy.  Only two of my prints had color and they were just like the photos, beautiful.  One print had a different variation of hem in the front but still, just like the photo.  The other four had the same curvature in the front so, yes there can be some variations in style.  I only saw a variation of 1-2 inches in sleeve length and fit when closing the front sides together, which I was able to do by 1–2-inch overlap.  I am 5'5 and the length came to upper mid-thigh on sides and covered the bum completely.  I do not have a big bum or a flat bum. With my bum and my small tummy and the front panels touching together, the fabric had a straight, falling drape in back from side view, no hugging. I have an hourglass shape.  At a 36C, my tummy does not extend past my bust.  Having said that, I normally buy a large 12-14 or a 10-12 size top and always a 12 bottom. I size for myself a slightly loose fit, not snug or tight.  If one likes snug fit, it could seem too big.  I expected a jacket style like this with drape and flow and that's what I got.  The bust and hip of the large fit me true to size.  It did not fall off my shoulders.  I did try one on with a shoulder covered shirt with grip and one with a spaghetti strap dress, no grip, and it fit my shoulders fine with no slip off on either.  Arm space had good room, drape and flow too.  I have good strong arms, not thin or small.  My shoulders are an average width and large fits them every time.  Fabric is a sheer polyester as was presented and expected.  Anything heavier would be too hot, in my opinion.  It is a summer staple and shouldn't be hot or heavy, especially in a hot climate where panty hose can suffocate you.  The sewing appeared to be satisfactory and solid hems on all I purchased.  They can wrinkle, so hanging up is advisable.  They are lightweight and I hung all of them over each other on one hanger, not a big deal or heavy.  These were exactly what I was looking for to balance me with spaghetti straps, which I don't look great in but love to wear.  I was excited to find them but figuring out the true sizing in reviews was crazy.  My experience is true to size, comfortable, perfect for my purposes, satisfactory crafted for value, colors and prints as portrayed.  The curvature of the front could be tricky for some to adjust to different body styles.  The photos were great to see this with.  I love them and would recommend.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2025
variant: Size: Large, Color: Blue Dark Floral

reviewDescription: This was very pretty, and it fit my need for a sheer, colorful coverup to dress up a casual outfit.  The fabric is thin and sheer, but that is exactly the description. I've found that this type of delicate material, if treated well, will last a good while. I wouldn't use it for a swimsuit coverup, though - you need fabric that is more substantial.I've found that a sheer coverup like this or a thin, glittery wrap will allow me to wear a plain knit dress or casual pants and a t-shirt and still look a bit dressy.  Especially good for traveling, as these pack down to nothing.  I mostly travel with carryon luggage only, so I don't take one-use clothes. If I'm going out for dinner, or on a cruise dress-up night, all I have to do is wear something like this over the same solid color knit dress or slacks/capris I wear every day, and my look is upgraded significantly.

reviewDescription: This is the best tasting brand out there.  I regularly order both the 26g and the 42g. These taste smooth, like chocolate milk.  There is no nasty aftertaste. I like both the chocolate and the vanilla.  There is also a strawberry option that I haven't tried. reviewDescription: HANES ist eine Marke, die nur in den USA weitverbreitet ist, was schade ist, denn sie ist gerade für etwas "kräftigere" Menschen das Mittel der Wahl. XXL entspricht dort nicht L sondern meint XXL.Abgesehen davon sind sie von hoher Qualität und halten die Farbe ewig und die Nähte sowieso. Nach 10 Jahren dürfen sie dann mal etwas "ausgeleiert" sein. Das entspricht dann aber 1,70€ pro Jahr tragen.Besser geht nicht. Für fashion victims natürlich nicht geeignet, da keine Klunker und Bändchen dran sind und auch kein Firmen-LOGO. Ist nur drinnen. Also was für dezente Wohlhabende mit Verstand und Sinn für Ökonomie, denn nur schlichtere Menschen verbrennen ihr Geld mit Klamotten.

reviewDescription: I popped a piece of PUR gum expecting a casual breath-freshening experience. What I got was a full-body cleanse of the soul. This isn’t gum. This is a lifestyle choice wrapped in minimalist packaging and Nordic values.First chew: my credit score went up.Second chew: I began sorting my recycling correctly and alphabetically.Third chew: a crisp breeze blew through the room, despite all windows being closed. Björk may have whispered something encouraging from the walls. Unclear.Aspartame-free? Try sin-free.100% Xylitol? Pretty sure that’s Elvish for “dental sorcery.”Honestly, this gum is so pure it made me feel bad about every food decision I’ve ever made. I now live off glacier water and regret.
reviewTitle: Chewed this gum and now I speak fluent Scandinavian

reviewDescription: Just thought I'd try to review each flavor individually. But before I start, I have to say that in general, I think the mint flavors are best. They last the longest due to the cooling sensation, and do the best job freshening the breath. However, in general, the flavor doesn't last as long as sugared gum or aspartame/acesulfame K gum. I've not noticed any kind of G.I upset from chewing these, and I often chew several pieces a day. But I know some people can be sensitive to xylitol, so bear that in mind.As for the flavors:Cool mint- not a big fan of this one. It has a slightly bitter flavor to it, kind of like a cucumber mint taste. It lasts decently long.Spearmint- very tasty, very fresh, one of the longest lasting. It's one of my favorites.Wintermint- it's also long lasting, but has an aftertaste I'm not crazy about. To be fair, I'm not a big fan of wintermint flavor in most things. If you're a fan of wintermint, this might be for you.Peppermint- a strong, clean bite, very fresh and long lasting. It has a true-to-peppermint flavor. This is also a favorite.Pomegranate mint- this one is a surprise favorite, with the fruity flavor wonderfully complimenting the mint, which is lighter than the other mints. The pomegranate flavor is bright and strong, and lasts a decent amount of time. I have found that the flavor lasting time can vary from piece to piece, but I suppose that's to be expected.Bubblegum- I really want to like this one. The base bubblegum flavor is pretty good, but this flavor lasts the shortest time, and once the flavor is gone, it tastes kinda rubbery.Cinnamon- this one is pretty good. It's not a super strong cinnamon, but it definitely warms me up a bit and is as good for freshening breath as the mint ones. It's becoming one of my favorites, and easier to chew on a winter day 😉 It lasts decently long.Chocolate mint- I actually got this pack intending to try this one, as I'd had most of these before. And I'm glad I did. This one is surprisingly tasty, with a good full bodied chocolate flavor and a perfect hit of mint. Both flavors are well balanced, and when the chocolate disappears, the mint lingers. It lasts about as long as the pomegranate mint.So would I recommend these? Definitely, especially if you love chewing gum but don't want all the extra sugar. And buying them in bulk like this is pretty economical, as this bundle is much cheaper per pack than buying them in store. If you're new to Pur, I'd recommend starting with the mint flavors first. Happy chewing!

reviewDescription: Pur gum is healthier as far as sweetener goes (it contains xylitol rather than aspartame or corn syrup), and the flavors are fine. However, just like all the less healthy chewing gums, Pur contains something called “gum base”. Gum base is typically composed of various emulsifiers such as polysorbate 80, carrageenan, maltodextrin, or xanthan gum—each of which can cause health problems. Because I know that there are safer and more natural alternatives, I emailed Pur to ask if their chewing gums contain any of these aforementioned ingredients, but they (politely) refused to answer, saying that their formula is proprietary. Since they wouldn’t tell me that their products *don’t* contain these emulsifiers, I can’t recommend them.

reviewDescription: I’m thrilled to buy and support more Looney Tunes on Blu-Ray!I would encourage anyone serious about collecting Looney Tunes on disc to seek out interviews from George Feltenstein (Warner Archives) and Jerry Beck (animation historian) to learn about their vision for the Collectors Vault series going forward.Volumes 1-4 of the Collector’s Choice series was an effort to bring us shorts that were not on any previous disc collections (DVD or Blu-Ray) in remastered form.  Each volume of Collector’s Choice was a single disc.That effort has now been rebranded as Collector’s Vault.  However, it has expanded to include two discs in each volume for only a few dollars more than the single disc Collector’s Choice volumes.The first disc will continue the trend of releasing shorts never offered on any Looney Tunes disc collection (DVD or Blu-Ray) in remastered form.  This is essentially what would have been Collector’s Choice Volume 5.  The additional second disc will contain shorts never offered on Blu-Ray in high definition.  For example, this will include shorts available on the Golden Collection DVDs that pre-dated Blu-Ray.This approach will allow Warner Archives to continue releasing new material (disc 1) while also upgrading SD/DVD shorts to HD/Blu-Ray (disc 2).I would not consider this approach “double dipping,” and I would not consider it cheating us out of additional new material.  Instead, it is a cost-effective way to get both new remastered cartoons out on disc, while also upgrading ones that were previously DVD only.Note that the 1-disc Collectors Choice volumes list for $21.99 while the new 2-disc Collectors Vault volume lists for $24.99.  For $3 extra dollars, we get double the shorts.I’m hopeful people support these new volumes so we can continue to get Looney Tunes on Blu-Ray for years to come, and eventually complete the library.Side note, it was revealed that the inclusion of “DOUBLE OR MUTTON” in this collection was a mistake, as it was already released in Collector’s Choice Volume 4.  However, it was also announced they would make up for this error by including an “extra” disc one short (26 instead of 25) on Collector’s Vault volume 2 when it is released.
reviewTitle: Consider this Collectors Choice Volume 5, but better!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2025

There are 25 new to disc shorts (1 accidentally included, that being “Double or Mutton”), and there are 25 new to Blu-ray shorts. Here’s the list of cartoons that will be included.DISC ONE: NEW TO DISCBARS AND STRIPES FOREVER (1939)BEAUTY AND THE BEAST (1934)A DAY AT THE ZOO (1939)THE DIXIE FRYER  (1960)DOUBLE OR MUTTON (was on LTCC V. 4)EACH DAWN I CROW (1949)EASY PECKIN’S (1953)FEATHER DUSTED (1955)FOX IN A FIX (1951)GOOD NIGHT ELMER (1940)THE GOOFY GOPHERS (1947)I'D LOVE TO TAKE ORDERS FROM YOU (1936)KIDDIES KITTY, A (1955)LET IT BE ME (1936)OF FOX AND HOUNDS (1940)QUACKODILE TEARS (1962)READY, WOOLEN AND ABLE (1960)ROBIN HOOD MAKES GOOD (1939)SQUAWKIN' HAWK, THE (1942)TERRIER-STRICKEN (1952)TWEET AND LOVELY (1959)TWEETY'S CIRCUS (1955)TWO'S A CROWD (1950)WILD ABOUT HURRY (1959)ZIP 'N SNORT (1961)DISC TWO: NEW TO BLU-RAYAIN’T SHE TWEET (1952)BANTY RAIDS (1963)BIRTH OF A NOTION  (1947)BYE BYE BLUEBEARD (1949)CAT-TAILS FOR TWO  (1953)DAFFY DILLY (1948)DAFFY DUCK AND EGGHEAD (1938)GEE WHIZ-Z-Z-Z-Z-Z-Z  (1956)GONZALES’ TAMALES (1957)HARE CONDITIONED  (1945)HARE TRIGGER  (1945)HARE TRIMMED  (1953)HORTON HATCHES THE EGG (1942)LITTLE BOY BOO (1954)MUCH ADO ABOUT NUTTING (1953)ODOR-ABLE KITTY  (1945)PAST PERFUMANCE (1955)PORKY’S DUCK HUNT  (1937)RABBIT PUNCH  (1948)RED RIDING HOODWINKED  (1955)RHAPSODY RABBIT  (1946)SNOW BUSINESS  (1953)TOM TURK AND DAFFY (1944)TWO CROWS FROM TACOS (1956)ZOOM AND BORED (1957)If you want to support upcoming Looney Tunes collections by Warner Archive, I suggest you buy this. reviewDescription: I think the review/info and opinion Kellye posted is spot on. This is a great value compared to the last 4 releases. I have all the Golden LT DVD sets and I have no problem paying an extra $3.00 here to get an entire disc of the already remastered shorts from the DVDs but in beautiful high definition. That is an upgrade in my humble opinion and not a double dip move. That’s not to say WB has never pulled the double dip move but this doesn’t count. WB has really done a good job giving fans of the classic Looney Tunes a lot of love when it comes to all the work they’ve done restoring and remastering so many wonderful Looney Tunes shorts. These classic cartoons deserve to be restored to their original glory and WB treats these like the important American cultural history they are. I hope someday we have all the DVD shorts brought to HD blu ray. What a joy that would be to watch these with future grandkids. 😊
reviewTitle: Kellye’s review and insight spot on

reviewDescription: I would love to give this item a 5-star review because the ones I bought a year ago have been extremely comfortable.  They have held up well in the laundry over time, with no shrinking, pilling or deterioration of the fabric or of the elastic, and no problems with the stitching popping or anything like that.  I was surprised how much I liked them, to be honest, because I was skeptical about the great price point -- that's why I only ordered a couple of pairs initially.  However, when I I recently reordered more to stock up on what was supposed to be the exact same style, exact same size, the underwear that showed up in the mail yesterday are ENORMOUS!  In the attached photos you can see the salmon pink pair of size Large that I ordered a year ago, and the white pair of size Large that I just received.  This is not due to shrinkage either; elastic does not shrink -- if the fabric of my pink underwear had shrunk that significantly, the elastic would be all rippled and wavy like ruffles around the edges.  Clearly there has been a drastic change to the sizing at the factory, or maybe Amazon switched to a different factory that is cutting everything larger.  I am super bummed.  I will be exchanging these for size Medium and I'm hoping they send me something closer to what was previously sized Large.
reviewTitle: Fantastic comfort and quality, but SIZING has changed drastically!  Order a size (or two) smaller

reviewDescription: Who doesn’t love a clean, organic protein bar that actually tastes good? ALOHA bars have become an absolute staple for me — so much so that I’ve even gifted them to friends and family! The Vanilla Almond Crunch flavor is one of my favorites: it’s satisfying, not overly sweet, and has a great texture with just the right amount of crunch. But all of the flavors are just delicious!I really appreciate the simple, plant-based ingredient list — no junk, no strange aftertaste, just clean nutrition. Each bar is packed with protein and makes for the perfect snack when I’m on the go, traveling, or even running late and need something quick and filling. I find these to be more affordable with clean ingredients compared to other brands.It’s also a great option post-meal when I’m craving something a little sweet but still want to stay on track nutritionally. These bars check every box: taste, quality, convenience, and clean ingredients. Highly recommend keeping a box on hand — you’ll go through them faster than you expect!
reviewTitle: Clean, Delicious, and My Go-To On-the-Go Snack!

reviewDescription: I just finished my first bar and rushed to do a review!  Firstly, I do not have extensive protein bar experience, mostly because I generally find them off putting and try to avoid anything processed. However, in my quest to increase my protein intake I found Aloha and have ordered the chocolate mint bars a few times. I also recommend those, but the Kona bars are a step above. The flavor is not overtly coconut or coffee or nutty. It’s a very nice blend and the flavors compliment each other making for a pretty dynamic taste. It’s not overtly sweet either, even though some folks might scoff of the sugar content. The texture is very soft and a tiny bit gummy, but not in an unpleasant way. I would love this bar to be chocolate coated for a real treat, but it’s enjoyable as it is. It is a little pricy, but I can justify it for myself considering what I like and need. reviewDescription: If you're a fan of flavored coffee and use a Nespresso machine, this variety pack is a fantastic addition to your lineup. It includes three flavors: Sweet Vanilla, Roasted Hazelnut, and Golden Caramel, each offering its own unique tasting experience. I’ve been using these pods daily and here’s my detailed breakdown:Sweet Vanilla:This is the most subtle of the three, with a light, smooth vanilla flavor that doesn't overpower the coffee. It blends beautifully with milk or cream and works particularly well for iced coffee. The vanilla is more of a whisper than a bold note, perfect if you like a gentle sweetness rather than something too dessert-like. While it wasn’t my personal favorite, I can see why it’s one of Nespresso’s best sellers. It's refined, versatile, and crowd-pleasing.Best enjoyed: Iced or with a splash of almond or oat milk. Brewed on "strong" for added depth.Roasted Hazelnut:This one really surprised me! I wasn’t expecting to love it as much as I did. The hazelnut flavor is rich, toasty, and incredibly comforting. It has a warm, nutty aroma right from the brew and pairs beautifully with a morning pastry or a cozy afternoon break. What impressed me most is that the hazelnut flavor tasted natural and smooth, not overly artificial or sweet.Golden Caramel:The whole reason I bought this pack, and while it didn’t hit with the bold caramel punch I expected, it still delivered a smooth and mellow flavor. The caramel is more understated than what you’d find in a sugary latte, but that makes it easier to enjoy daily without feeling like you’re drinking dessert. It’s balanced and elegant, which I’ve grown to appreciate.If you're looking for a flavored Nespresso variety pack that’s flavorful without being overpowering, this is a five-star pick. Great for everyday use, adaptable to hot or iced drinks, and a pleasure to explore.
reviewTitle: A Must Try Nespresso Variety Pack!

reviewDescription: The Film:  The Texas Chainsaw Massacre-The Beginning-UnratedYear Made: 2006Let me start by saying that when I review a film, I like to do so without compairing to others.  To read exactly what I think of the original Texas Chainsaw Massacre 1974 version, feel free to read my review on that film.  I'm not going to compair, I'll just tell you what I feel with this film on it's own merit.  Lets begin...The package. 4 Stars.  The cover looks brutal, with what would be a face of a person that Leatherface cut off and did some nifty stitch work. I was dissapointed that when I opened up the CD case though, mine had no inlay inside at all, only the disc. hmm Not sure if this was normal or not but thats it.  The extras on the disc are very nice and the CD is easy to pop out and yet the holder holds it into place very well.  I hate when cases are put together bad and it's a nightmare to pop out the disc, this one is no problem.  So all and all, I love the cover art, but was let down by the fact, no inlay at all.Spook Meter.  5 Stars.  WOW, what can be said here except well, BRUTAL.  This film is just creepy.  I will never look at a sheriff the same way again after seeing the sheriff in this film.  The family is creepy and the sherrif played the role extreamly well.  I don't think I would ever want to meet that guy face to face, he played the role that well. I did not sleep to well after watching this film.  This film is very intense, brutal horror plain and simple.  This is not a "fun campy" type horror film by any means.  This is a film that was made to make the viewer very umcomfortable and it does a great job at that. We see in this version of the film just how Leatherface became who he turned into later in life.  I really liked how this movie started and did a great job explaining different things. Well acting overall, some parts I thought with some of the kids could have been a bit better acted out, but the sheriff and the family more then make up for that.  Leatherface is very intense, I love how he at times would turn off his chainsaw for a moment and seach around for his victim, then start it back up when it felt he was near them.  Little things like that can really add to the creepy feel and it did.  He did not have his chain saw going all the time and when he did have that thing revved up well... hahahha read on.Gore Meter.  10 Stars!  Oh wait.. It only goes up to 5 stars max.  Ok, 5 stars!!  The blood, gore is very extream in this film! While some horror films show the action and then leave a lot to your imagination, this film goes the other way in a big way!  Just remember if you watch this, it's fake blood and people are not really being killed.  You will have to say that to yourself a few times to get through this.  I don't like to give much details away when I do a review.  Let's just put it this way.  Most all horror films don't even come close to the gore level that you will see when watching this.  If you have a weak stomach, AVOID this movie. Personally I LOVED all the blood and gore.  In this film it just came together very well.Profanity Meter. 5 Strikes.  I can deal with gore, I can handle a creepy movie and thats fine.  I was dissapointed that the profanity is also very extream.  I just personally find profanity to actually take away from a film. Lucky for me I have a DVD system that cuts out language and it was working overtime when I played this.Sexual Meter:  1 Strikes.  Nothing sexual in this film, just a ton of violence and gore.Final thoughts:  This film does what it was meant to.  It explains things very well and it is not a comfortable film to watch.  With that said, overall I was very pleased with how well this was made.  There are a few setbacks that I named above but I really overall loved this film.  If you want a to watch a horror film that will freak you out and does not hold back the brutal violence, this IS the film to watch.  I have to say, I really hope there IS another Chainsaw film in the future.  I love  this film, and I can't get enough of the Hewitt Family!!  Leatherface! Keep that chainsaw warm and I hope you return to the big screen again soon!!!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2007

reviewDescription: Many viewers found The Texas Chainsaw Massacre (2003) to be needlessly mean shock cinema. But I always found it truly appropriate for the inherently cruel story and characters. They were meant to be insidious psychopathic cannibals, right? So following in the same shocking vein, this prequel opens with a viscerally graphic birth scene complete with a slimy animatronic fetus on the floor of a slaughterhouse. That visual alone ought to inform you if this film is for you. Clearly, it’s trying to push the limits of the 2003 reboot.The unsightly baby is rescued from an offal dumpster and taken to the old Hewitt house; the opening credit sequence is littered with visuals of lacerated flesh and the sounds of wet chunks of meat being squeezed between fingers; and the language describing Thomas “Leatherface” Hewitt (Andrew Bryniarski; The Texas Chainsaw Massacre, Mother’s Day) is not just culturally insensitive, but brutal.In current day 1969 two twenty-something couples are driving across the country. After a car accident, Bailey (Diora Baird; Night of the Demons, 30 Days of Night: Dark Days), Chrissie (Jordana Brewster; The Faculty), Eric (Matt Bomer; American Horror Story, The Sinner) and Dean (Taylor Handley; Bird Box) are picked up by the sheriff and taken to his home. A glowing example of psychopathy, “Sheriff Hoyt” (R. Lee Ermey; The Texas Chainsaw Massacre, The Rift, The Frighteners, Up from the Depths, The Watch) takes every opportunity to rattle our senses as the most vile entity we meet in this story. Leatherface is an animal, but Hoyt is a true monster.The pacing is strong. True to its 2003 and 1974 source material, this movie’s violence is jarringly abrupt and abundant. From roadkilled cow and dispatched bikers, to hammer homicide and peeling off entire faces, the action starts right away and takes few breaks from shocking us. For example, Leatherface’s hammer game is strong in this movie! Not since Annie Wilkes in Misery (1990) have I seen someone so brutally hobbled, making bone meal out of a poor guy’s knees.This Leatherface is also among the grossest (although not so perverted as in The Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2), with a degenerative skin disease and his arms seem perpetually discolored in dry oxidized blood. He’s always sweaty, he’s always filthy, and his presence feels the most menacing of any TCM film (1974-2017).We see heads get blown apart, horrendous beatings, someone getting chainsawed in half, legs are amputated on screen, and skin get flayed before our eyes. We also enjoy (I think) the most chainsaw deaths and attacks of the entire franchise from originals to reboots. Personally, I’d say director Jonathan Liebesman (Darkness Falls, Battle Los Angeles, Wrath of the Titans) did well by TCM fans, and his amped up brutality really just seems to follow the trend in TCM movies leading up to this.This movie is a blast for gorehounds! I haven’t seen 2003 recently enough to say for sure, but this and 1986 might just be my two favorite TCM movies.
reviewTitle: Incredibly gory, abruptly brutal, and unrelenting in its indecency. My favorite Leatherface, too!

reviewDescription: Absolutely life changing.From the moment the opening scene lit up the screen, I knew The Minecraft Movie was going to be something truly special. As a longtime fan of the game, I went in with high hopes—but what I experienced was beyond anything I could have imagined. This film isn’t just a video game adaptation; it’s a love letter to the creativity, adventure, and endless possibilities that Minecraft represents. It’s a thrilling, heartwarming, and visually stunning journey that captures the essence of the game while telling a story that resonates with both die-hard fans and newcomers alike.A Faithful Yet Fresh Take on the Minecraft UniverseOne of my biggest worries was whether the movie would stay true to the spirit of Minecraft while still offering something new. I’m thrilled to say it absolutely does! The world-building is phenomenal—every blocky tree, every creeper lurking in the shadows, every sprawling biome feels like it was pulled straight from the game, yet expanded in ways that make the universe feel alive. The attention to detail is astounding, from the iconic sound effects (that "ssss" still terrifies me) to the way characters craft tools and build structures in real-time.The story is a perfect blend of adventure, humor, and emotion. Without spoiling anything, it follows a group of unlikely heroes—some familiar faces and some new—as they embark on an epic quest to save their world from a looming threat. The pacing is fantastic, balancing intense action sequences with quieter, heartfelt moments that give the characters real depth. And yes, there are plenty of Easter eggs and references that will have fans grinning from ear to ear.Stellar Voice Acting and Characters You’ll LoveThe casting is spot-on. Every voice actor brings their character to life with so much personality and charm. Steve (played by an incredibly talented actor) is everything we hoped for—stoic yet expressive, brave yet relatable. The supporting cast, including a hilarious parrot sidekick and a surprisingly complex villain, adds so much flavor to the story. Even the mobs—zombies, skeletons, and of course, the ever-menacing Ender Dragon—are given moments to shine in ways that feel fresh and exciting.Visual Spectacle – Blocky Beauty Brought to LifeThe animation style is a perfect marriage of Minecraft’s signature blocky aesthetic and cinematic polish. The way light filters through leaves, water flows dynamically, and explosions send blocks flying is nothing short of breathtaking. The action sequences are fluid and exhilarating, especially a climactic battle that had me on the edge of my seat. And the Nether and End dimensions? Absolutely stunning—vibrant, dangerous, and full of surprises.A Soundtrack That Hits All the Right NotesThe music is a beautiful mix of nostalgic Minecraft melodies and sweeping orchestral pieces that elevate every scene. Hearing those iconic C418-inspired tunes reimagined with a full cinematic score gave me chills. The sound design, from the clinking of pickaxes to the roar of the Ender Dragon, is immersive and perfectly craftedI am steveChicken JockeyFlint and Steel!THE NETHERThis is a CRAFTING TABLEthey love CRUSHING A LOAFtheyre the VILLAGERSwater bucket RELEASEsteves LAVA CHICKENender PEARLdiamond armor FULL SETas a child I yearned for the minesI am placing blocks and sh

reviewDescription: I didn’t expect much from the movie, but after watching it, it truly changed my perspective on life.The theater almost burned down after "CHICKEN JOCKEY" came up.And after every Good part came up, such as "I am Steve" the whole theater was so loud, people cheering and screaming.After the movie the whole theater was so messy, people were throwing full giant Pepsi across the theater saying "Ender pearl", and during chicken jockey I could not see one person who did not get up from there seat, scream, and throw a whole bag of large popcorn in the air.  Before the movie there was this kid who said, when I say flint you say steel, not one person failed on that request. Honestly I wish more movies had this amazing interaction in the theaters, and at home will not be the same but still it will be a wonderful movie for a date night. I had a friend who brought his girl to the movie theater and shared popcorn with her. And I sat by my huzz to. Honestly my future children will know the date of April 4th, 2025, truly a date to remember. I wish we could all get dementia and watch the movie all over again.  But there was only 3 sad parts in the movie I have to let you guys know about. First, when pink sheep died, honestly a 5 year old three seats down almost broke down, could not blame him, you could see the zombies tearing at. RIP. Next was when Steve was saying goodbye to Dennis. Honestly such an amazing sad moment. Beautiful amazing song by Steve in that. Finally the ending of the movie. After the movie, we all stayed late, and the employees were getting pissed at us. Also another great part was Steve's lava chicken song, made a tear roll out of my eye.

reviewDescription: #MovieReview#AMinecraftMovie🍿 (Out of 5)OMG – what a waste of money. As a fan of the game itself – they could have done so much more with this movie than they did. Two dimensional characters, ridiculous story and just plain dull overall. Why?Directed by Jared Hess just leaned on the bad story too much. Too many cooks in the kitchen syndrome because the screenplay was written by Chris Bowman, Hubbel Palmer, Neil Widener, Gavin James and Chris Galletta (from a story by Allison Schroeder, Chris Bowman and Palmer). It was nothing new, nothing fun or nothing really interesting but they could have done so much more in this wonderful classic game universe.What is the story? A mysterious portal pulls four cardboard-performing misfits into the Overworld, a bizarre, cubic wonderland that thrives on imagination. To get back home, they'll have to master the terrain while embarking on a magical quest with an unexpected crafter named Steve. All the attacks, saves and rescues are so unoriginal and predictable. Yawn.Jason Momoa is flecking every 5 minutes. Jack Black is singing and Jack-Blacking’ every 5 minutes. Danielle Brooks, Emma Myers and Sebastian Hansen are doing their best. And even Jennifer Coollidge was trying hard to be funny and actually was.The film is completed CG’d and the cinematography by Enrique Chediak is colorful and the editing by James Thomas kept the film moving fast with the music by Mark Mothersbaugh getting the emotion rushes, but again, the story. Yawn.Pass on this one in the theatre. Wait for streaming if you must!Lorenzo M
reviewTitle: D for the Attempt, F for the Casting, F for the Story (B for the Visuals)

reviewDescription: As a longtime fan of Wicked, I was thrilled to get my hands on this exclusive limited-edition gift set, and it did not disappoint. The gold-tone metal bookends are beautifully crafted, capturing the essence of Elphaba’s hat and Glinda’s crown—they’re both functional and a stunning display piece. The collector’s box adds an extra touch of elegance, making this set a standout on my shelf.The 4K UHD transfer is exceptional, with vibrant colors and crisp detail that bring the magic of Oz to life. The Blu-ray and digital copies are a great addition, ensuring I can enjoy the film in various formats. The included certificate of authenticity adds a special touch, making it feel like a true collector’s item.Overall, this gift set is a fantastic tribute to the beloved musical. It’s clear that a lot of thought went into its design and presentation. If you’re a fan of Wicked or know someone who is, this set is a must-have.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2025

reviewDescription: Alright, gents, let's talk "Wicked" – the movie version, that is. As a guy who's seen the stage show, once I went in with a healthy dose of skepticism, but came out genuinely impressed. They've taken a beloved classic and given it a visually stunning, emotionally resonant cinematic makeover.First off, the world of Oz is absolutely breathtaking. They've translated the stage magic into a sprawling, vibrant spectacle. It’s like stepping into a living painting, every scene bursting with color and detail. It’s a feast for the eyes, even for those of us who usually prefer our entertainment with a bit more… explosions.The story, as always, is a masterclass in nuanced storytelling. It's not just about good versus evil; it's about friendship, acceptance, and the power of perspective. They’ve captured the heart of the show perfectly, and even added some new layers that really enhance the experience.The performances are top-notch. They’ve brought these iconic characters to life with such depth and authenticity. The chemistry between Elphaba and Glinda is electric, and their vocal performances are simply stunning. They deliver those iconic songs with power and emotion, making you feel every note.Look, I get it. Musicals aren’t everyone’s cup of tea. But "Wicked" transcends genres. It’s a story that resonates with everyone, regardless of their musical preferences. It’s about being true to yourself, even when the world tells you that you're too different. And that's a message that everyone can get behind.They've done justice to the source material, and they’ve created a film that’s both entertaining and thought-provoking. It's a movie that you can enjoy with your friends, your family, or even by yourself. It’s a feel-good experience that leaves you with a smile on your face and a song in your heart. Trust me, even if you’re a die-hard action fan, you’ll find something to love in "Wicked." It’s a magical journey that’s definitely worth taking.

reviewDescription: Alright loves, time for an honest review on Wicked - the movie:I started loving Wicked as a child, seeing it on Broadway for the first time in 2005. As a little girl, no older than 4, the colors and singing reeled me into a life long love for the play — of course, nothing can make it better than the orginal cast. The next year, I was gifted the Wizard of Oz movie and of course Ruby slippers (because what 5 year old can go without), allowing me to further grow my love of the Oz world. Seeing the play again in 2013, I feel in love with Oz as a whole.When I heard in 2015 that there was talk of a movie version, I was a tad skeptical. By 2019, when I read the book version, I was very worried which way a movie version can go.With covid and working in healthcare, I looked no further into the movie until late 2022, when I heard that Ariana Grande had been casted as Glinda from a theatre friend. As a girl who grew up on Victorious and her music, I became excited for the future of the movie. Cynthia Erivio, I knew less about, only knowing her via The Greatest Showman and glimpses I saw of Harriet. By 2024, my skepticism waned, and like any Wicked enthusiast, I went to the theatre with mild unease, but came out with joy.The producers and actors/actresses were able to bring the wonders of Oz to tbe big screen. With action, color, glam, this is a must watch for all ages. It combines learning acceptance, the power of friendship, all the great teachings of the play into one. While I can admit, I’m not the world’s biggest fan of muscicals, this is one I will cherish time and time again.Even in the first few moment’s of the movie, it foreshadows the second act. Spoiler alert: I love the Easter eggs to the Wizard of Oz. With the well known songs of “Popular” and “Defying Gravity,” I felt a part of the world, especially when watching the 3d version. Who knew monkeys flying out the screen would give such a crazy jump scare? 😂But no more spoilers. I hope you and your families or friends enjoy.Please note, some parts may not be child friendly — just because I saw the play at 4 does not mean your child should. There is nothing inappropriate nor language, but it can be overwhelming and mildly violent with some more adult references.The physical DVD wise:The 4k dvd is “ehh” at best. The colors pop, but the sound vibrates every time a song plays, catching on major notes and ruining the show for me. I believe it’s just the dvd’s manufacturing, as playing the same version on MovieEverywhere does not lead to this annoying vibration/lagging. And yes, I did try three dvd player’s and multiple tv’s to verify it was not my ears — all player’s that are meant for 4k dvd’s. The non-4K DVD worked fine. If not for the DVD’s issue, I would have given 5 stars.

reviewDescription: I bought the 6-tee shirt package for $21.48 ($3.58 each).  I consider cost vs value in my 5-star review. reviewDescription: This has become my new summer go-to for just hanging around the house.  At this price, it's never going to be that one that you hold onto for 15 years until your wife gets tired of seeing it and "accidentally" destroys it or wear to that singles event at the park where you want to look like 1M$.  It is the one however, that you wear to Lowe's, mow the lawn, and don't really care if you get some random schmuz all over it or you suddenly can't find it [ask the wife if she has and look for guilty body language].They are cheap, they do shrink a bit but won't Hulk Hogan on you by accident, and reasonably comfortable.  The one suggestion is that like many red things, you'll want to run that one through the washer with other dark colors first, and probably never with the white clothes unless you think pink socks are flattering.Maybe best of all, even when you've moved onto the next set, the old ones have a second life, if not for that painting project you don't want to get all over your new ones, then for cleaning up after the dog, washing the car, or any number of other dad-activities that we don't brag about.  I think I still have one of my first ones hanging around as a stain rag.  And you won't shed a tear when it finally does come to an end because after spending $5 on it and getting $15 worth of wear and utility, it deserves to go with dignity.

reviewDescription: I recommend these T-shirts. I am 5'8" and 140", I do not like tight T-shirts so I bought a large. I am happy with it, although I am sure that a medium would have worked.I will compare the Gilden T-shirt with the Fruit of the Loom Platinum that you will see at Wal-Mart.Pro - The Gilden appears to be better built and the sizing was consistent on the two T-shirts that came in the package. The neck was smaller, without being tight. I am guessing that fabric around the neck will not wrinkle up, unlike many Fruit of the Looms. There were no loose threads, unlike many Fruit of the Loom.  Gilden has heavier fabric, which is better most of the year where I live (east Tennessee). I do not want a see-through T-shirt. Also, no one who sees me would want me wearing a see-through T-shirt.Con - The Fruit of the Loom is much softer after a first washing. I washed the Gildan T-shirt in warm water with two minutes in the dryer on Energy-Saving. Gilden has a tag which is not as good as Fruit of the Loom (no tag). I cut the tag out without any problem and now the Gilden is fine. Gilden is slightly more expensive but both brands are inexpensive.Neutral - Neither brand bleeds color. I have only washed the Gilden one time so I do not know whether it will fade. My Fruit of the Loom T-shirts fade but it takes many washes for that to occur.I hope that this review is helpful to you.Update - June 2, 2020. The Gildan T-shirts that I bought previously held up reasonably well for the money. They did not shrink. They did not fade. However, they did not get softer.  Washing was on warm and drying was three minutes on energy saver.I purchased some more Gildans to replace the ones that wore out.  I have not washed them yet. I bought Galapagos Blue and Orange in Large size. Both are 100% cotton. The necks seem smaller than the Fruit of the Loom Platinums that I own. I like that because I have a small head so I don't need a big neck. I am still 5'8" and 140 pounds and the Large is comfortable for me. A medium would probably fit me better; however,  I like a looser-fitting T-shirt.I will let you know how well the new Gildans do after washing in warm water and drying for three minutes on energy saving heat.Notably, I have some old Fruit of the Loom T-shirts (like ten years or more) which are reasonably thick, reasonably soft, and still going strong after all this time. I wish that I had bought more of them.June 10, 2020 - After one wash in warm water and three minutes in the dryer, the new Gildans did not shrink or fade. Also, the necks did not stretch. However, the T-shirts did not become softer. Therefore, three out of the four results were good and one result was neutral.September 20, 2020 - After multiple washings in warm water and three minutes in the dryer on "energy saving", the verdict is the same. Good - the T-shirts did not shrink or fade and the necks did not stretch. Bad - The T-shirts did not get any softer. One other note - the tags on the T-shirts would be very annoying to wear so I cut the tags out.November 22, 2020 - The first thing to go bad on these T-shirts has been that the necks have stretched slightly. The stretching was not terrible but it is noticeable (at least to me). Nevertheless, I would give the T-shirts 4.5 stars. They do seem a little but softer or maybe I am getting more used to them.  They do not feel scratchy to me. They have not faded or shrunk. I definitely like them much better than the ultra-thin Fruit of the Loom Platinum.November 28, 2020 -  I have purchased only Large-size Gildan T-shirts. I am very happy that the sizing has been very consistent. Gildan has much better quality control than Fruit of the Loom.March 11, 2021 - I have revised the rating to a five stars. The T-shirts have gotten soft after probably 10 - 12 washings. The necks have stretched slightly but not very much. I am picky about that so I may notice that more than most people would. I dry the T-shirts by putting them in the dryer on energy saving setting for three minutes and then laying them on a bamboo drying rack. I do NOT dry them by putting them on hangers. The T-shirts still look great with no fading. I wear them frequently and enjoy the various colors.September 16, 2021 - The T-shirts are still doing well. One note, I think that the 6.0 weight fabric is much better than the 5.3 weight fabric. I bought some 5.3 weight lime green T-shirts to try to make myself more visible when walking. The necks have sagged after four washes. They served the purpose for the summer. However, I would not buy the 5.3 ounce again. The 6.0 ounce T-shirts have maintained their shape with minimal neck sagging or crinkling.

reviewDescription: Overall, I'm pretty pleased with it. The first thing I noticed when I tried it on was how incredibly soft the fabric feels. It's made from 100% cotton, which makes it breathable and comfortable, especially for casual wear during warmer days. The material is thick, but not too heavy, giving it a nice, durable feel without being uncomfortable.The yellow color is vibrant and eye-catching, perfect for adding a pop of brightness to any outfit. Whether you're wearing it on its own or layering it, the shade definitely stands out, and I love how it adds a fun, energetic vibe to my wardrobe.However, the fit is where I had a bit of an issue. The shirt runs slightly oversized. It's not a huge problem, as the extra room can be comfortable if you’re looking for a relaxed, laid-back style. But if you prefer a more tailored, fitted look, this shirt might feel a bit too loose around the torso and sleeves. For reference, I ordered my usual size, and I found that it fit more like a large rather than a true medium.All in all, if you don’t mind a looser fit, this Gildan t-shirt is a great choice. It's soft, stylish, and perfect for everyday wear, though if you're looking for something more fitted, you might want to size down or try another style.

reviewDescription: As a longtime fan of Wicked, I was thrilled to get my hands on this exclusive limited-edition gift set, and it did not disappoint. The gold-tone metal bookends are beautifully crafted, capturing the essence of Elphaba’s hat and Glinda’s crown—they’re both functional and a stunning display piece. The collector’s box adds an extra touch of elegance, making this set a standout on my shelf.The 4K UHD transfer is exceptional, with vibrant colors and crisp detail that bring the magic of Oz to life. The Blu-ray and digital copies are a great addition, ensuring I can enjoy the film in various formats. The included certificate of authenticity adds a special touch, making it feel like a true collector’s item.Overall, this gift set is a fantastic tribute to the beloved musical. It’s clear that a lot of thought went into its design and presentation. If you’re a fan of Wicked or know someone who is, this set is a must-have.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2025

reviewDescription: Alright, gents, let's talk "Wicked" – the movie version, that is. As a guy who's seen the stage show, once I went in with a healthy dose of skepticism, but came out genuinely impressed. They've taken a beloved classic and given it a visually stunning, emotionally resonant cinematic makeover.First off, the world of Oz is absolutely breathtaking. They've translated the stage magic into a sprawling, vibrant spectacle. It’s like stepping into a living painting, every scene bursting with color and detail. It’s a feast for the eyes, even for those of us who usually prefer our entertainment with a bit more… explosions.The story, as always, is a masterclass in nuanced storytelling. It's not just about good versus evil; it's about friendship, acceptance, and the power of perspective. They’ve captured the heart of the show perfectly, and even added some new layers that really enhance the experience.The performances are top-notch. They’ve brought these iconic characters to life with such depth and authenticity. The chemistry between Elphaba and Glinda is electric, and their vocal performances are simply stunning. They deliver those iconic songs with power and emotion, making you feel every note.Look, I get it. Musicals aren’t everyone’s cup of tea. But "Wicked" transcends genres. It’s a story that resonates with everyone, regardless of their musical preferences. It’s about being true to yourself, even when the world tells you that you're too different. And that's a message that everyone can get behind.They've done justice to the source material, and they’ve created a film that’s both entertaining and thought-provoking. It's a movie that you can enjoy with your friends, your family, or even by yourself. It’s a feel-good experience that leaves you with a smile on your face and a song in your heart. Trust me, even if you’re a die-hard action fan, you’ll find something to love in "Wicked." It’s a magical journey that’s definitely worth taking.
reviewTitle: Visually amazing, and the songs were good, too
