reviewDescription: Alright loves, time for an honest review on Wicked - the movie:I started loving Wicked as a child, seeing it on Broadway for the first time in 2005. As a little girl, no older than 4, the colors and singing reeled me into a life long love for the play — of course, nothing can make it better than the orginal cast. The next year, I was gifted the Wizard of Oz movie and of course Ruby slippers (because what 5 year old can go without), allowing me to further grow my love of the Oz world. Seeing the play again in 2013, I feel in love with Oz as a whole.When I heard in 2015 that there was talk of a movie version, I was a tad skeptical. By 2019, when I read the book version, I was very worried which way a movie version can go.With covid and working in healthcare, I looked no further into the movie until late 2022, when I heard that Ariana Grande had been casted as Glinda from a theatre friend. As a girl who grew up on Victorious and her music, I became excited for the future of the movie. Cynthia Erivio, I knew less about, only knowing her via The Greatest Showman and glimpses I saw of Harriet. By 2024, my skepticism waned, and like any Wicked enthusiast, I went to the theatre with mild unease, but came out with joy.The producers and actors/actresses were able to bring the wonders of Oz to tbe big screen. With action, color, glam, this is a must watch for all ages. It combines learning acceptance, the power of friendship, all the great teachings of the play into one. While I can admit, I’m not the world’s biggest fan of muscicals, this is one I will cherish time and time again.Even in the first few moment’s of the movie, it foreshadows the second act. Spoiler alert: I love the Easter eggs to the Wizard of Oz. With the well known songs of “Popular” and “Defying Gravity,” I felt a part of the world, especially when watching the 3d version. Who knew monkeys flying out the screen would give such a crazy jump scare? 😂But no more spoilers. I hope you and your families or friends enjoy.Please note, some parts may not be child friendly — just because I saw the play at 4 does not mean your child should. There is nothing inappropriate nor language, but it can be overwhelming and mildly violent with some more adult references.The physical DVD wise:The 4k dvd is “ehh” at best. The colors pop, but the sound vibrates every time a song plays, catching on major notes and ruining the show for me. I believe it’s just the dvd’s manufacturing, as playing the same version on MovieEverywhere does not lead to this annoying vibration/lagging. And yes, I did try three dvd player’s and multiple tv’s to verify it was not my ears — all player’s that are meant for 4k dvd’s. The non-4K DVD worked fine. If not for the DVD’s issue, I would have given 5 stars.
reviewTitle: A One in a Million Masterpiece 🥰

reviewDescription: I'm pleasantly surprised with this vest, my first foray into weighted vests. I've only had it for several days, so I can't comment on the durability. There was an initial strong odor of plastic or something similar, but that's going away. The odor wasn't overwhelming, but certainly noticeable. I've only used it during walks and yard work as I'm recovering from an injury and can't run yet, so not sure how it will do when I'm more active. I'm 6'4" with a 44 inch chest and it fit comfortably with a few inches to spare in the strap. I bought the 12lb which I think is a good starter, but I may get a heavier one in the future. There are vests that look to be higher quality and more versatile, but they can be 10x the price of this vest. So for the cost, I'm happy with it.

reviewDescription: I purchased this 12 pd weighted vest to use on my daily walks. I am an older woman who would like to benefit from a little extra help. However, I put this one on and it fit just right with a little adjustment so I would say that it fits a variety of different body styles when you pick up a 12 pound weighted vest it feels heavy but when you put a 12 pound weighted vest on it feels great. I took a walk and it was a little extra effort to get through my 2 1/2 miles however, I know my core and body are going to benefit from this. reviewDescription: I bought the 12 lb weighted vest because all the perimenopause influencers are doing it—and honestly? I'm glad I joined the club.It’s perfect for adding intensity to slower walks (especially since one of my dogs has an injury and strolls like he’s on vacation). The front pocket fits my phone and my pepper spray (which I’ve thankfully never needed), so I can skip the fanny pack when wearing pocketless shorts. Small joy, big win.Does it make me look like I’m skydiving into suburbia? According to my brother’s wife—yes. She calls it my parachute. But as a proud member of the We Do Not Care Club, I just tell them that this is peak middle-aged woman fitness. 💁‍♀️No dramatic weight loss claims here, but it definitely makes my core work harder—even on easy walks. One star off because it had a bit of a smell when I first opened it (took about a week to fade), but otherwise it’s fantastic.If you're on the fence: Just do it. reviewDescription: I bought the 20 lb version three months ago and have used it several time a week since then.  I am walking briskly 3-4 miles. reviewDescription: I bought the 20-lb version and will probably purchase a 25- and/or 30-lb soon as my body adjusts to this weight. It’s already strengthening my bum knee after my second hill session. Glad I purchased some cushiony shoes beforehand to avoid jarring my joints with this heavier vest. Fits comfortably. I am more inclined to get the single weight varieties rather than the adjustable weight one after reading reviews. I prefer the way the single-weight vests sit higher on the back. Yes, the vest had a chemical odor out of the box, but I didn’t notice it during my two hikes so far. I cannot yet speak to the durability. I like that this one has two adjustable clamps which keep the vest from sliding around. Easy enough for me to put on and take off, plus I can wear my small shoulder strap mini purse to carry my phone and other items right over the vest without complication. I haven’t used the included practical phone case yet, since it wouldn’t fit all the gear I prefer to bring along in my purse, but I did verify that it would snugly fit my iPhone 16 Pro Max, a key and a credit card.  Overall great tool for upping the intensity of my daily hikes--highly recommended!

reviewDescription: I bought these in Rose Gold 10 Wide back in 2023 these sandals are a perfect fit true to size and width. I have worn them pretty much nonstop and they only get better. I always buy at least 2 new pairs of sandals every year to replace or upgrade my sandals because I practically live in them but honestly my news ones for 2024 & 2025 are still in their original boxes because I keep coming back to these. I look faithful monthly to see if these Rose Gold ones are back in stock so I can rebuy them but I can't seem to find them being back in stock, please help a girl out and get these back in stock. I can tell you if they come back in stock I am buying at least 2 pairs immediately because I don't want to be without these sandals. I am pleading to the owners of this company/ brand please get this back in stock it's obvious it's a best seller considering I have been looking to repurchase for 2 years now.Thank you,Brenda Hanlon

reviewDescription: Just received these today and slipped them on - holy moly!!! After trying on Birkenstocks and wondering why the heck people say they are comfortable (they are NOT- at least not in the store- the footbed was hard and awkward), I found these dupes for a fraction of the price and the reviews were great. I am SO IMPRESSED with how comfy they are right out of the box! I typically wear a 7.5-8 in sandals and the 8 fits perfectly. I love how they fit and that I can adjust the buckle closest to my ankle for a more secure fit. I am planning to "break these in" over the next month with the hopes of wearing them during my European vacation this summer. These will look great with shorts, jeans, dresses, everything!! Great buy!!

reviewDescription: They look pretty good. I got the rose colored ones and they are pretty. Look-wise, I can tell the straps are different than my Birkenstocks, but it doesn't bother me. I do worry about how well the straps will wear over time, but they look great brand new out of the box. I held them up side by side to my 10-year-old pair of Birkenstocks. Overall, they look great and almost identical, except the arch support isn't as great. That is a disappointment for me. But I'm going to keep them and see how it goes. The extra cushioning is a nice addition, as my Birkenstocks don't have that. If the company is reading this, more arch support (and that they last fairly well) would make me a regular customer.

reviewDescription: Oh boy, let me tell you about my wild adventure with Happy Belly Medium Dark Roast Coffee Pods, House Blend! Strap in for a hilarious ride as I recount my personal experiences with this coffee that left me laughing and craving for more.First things first, let's talk about the packaging. The moment I received my delivery, the bright and cheerful design caught my attention. It practically screamed, "Wake up and smell the coffee!" It definitely set the tone for the delightful experience I was about to have.As I eagerly unwrapped the package, I couldn't help but notice the distinct aroma escaping from the sealed box. It was like a coffee lover's dream come true. The fragrant blend of beans promised a flavor-packed journey, and I was ready to embark on it.With my Keurig 2.0 K-Cup Brewer ready to go, I popped in one of the Happy Belly coffee pods and hit the brew button. As the machine hummed to life, I found myself grinning with anticipation. And boy, oh boy, did it deliver!The first sip was like a gentle wake-up call from a mischievous alarm clock. The medium dark roast offered a perfect balance of robustness and smoothness. It danced on my taste buds, leaving me pleasantly surprised. I could taste the hints of chocolate and nuts that added a touch of sophistication to the blend. This house blend was a true crowd-pleaser, sure to satisfy even the pickiest coffee connoisseurs.Now, let me take you on a hilarious detour. One morning, in my pre-caffeinated haze, I accidentally brewed two pods in one cup. To my surprise, it created a supercharged coffee experience that sent me into a fit of laughter. The richness of the medium dark roast was amplified, creating a cup of coffee that could wake up even the sleepiest of souls. Who knew a simple mistake could turn into such a caffeinated adventure?Speaking of adventures, let's talk about the convenience of these coffee pods. The compatibility with Keurig 2.0 K-Cup Brewers made it a breeze to enjoy a fresh cup of coffee anytime. Whether I was rushing to work or lounging on a lazy Sunday morning, Happy Belly was there to save the day. No more measuring, grinding, or brewing dilemmas—just pop in a pod and voila! Coffee bliss was at my fingertips.Now, I must mention the exceptional value this 100-count box offers. With each pod carefully packed, I never had to worry about running out of my favorite brew. It kept me caffeinated through countless mornings, and even provided enough for the occasional office coffee run. Happy Belly truly understands the needs of coffee enthusiasts who crave quality and quantity.As a coffee lover, I've tried my fair share of brands, but Happy Belly Medium Dark Roast Coffee Pods, House Blend stands out from the crowd. The laughter it brought into my mornings was the cherry on top of an already delicious cup of joe. It offers a rich, balanced flavor that tickles the taste buds, leaving you eager for the next sip.To sum it up, Happy Belly's coffee pods are a must-have for any coffee enthusiast. The quality, convenience, and value are unmatched, and the flavor will leave you grinning like a caffeinated Cheshire cat. So, grab a cup, sit back, and let the Happy Belly experience take you on a hilarious and delicious journey you won't soon forget!In conclusion, Happy Belly Medium Dark Roast Coffee Pods, House Blend deserves a resounding five out of five stars for its exceptional taste, convenience, and the laughter it brings to your mornings. Don't miss out on this comedic and flavorful coffee adventure!

reviewDescription: My 2 boxes of Amazon Brand - Happy Belly Coffee Pods - 100 count just came, and I'm drinking my 1st cup (of it, not cups total for the day - though I'm trying to not go above 3 cups daily). I'm having it like I do most, which is 10 ounces of brewed water, a splash of cold water, 2% milk, Walmart French Vanilla creamer, and Hershey's Simply 5 chocolate syrup - which is their most expensive choice, as it doesn't use high fructose corn syrup. It tastes fine - but I'm NOT a finicky coffee drinker. I just try to buy and drink those pods I like to some degree, (not bitter) and is relatively inexpensive at .25 - .30 cents each. This meets those lax standards. Of course, if you're willing to pay 2 to 4 times that, (.50 to $1.00) you can get some very addictive coffee pods made by Starbuck's! My other habit is to buy cheap coffee in the can, and add some flavored coffee to it, and brew in a reusable pod w/ 12 ounces of water (a large cup). Those can get the cost down to about .15 cents for a large cup, before creamer, and (many claim) is better for the environment. When buying Amazon's brand, note that you have to make sure you're making a one-time purchase, and not regularly, through their Subscribe and Save (unless you want that, as the price is slightly lower). Apparently, I clicked that radio button once, to see the cost, didn't change it back, and didn't buy any whatsoever. But at some point I did save it the Save for Later Cart. Online days later, when I went to buy it, it had kept the subscription choice from days prior, and I noticed it just before purchasing.
reviewTitle: Price varies - maybe several times a day?

reviewDescription: First, let me say that I don't usually write reviews on my purchases.  I purchase quite a lot, even weekly, from Amazon.  But when I come across a product that is unusually bad or unusually good, I want to tell others.I'm a coffee afficionado.  I love my coffee.  I can't imagine a day without it.  I've bought more brands, different roasts, both ground and whole beans, and of course, KCups. I don't have a Keurig but I have a generic coffeemaker that can use KCups.  These cups work perfectly in my no name coffeemaker.Now for the coffee itself.  I didn't have high expectations for this coffee.  First, it's not a name brand.  Happy Belly?  Makes me laugh!  Next, the coffee was quite a bit cheaper than what I usually buy.  But I took the chance on this coffee and boy, I'm glad I did!I got the Dark Roast coffee.  The scent of this coffee brewing is only a hint of what's to come.  I always have my coffee with creamer and sweetener and I did the same with this coffee.  This dark roast coffee is full bodied, just strong enough and not a bit of bitterness.If you're always on the search for that perfect coffee without breaking the bank, give Happy Belly a try.  I have to say I'm very pleased with this coffee and I'm certainly going to try some of the other varieties.

reviewDescription: The Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells ARE SOLD AS A PAIR!I purchased these 12LB PAIR Neoprene Amazon Basics Dumbbells on Wednesday December 27th, 2023 and they arrived today on Tuesday January 2nd, 2023. They would have got here 3 days earlier but there was a few days delay due to the weather I am guessing.I am pretty pleased with this purchase. These 12LB Pair Neoprene Amazon Basics Dumbbells are at a VERY affordable price in comparison to other weights around the internet. That must explain why these Amazon Basics Neoprene Pair Dumbbells have over 90,000 reviews averaging 4.8 stars out of 5 stars. These Amazon Basics Neoprene Pair Dumbbells truly are… the only value for your money online I would say. The quality seems to be there too. I would say… these are a GREAT purchase!The Black color Neoprene is… Black; the color is true. The Neoprene provides a comfortable grip for those people with softer hands and for people with rougher hands as well.I do not have a weight scale (I apologize everyone). So I am unable to verify the EXACT weight of both of these 12LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells. But I will say this… I am 32 years young, played football, served Active Duty in the U.S. ARMY, I am 5’9 and weigh in between 225-240lbs (around 215lbs during my time in the U.S. ARMY) and I have been strength training since I was 16 years old CONSISTENTLY and TRULY (I Love training). I have Benched  Pressed 335lbs, Deadlifted 455lbs for 3 reps, Squatted 655lbs, Dumbbell Pressed the 140lb Dumbbells, Leg Pressed 1,000lbs maybe a little more, and I have curled a little over 140lbs on the curl bar (two 45 plates one on each side and two 25lb plates one on each side). So I have some credibility in judging weights on how they feel without a scale. And I can truly say that these 12LB Pair Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells do feel around (if not true) to 12LBS. Because I was using 10LB Neoprene Dumbbells from Reebok for MONTHS! And I CAN FEEL THE SLIGHT WEIGHT INCREASE in comparison to the previous Reebok 10LB Neoprene Dumbbells; especially when I am doing light at home shoulder work (train shoulders safely for good health and longevity muscles break quicker than iron most times). And these Amazon Basics 12LB Neoprene Dumbbells feel GREAT and I really like them! I have the 20LB Pair Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells coming tomorrow (Wednesday January 3rd, 2023) I placed that order on Friday December 29th, 2023 and those ran out of stock and I am getting those this fast and quickly! -Impressive! So when they have these in stock, they come quickly! -AND FOR A GREAT TRULY UNBEATABLE PRICE! So purchase them while you are able to. If you want them, purchase them quick because they might be temporarily out of stock. But Amazon restocks them fairly quickly. As you can see from my review details on when I placed the order for mine and received mine in about one week timeframe. And that was with delays like: weather, and being temporarily out of stock.On to the size and how they feel in your hands (depending on hand size). I have fairly larger hands; almost 8 inches tall from my wrist, to the tip of my middle finger. And with my hands spread wide open, my hands measure 9 inches from the end of my thumbs, to the end of my pinky fingers. And when I grip these 12LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells I have a snug grip. These 12LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells in comparison to the 10LB Reebok Dumbbells that I was using are… “stubbier” I would say in comparison to the 10LB Reebok Dumbbells I was previously using (I purchased these Amazon Basics ones because they are an exact matching pair the Reebok ones were a mismatch). -BUT! Even though these 12LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells are… “stubbier,” in comparison to the previous mismatched 10LB Reebok Dumbbells I was using. I still REALLY like these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells because they fill my hands, and there is no wasted space in between my hands and the handle of the 12LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells. -AND… the Amazon Basics ones match! So now I have EXACT weight distribution instead of constantly switching hands to even out the weight distribution in each arm due to the Reebok ones being a 10LB mismatch (their shape is different got mixed up sometime in the past). These 12LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells are: compact, and they feel AT ONE with my body. There is no “slack” in the feeling when I use these 12LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbell’s.The hexagon pattern in these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells are very nice as you would expect, and they stack very well when you store them after your workout. They can also make a good transportable dumbbells to workout with if you are road tripping somewhere and you want to have the opportunity to get in a quick workout, you can throw these in a duffle bag (a sturdy one) and take them with you somewhere to workout when you want to. I’m unsure about taking them with you on an airline; you may have to call the airlines for that clarification so you don’t risk getting them possibly confiscated, but if you are driving and you want to take these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells with you, you can do that!The white “12LB” labeling on these Black Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells (the 12LB versions) are easy to identify due to the good use of color contrast; the white colored numbering “12LB” on these Black Amazon Basics 12LB Dumbbells are easy to identify… and… that was redundant.As for the durability of these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells, I am confident; and I think you will feel confident that these will be able to withstand normal use in your workouts. And if you drop your weights (although safely controlling the weight down is a far wiser option) I am confident and you will feel confident that these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells WILL HOLD in the durability department.Thank You for reading my review of these GREAT VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells (PAIR)!Now if you will excuse me, I am going to workout with these now… and if you’re thinking about making the purchase as I was, I am confident that you will be satisfied and find value in your purchase so you can train better and more effectively and efficiently.Thank You again for reading my review of the Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells (PAIR)! God Bless You.UPDATE: Hi people! Today is Wednesday January 3rd, 2024 and I just received my Green 20LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Pair Dumbbells! THEY ARE SOLD AS A PAIR! And as I Love the 12LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells I also LOVE these 20LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells! THEY ARE SOLD AS A PAIR! And at a VERY AFFORDABLE PRICE! And the quality is FANTASTIC! Mine came with a slight scuff mark from something before I purchased and received it as my own; whatever that was.But I Love these 20LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells! They are Big compared to the other smaller Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells; not overly big, just… 20LBS big! They feel very nice in my larger hands I have nice comfortable room to grab onto and fill my hands. They stack very nice in place and won’t take up alot of room depending on how you stack and store them before your next workout / training session.I like how these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells have a underline that goes underneath the numbers so you don’t get confused if you are lifting 6 or 9 pound dumbbells. So I really appreciate Amazon putting that white underline underneath the numbers so you don’t get confused trying to identify if your 6 pound dumbbell is a 9 pound dumbbell and vice versa. I really like how clearly labeled the weight is on these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbell Pairs are. They are exactly like this: 12LB, 15LB, 20LB, etc: it makes identifying your weights alot easier and faster.I only intended to “just” get the 12LB Pair Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells. But… I like them so much because they are sold as a pair and that the price is SO AFFORDABLE I got the 20LB ones… and after I just received my 20LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells today (Wednesday January 3rd, 2024)… I went and just bought the 15LB pair as well for my at home shoulder training workouts and training sessions.Overall these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells are a GREAT BUY! DO NOT WAIT! BUY THEM IF YOU ARE THINKING ABOUT IT! Because after you shop around these Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells are a GREAT DEAL! Very affordable in comparison to just 1 dumbbell from another place you might shop around for. And plus… the reviews and very high ratings speak for themselves.UPDATE: Hi everyone! I am writing this update today (Tuesday January 9th, 2024). I received my 15LB Pair Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells yesterday (Monday January 8th, 2024) and they arrived with the scheduled arrival time (Between 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM). And They are great! I like them. I don’t have a scale so I am unable to provide the exact weight to see if they are exactly 15LBS but they feel it though.These 15LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells I received are… “the most defective” out of the 3 Pairs I received. Very minor though, and I am going to share with you all what those 2 minor things are: The first minor defect is there are a few very tiny Neoprene holes that didn’t get filled in. You wouldn’t notice though unless you VERY CLOSELY inspected the product as I did. And the second minor defect I… “felt” was that one of the 15LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells in the handle has a… oval shaped feel, rather than a full round handle shape feel as all of my other Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells do. And that’s all. Still a good valuable purchase though. I’m not trippin too hard about it but I wanted to point those out to you.I already threw the box away, and I don’t feel like exchanging them for a NEW set of 15LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells. Who knows… maybe I should though since I am using these as a long term investment. Maybe I should just make it perfect. We’ll see.Other than that the hexagon shaped pattern is perfect! The grip feels good, I have a little more space innthe handle with the 15LB Amazon Basics Neoprene Dumbbells kind of like the 20LB pair. Now I am straight for training, lifting, and exercising during the winter with good, safe, full, complete shoulder workouts and more during this cold season.

reviewDescription: I wasn’t sure what to expect when I ordered these, but they’ve totally exceeded my expectations. I have a 7-year-old and 2-year-old twins, and I was amazed that these goggles fit all three of them so well. The adjustable straps make it super easy to get the right fit, and they actually stay in place without leaking or slipping off, even with all the splashing and jumping around.One of the best features for me as a parent is the snap clasp in the back. It makes putting them on and taking them off so much easier—no more tugging them over their heads or accidentally pulling anyone’s hair. The kids love that part too. The goggles themselves are clear, don’t fog up, and seem really well made. We've used them several times now, and they still look and work like new.Overall, I’m really happy with this purchase. It’s hard to find one product that works for multiple ages, but these nailed it. Highly recommend for any parent looking for reliable, kid-friendly swim goggles!

reviewDescription: I'm not a super meat head muscle workout guy, but I went from being very active about my nutrition and macros and then had an accident which left me disabled so my needs changed. This fits different needs, but is still really really exceptional.If you're a gym rat just looking for *only* plain old bulk protein to take after workouts, or you reeeeeeallly take a lot of it, honestly I'd get a big giant tub of bulk powder from like muscle milk or optimum nutrition. The price is just too good to ignore, & plus you can add another scoop or two to double or triple the protein. You can't really beat it, other than taste.Speaking of taste, whether it's a pre-mix or powders, I've never, ever ever ever tasted a protein shake that tasted as good as this chocolate one. Dozens & dozens of brands over the decades, & the only one that comes close was the OG Muscle Milk recipe in the old tetra packs from like 15-20 years ago, before they were bought by Gatorade or whoever. This has NO right tasting as good as it does, with as little sugar, calories, & fat. PLUS having artificial sweeteners like stevia & sucralose. One reason I despise pre-made shakes, zero calorie & low sugar drinks is because I have a very strong detection of artificial sweeteners, but I can barely tell these are there. On top of that, 42 grams of protein in 14floz? I don't know what magic Fairlife did, but it's incredible.One thing I will say though, is if you're taking a protein drink for pretty much anything other than supplemental protein replacement, this doesn't offer too much else. The "vitamins & minerals" aren't too impressive, and though a high protein drink can make you feel full or satiated, calories & fat are important too. As stereotyped it is, something like Ensure has a really good blend of calories, fat, sugar, and a lot of vitamins. There is a reason it's used all over hospitals & nursing homes. Plus the Ensure "Plus" & "Complete" have 16g & 30g protein each, respectively. They don't taste as good as the Fairlife does, but they're actually not too bad, since they use actual sugar. However, those really are meant for convalescing & true meal replacement, not bulking & training.The only other downside is price really, at $40-45 for a 12 pack, these aren't cheap. However, when compared to a good alternative like optimum gold at about $25 for a 12 pack, you're getting almost double the protein in each drink from 24 to 42, and they're 14oz instead of 11oz, so you're getting 168oz compared to 132oz, which is like getting 3 more drinks worth. It's still a bit costly per bottle, as an Optimum Nutrition/Pure Protein/Premier Protein 11oz pre-made at $25 a 12pk will be a little over $2 each, & the Fairlife 12pk @ $45 is about $3.75 each. Still cheaper than if you went to pick one up at the gym or a gas station or something, a single would probably be $5-7, so there's value there in bulk. If it's worth it to you, that's up to your wallet.Another plus is they are SNAP/EBT eligible, so that's a massive W.If you take loads & loads & loads of protein every single day, and lugging a shaker with powder around isn't a problem, bulk powder is gonna be a LOT cheaper. However, if you only drink one every couple days, and don't want to deal with the blender/shaker hassle, and most importantly want the best tasting shake, this is it. This stuff is awesome, & I'll 1000% be trying the vanilla and strawberry as well. The chocolate is an easy 5 and worth trying.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2025

reviewDescription: Trying to up my protein. I turned 34 this year and realized I didn't have a ton of the energy I did before turning 30. Of course that's natural, but there's still plenty you can do in your 30s onward to stay in great shape, and that's upping that protein. Okay, so I gotta say, these are probably the best bottled protein shakes I've ever had, and I've tried a good majority of them at different price ranges. This gets to the point. You get the 42 grams of protein at a reasonable price. Sometimes I replace breakfast or lunch (or both) with one of these shakes. I have them on a subscription so I get the discount and always have them available. The sugar content is fairly low, not really at a level that concerns me. Tastes like chocolate without that weird chalky fake sugar protein taste. It's actually enjoyable to drink.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2025

reviewDescription: I can't believe this is a protein drink, it tastes so good and it's texture is creamy and smooth(no weird floating globs). Not only does it taste just like chocolate milk, but it tastes like GOOD chocolate milk. It's freaking crazy lolI actually tried the Vanilla one first, since that seems to be the crowd favorite. It was also really good, but in my opinion, it doesn't hold a candle to the chocolate. I'm blown away.I guess Fa!rlife knows what they have, so they charge a lot knowing people will buy it. But, man, I wish it were like 25-30% cheaper, because buying this stuff makes me question my financial priorities lol Fortunately I can justify paying for it because I'm using it as a lunch replacement on my diet(I drink this around noon and then eat a big dinner around 5 or 6pm). So given my lunches would normally cost anywhere from $5-10, I guess it's sort of saving me money? Sure, let's not think about the price any further and go with that :D

reviewDescription: Years ago, I swore I would never again wear an uncomfortable body shaper. But when I tried on a dress in my closet that I wanted to wear to a dinner next week, and saw panty lines, pulling and a stomach bulge, I knew I had 3 choices: lose enough weight in one week (LOL!), find a new dress, or order some shapewear. I remembered that the NY Times' Wirecutter had done a shapewear review so I found that article and decided to order the Shapermint high-waisted shaper. I ordered two sizes because I'm always surprised to find that I'm larger than I think I am, but thankfully I never even opened the larger one. I'm 5'2" and 165 lbs and the M-L fit well. I took before and after pictures, but truthfully, it was hard to see any difference in the pictures so I haven't included them with this review. BUT the important thing is that I could see a difference in the mirror and the Shapermint will allow me to feel confident while wearing the dress. Does it give me my old figure back? No, but it does smooth me out with the top of the shaper coming up to my bra line and there is no thigh bulge where the shaper ends. All this while being surprisingly comfortable!  And the price is very reasonable.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2025

reviewDescription: Fit well, held well, was comfortable for hours. It smoothed and condensed but didn’t make me feel squished in like a sausage. I was able to eat a hearty dinner after three hours of being in it and still felt fine through late into the night. Also very moveable. It wasn’t stiff at all. It has rubber (I believe that is the material) at the top and short stiff bands (similar the wire of a bra) at the top for about three inches. Not uncomfortable at all and did not poke me once. I was pleasantly surprised since I do not like wire bras for that exact reason. It did not fall or slip at all for the over six hours I wore it. I recommend!
reviewTitle: Fit well and was comfortable for hours
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2025

Overall, a win for me because they are comfortable and wearable in the summer.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2025

reviewDescription: Lots of the reviews described the product being too big when ordering the size according to the chart. The shorts fit, but they didn't really provide the support expected. On the advice of a few, I purchased a size xs/s instead of m/l like I normally do.When I looked at the shorts, I thought there was no way that I was going to be able to fit my skinny-squishy 165lb body in those itty-bitty things. But I did. And without much effort at all.  They're tight, but they're not snatching my waist like they're supposed to. Everything is smoothed out. No bulges. And I can breathe, but it didn't shape my stomach. My stomach is still pooching out like it did before. There's just smooth flub-blub now instead of multiple flub-blubs and no muffin top (which is nice).I sat down on the bed to see if it was possible to still breathe (it was) and I looked at the package. On the back of the package it says "Plus-size black small" and it now makes sense why I am able to wear it.I'm 5'11. 165lbs. All of my weight is in my stomach, hips, and thighs. I wear a size 10-12 in jeans.Plus-sized clothing is made specifically to accommodate a body type that is beautifully voluptuous. Plus-sized clothing is labeled "16W" or "16 curvy" fur example.  The W or curvy indicating that it will fit a fuller figured individual. I know there's not a small in plus-size, but I think I've figured it out nonetheless:I have a friend that wears a size 14 curvy which is another way to tell the shopper that this product is constructed differently from a size 14 regular. The curvy or the W are constructed in a way that allows a fuller figure to settle comfortably unlike the regular that would be far too tight and constricting in the waiste, knees, and calves. Anyway...I checked on Amazon and found a plus-size Shapermint, high waisted shaper shorts that can be purchased in size S-3xl. These shorts are made like the curvy or W to accommodate curves that a woman who wore a regular small would not have. I believe the seller may have accidentally shipped a plus-sized garment when the purchaser wanted a regular rather than plus. And I think that this is why some buyers are talking about sizing down while others are describing being swallowed by a boa constrictor and not being able to breathe, or move, or sit.Maybe if I had a regular small then I'd be complaining about that, too because, trust me, I may be skinny-squishy but I haven't been able to fit into a small anything since 9th grade. And that was 32 years ago. 🤷‍♀️
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023

reviewDescription: Awesome shapewear!  Got the M/L, tried it on and decided I wanted a little more compression so I ordered the S.  Came just in time, fit great, did the job, and was comfortable! reviewDescription: I drink 2 mugs of coffee to start my day. I typically have 5 - 6 kinds that I particularly like and most I brew from K-pods in my Keurig machine. Taste wise, this Solimo French Roast coffee in Kpods gets 4 stars overall , which means it is a good value, is of good quality but the strength is a little less than other French Roasts that I enjoy. Functionally, it only gets one star because more than half of the K-pods do not work at all or only a little amount of coffee gets through the pod. That leaves a very, very weak or non-coffee taste. To be fair, a few did work. I ever had this problem with any other brand of coffees I buy.  So my overrall rating is a generous 3 stars. And I can't recommend it.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2025
variant: Flavor Name: French Roast, Size: 100 Count (Pack of 1)

reviewDescription: I have to admit, I got this not expecting much from it but to hold me over as my usual go to coffee had risen in price. Love that I can order it especially during these winter months we end up snowed in, not having to risk it bc I can’t go without coffee was a huge plus. Upon receiving it I figured I’d treat myself to an extra latte to try it out. I’m in no way exaggerating when I tell you I was shocked speechless. Speechless bc I couldnt stop sipping it in disbelief of the euphoria I found with every gulp. It was so aromatic with a full body taste with ZERO bitterness and bite. It’s so hard to find a good full bodied roast without any bite these days yet it’s both strong and smooth. It reminded me somewhat of chock full o nuts brand bc it had that smooth nutty taste but not one you’d notice if you weren’t trying to grasp each note of the flavor. I usually drink Gevalia Colombian but after trying this especially bc you can’t beat it being both cheaper and better, I’ll never buy anything but. In fact I have an order on the way but got a pack of gevalia to hold me over and it was such a downgrade so I’m counting down the days for my second order to arrive, if you’re contemplating just try it. You will in no way regret it and on the plus side you’ll be saving money when coffee prices are going to continue rising. It’s the best roast I’ve tried and I’m very picky when it comes to coffee. Very simple to use you can’t go wrong. I use 2oz shot worth of water through my kcup and I do that twice so I have 4 oz from 2 kcups as the base in my latte and froth a combination of half milk and half creamer of choice in the frother up to the max line and it makes a better latte than I can buy every single morning, afternoon, and evening.

reviewDescription: The 8 Fl Oz bottles are the perfect size for tossing into a bag, lunchbox, or car cup holder without taking up too much space. No more lugging around bulky bottles—this size hits the sweet spot for a quick refresh, whether running errands, heading to a workout, or just out and about.The water itself? Clean, crisp, and always refreshing. It’s the kind of bottled water that never disappoints—straightforward, pure, and exactly what’s expected from a trusted brand like Pure Life. Each bottle is also super easy to open, even one-handed during those busy multitasking moments.The 24-pack is a lifesaver. There’s always a bottle ready to grab, whether for solo hydration or handing one off to a thirsty friend. Even kids love these—perfectly sized for little hands and ideal for school lunches or playground breaks.Only minor hiccup? A few bottles in the pack didn’t seal quite right. And while the plastic bottles are pretty standard, more eco-friendly packaging would be a welcome upgrade.Pros:Handy 8 Fl Oz size—great for on-the-goCrisp, clean tasteGenerous 24-pack = never running outKid-friendly and easy to openCons:A few bottles had sealing issuesPlastic packaging could be more eco-consciousOverall, this water pack keeps things cool, simple, and refreshingly convenient. reviewDescription: As someone who’s always on the go, I’m constantly looking for convenient ways to stay hydrated throughout the day, especially when I’m juggling work, errands, and taking care of my family. I recently picked up a 24-pack of **Pure Life Purified Water** in 8 fl oz bottles, and I have to say, it's been a game-changer.### **Perfect Size for On-the-Go Hydration**First off, the 8-ounce size is fantastic. It’s small enough to easily slip into my bag, lunchbox, or even my kids' backpacks. I’ve tried various bottled waters in the past, but I love how these mini bottles are perfectly portioned. They’re just enough to quench my thirst without feeling like I’m carrying around an entire gallon of water. Plus, they're lightweight, so I never feel weighed down.I also appreciate the resealable cap. It’s super convenient since I don’t have to finish the whole bottle in one go (especially when I’m running errands). If I don’t finish it, I can easily close it and save it for later, which is perfect for me and my kids when we're out and about.### **Clean, Refreshing Taste**The water itself tastes clean and refreshing. No weird aftertaste or overly processed flavor like some other bottled waters I’ve tried. It’s simple, crisp, and just what I need when I’m thirsty. I’m also glad there are no calories or sweeteners – sometimes I just want pure, unflavored hydration. The added minerals (calcium chloride, sodium bicarbonate, magnesium sulfate) give it a subtle, pleasant taste that makes it feel just a bit more satisfying than plain water.### **Great for Kids and Healthier Choices**I can’t stress enough how perfect these bottles are for my kids. I throw them in their school lunches, and they’re the ideal size for little hands to carry around. They love how easy it is to drink from, and I love that they’re getting something healthier than sugary juices or sodas. It's such a relief to know they’re hydrated without having to worry about them ingesting unnecessary calories or sweeteners.### **Convenient and Easy to Stock Up**The 24-pack is great for stocking up. We go through water pretty quickly, and it’s nice to have a case of these small bottles in the pantry. I can grab a few at a time and stash them wherever I need – in my car, my office, or the fridge. It takes up little space, and I don’t have to constantly run out to buy more, which is a bonus. Plus, the price is really reasonable for the quality of water you’re getting.### **A Few Minor Issues**One small downside I’ve noticed (and it’s not a deal-breaker) is that a couple of bottles in my pack seemed to have a slight leak when I first opened them. It wasn’t a huge issue, but it was a bit annoying. I haven’t had it happen with every bottle, but it’s something to be aware of. Still, the quality of the water itself is top-notch, so I can overlook that small inconvenience.### **Final Thoughts**All in all, I’m really happy with my purchase of the Pure Life 8 fl oz bottles. The size is perfect for me and my family, it tastes great, and I feel good about choosing it over sugary drinks. It’s easy to store, convenient to carry, and a healthy hydration option. I’ve been drinking these bottles regularly now, and it’s become a part of my daily routine. If you're looking for a portable, no-fuss water option, this is definitely worth checking out!

reviewDescription: There's a common misconception that wearing the sweat band while working out will actually make your waist slimmer, and while it may definitely appear that way at first, it's just making you sweat out water weight. It's not making you loose fat, and the "slimming effect" doesn't last because you'll just gain that water weight back later. Another thing I noticed was that because it made my mid sections sweat so much, it also made me break out. I found a bunch of tiny, pimple-like bumps all over my stomach the very next day.. and I showered immediately after using it. Overall, I don't think buying this is worth it. It for sure works and does what it's supposed to but the effects are not long lasting and all it did was make me sweat and then broke me out. It doesn't make you lose fat and definitely doesn't give you an hour glass shape long term.
reviewTitle: It does exactly what it's supposed to, but its temporary

reviewDescription: This is a real tour de force of story, characters, horror, and social messaging. All the cast are set up really well in a film that confidently and competently rolls out the exposition in a natural manner. When the horror part happens, it is also really well-paced, especially when it comes to the action, and has some appropriately eerie and eye-catching parts. I'm rather pleased that this takes a common supernatural threat (I'm not mentioning it if you haven't seen the second trailer yet), and looks at it from more of a "mysticism" lens.The movie does a wonderful job of weaving together messages and story. Since this is in the Jim Crow south, of course racism and the treatment of Afican Americans is a definite component, but it never feels like this is a movie focusing on trauma, but is about the people living their lives and a testament to black culture. When it comes to main messages in this, I'm not going to spoil anything as part of the joy of watching this is being made to think about what the movie is trying to say.Excellent casting all around in this. No surprise to anyone, but Michael B. Jordan gives a terrific performance. He does a great job of making each of the twins separate characters with separate personalities, storylines and wants for each. Musician and acting newcomer Miles Caton also gives a really solid performance as the Smokstack twins' cousin, musician Sammie Moore, a guy who loves his music and looks up to his more dangerous cousins. Caton gives a very real performance, and is sort of the core of the film.Jack O'Connell is also a lot of fun as the main villain Remmick. Director/writer Ryan Coogler (Black Panther/Creed/Fruitvale Station) could've gone with a one note monster with him, but he is surprisingly affable and three-dimensional (while also being an uncomfortable threat when the scary stuff happens), and his main goal may surprise you.Wonderful cinematography (including three REALLY well shot moments that steal the show). The movie is shot in a way I'd describe as "stark" color. Not darkly lit, but it has a harshness to it. Coogler and the cinematographer and editor do a solid job of having Jordan act opposite himself. The threats in this look appropriately off-putting.Music is a real focal point of the movie, and Sinners makes great use of songs and a stand-out score by Ludwig Goransson.The one thing about this film that may not work for some people is that the introduction is very long. It suitably sets up the people and place, but one could get bored.Highly recommended. This is one of those movies where everything works and really drags you in.  This is one of those rare horror movies like The Menu or The Substance that transcends being merely just horror.

reviewDescription: I can't say enough good things about the Bagail 8-Set Packing Cubes—these have completely transformed the way I pack for trips! Whether it’s a weekend getaway or a long vacation, these organizers make everything so much easier.The variety of sizes in the 8-piece set is perfect. I use the larger cubes for jeans and sweaters, the medium ones for shirts and dresses, and the smaller ones for undergarments, socks, and accessories. There’s even a great shoe bag and laundry bag included, which keeps clean and dirty items separated.The quality is impressive—lightweight yet durable, with sturdy zippers and breathable mesh panels that let you see what’s inside without having to unzip everything. They fit beautifully in both carry-on and checked luggage, maximizing space and keeping everything neatly compressed and wrinkle-free.Packing and unpacking have never been this stress-free. Instead of rummaging through a chaotic suitcase, I just pull out the cube I need. It’s a total time-saver and helps me stay organized throughout the entire trip.If you travel at all, this set is a must-have. It's a small investment that makes a big difference. I highly recommend the Bagail packing cubes to anyone who wants a smarter, more streamlined travel experience!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2025

reviewDescription: I really wanted to organize my packingI tend to be more messy at heart unless I hyper organize myself. I looked into the packing cubes, but some of them are expensive and some organizational tools just don’t work for me and I didn’t want to spend the money to find out it didn’t workI also tend to pack right up to the 50 pound limit so I didn’t want heavy packing cubesI’ve had these for a while now and they’ve been on airplane trips and trips to the beach for a long weekends. I adore themThey are not stiff so they are a little bit more forgiving if you overpack them and they don’t hold up their sides very well  This is very fine for me. It might be not fine for someone else.My husband, bought some of his own.  he spent more money and his were stii and they also had heavy metal company tags on them. They weighed too much.  He ended up not liking them because the set was just all square ones and never used them and they’re probably going to the thrift storeThis set, On the other hand, had a multiple of sizes. I Use the sock bag to put all my hair items in. I put in a mirror And various hair clips and scrunchies and barrettes. Just one of each.I put my shower shoes in the pocket of the shoe bag, And I put all my shower items in the large section, Shampoo, my back scrubber my razor anything that goes into the shower goes thereI use one of the Medium bag for my bedside bag. I put a nightgown and bed socks into it  I put a drawstring bag with all my CPAP accessories in it. And then I put the toiletry bag as well in it  Inside the toiletry bag are my cordsOn the bottom of it vitamin box. My outlet surge protector because if you have a CPAP and electronic devices, you always need extra plugsIn the pockets, I put Reading  glasses for nighttime, Lotion, lip, balm, cuticle oil, etcIn the front pockets, I put my cords and my camera chargerOK, this might seem like a lot of detail, but this is why it’s importantThe shower has a handle on top the minute I get where I’m going. I take it by the handle and in the bathroom and everything is ready to go.I take my bedside place in the nightstand and I have everything ready to go, i unpack my cords, Plug everything in and I’m ready to recharge and set up my CPAPI put the underwear bag that I also put in deodorant, sanitary pads, etc And place that where I’m going to get dressed in the morningI use one of the other bags for all my swim gearI put my swimsuit, my cover-up, My suntan lotion, Sunburn cream, Water wallet, Water shoesetc.When I’m ready to go to the pool, I just open it up get dressed and I’m good to goIf we’re tropical and we’re touring around, I might just throw the whole thing in the trunk of the car because sometimes after you’re done, you might find a beach you might want to swim in.So well, I hoped these are just make my suitcase more organized.  They actually have made me so much more organized.When I return home, I clean out my suitcase and after doing laundry, I repack them so that I’m almost ready to go in a moments. All I have to do is throw my clothes in my suitcase. It’s very helpful if you have elderly parents or other reasons you might need to pack quickly, like a traveling jobI would s get these again,  in fact, I’m thinking of getting another set.If you’re new to packing cubes, I would recommend these. They are lightweight and they are good economic way to try them out. It’s nice that they come in a multitude of colors.I made a list of everything that goes in them a little little business cards and laminated them and attached them to the zippers so that it makes it super easy to pack whether I am home or I am packing up at my destination so I don’t forget anything.

reviewDescription: I've had these for 3.5 years and they are still holding up well. When I first got them I was skeptical as to how long they would last since the fabric seemed a little flimsy but I have had zero problems. The zippers have been sturdy and smooth and the fabric has held up even though i fill them completely (and I do mean completely) full each time. I can pack jeans, 5 tops, pajamas, and workout clothes in one of the larger cubes, even in winter. I also use the zipper pouch a lot for holding charging cords, earbuds, and other random items. I initially used the shoe bag a couple of times but I don't find it very helpful. The laundry bag is too small to use for laundry and so far I haven't bothered using it for anything else. But it might be useful in another capacity. I used the toiletry bag a couple of time for socks and underwear but I just don't care for it so I really never use it. I have Travelon mesh pouches that I love for that and many other purposes. The actual cubes and the zipper bag are the pieces I use all the time. I usually travel at least once a month so these have gotten a lot of use. I do really like the mesh top so I can see what's in the cube and I like that the fabric can be easily wiped off if something gets on it. I also love that the top unzips all the way around. Makes packing so much easier. Packing cubes have been a game changer for me and have just made traveling so much easier. These aren't the highest quality but they work just fine and the price is right. Great place to start if you're just beginning to use packing cubes and want to see what all the fuss is about. I might upgrade in the future but for now these work great.
reviewTitle: Used them 3.5 years and still going

reviewDescription: I previously had some cheap ones (the ones that all say “laundry pouch” or something on) and they were falling apart and so frustrating to use. These Bagail ones are so much more well-made and make both packing, and keeping organised on holiday, a dream.The material is smooth and relatively wipeable, as well as an ideal thickness (lightweight but still thick and durable).  The zips are durable, smooth and easy to use (unlike the zips on my previous set). The striped pink pattern is cute and is satisfying with my pink suitcase.The range of sizes is great, and plenty of cubes come in the set but I would’ve loved 1 extra for my own personal needs and preferences. The cubes are nice and deep/tall so good for “large” 77cm cabin suitcases”. You can fit so much in the cubes, yet despite being a notorious over-packer, I rarely fill the cubes themselves. I usually end up stacking them all/most on one side of my large suitcase and using the other side of the suitcase for my toiletry bag, shoes, slippers, etc.I ordered a few different sets ranging from £10-£15ish. While the Bagail were the most expensive set I looked at, they felt the best quality and were the best size and range. I’m happy with my choice and would definitely recommend them. I bought them on sale and think for around £15 that they’re excellent value!

reviewDescription: The material on this vest is really nice—stretchy and comfortable overall. I will say the strap across the front goes straight across the chest, which can be a little inconvenient if you're a woman. Also, the way the back sits, it tends to hit right at my scapula, which can get a little irritating during longer walks. I don’t think that’s a flaw in the design, though—probably just how these types of vests fit in general.I’m about 150 lbs and chose the 10 lb vest. It’s surprisingly heavy (in a good way!) and not adjustable, so I knew I had to pick a weight that would challenge me without being too much. You can definitely feel the difference when you wear it. I usually get about 10,000 steps a day, and this is definitely going to take my workouts up a notch.Overall, it’s a solid, well-made vest if you’re looking to add a little extra intensity to your walks or workouts!

reviewDescription: Before I purchased this item, I saw the reviews reporting a negative chemical smell from several posts, so I was prepared for the smell when the item arrived. The smell was completely gone the next morning.  There is no smell now at all.  A plus to add, the 10lb weight is easy for me to manage, and the size is easily adjustable.  A great benefit is that the way the vest sits on my shoulders and upper back instantly corrected the way my shoulders naturally lean forward, so my shoulders feel so good after the use.  I have had both shoulders worked on with surgery removing an inch off of both my clavicles two years ago and this vest causes no discomfort, and after five uses has improved the mobility of my rotator cuffs.  So happy!

reviewDescription: These night vision polarized glasses are a real revelation to me.  I have Age-related Macular Degeneration and am legally blind from the condition.  While my central vision is affected I try to maintain as normal a life as possible.  This includes bowling on a team in a senior league.  I could not see the edge of the lanes because of the light glare on those oiled lanes so had to kind of guess where my mark was that I needed to go over.  These lightweight, low cost night vision glasses have made my bowling much easier and therefore much more enjoyable.  The glasses cut the glare making it much easier to make out where the edge of the lane is,  they are durable and the lens are scratch resistant .Since I have 3 pair with cloth drawstring cases and cleaning cloths, I will be set for quite awhile.  In the meantime I will be exploring how these may assist me in other areas.  I am beyond thrilled with ths find and definitely recommend the product

reviewDescription: I bought these acne patches a while back and they were great for me! They are affordable compared to their other competitors and are definitely worth the money! They stick right on my face and don't fall off until I take them off myself. They are not very big, and go unnoticed when I am wearing them,  but they definitely work!Something people should know is that these only work on pimples where the white-head can be seen popping out, if you have a pimple but it's underneath your skin it won't work, you'll have to wait for the white head to be visible before applying the patches.The color matches my skin which adds to the part where people don't notice. The acne patches are very slim. Cleanser is overrated, this works, and it's fast!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2025

reviewDescription: I was skeptical at first, but Mighty Patch completely won me over! These little patches are absolute lifesavers for those annoying whiteheads that pop up overnight. I apply one before bed, and by morning, the blemish is significantly reduced or completely flattened. It’s oddly satisfying to see how much gunk the patch pulls out. They stick well, stay in place through the night, and don’t irritate my skin at all. I also love that they’re nearly invisible, so I can wear them during the day if needed. It’s not a miracle cure for deep cystic acne, but for surface pimples, it works like magic. I always keep a box on hand now—definitely a must-have in my skincare kit! Its great price depending where u buy too and its like see through not too thick for that natural look  with make up or anything i think your face will look great
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2025

reviewDescription: Listen to me when I say this - These actually work!! I used to be a nurse and these are made of the same product we used for wound healing. So the fact that they’re being used in this way ( for pimples and blemishes) is actually so genius I wish I had thought of it first. But oh well. Follow the instructions or it won’t do what it’s supposed to do. Your pimple should come to a head for this to be most effective. reviewDescription: I have been sleeping on air mattresses for about 5 years now.  Yes, every night.  The reason is that I cannot afford a decent new mattress and before switching to an air mattress, I had used mattresses.  Most developed "sink holes" and those who sleep on an older mattress know what I mean - a spring or something inside has shifted and that spot...well, it's a dip that you have to figure out how to avoid when sleeping.  But the basic reason is because I am an older lady that lives alone and when I have moved, I have moved myself so as not to bother people.  I have mostly flat pack furniture so I can break it down and move it myself.  Having an air mattress fits right in with that ease of moving my own stuff.  The IDOO I had was a great deal, though I had last had a King Coil 22" that I really liked EXCEPT for their "pillow" area (the part at the head is inclined and that bothered me since I am an "arm sleeper" - put one arm up under my pillow, under my head and hang it off the bed).  Other than that part King Coil is a great air mattress bed.  Now for this Intex - I have had a couple of different Intex items and find they make quality stuff - first was a smaller, rectangular pool that wasn't too hard to set up (but I did need a friend to help with putting it up) and I currently have their inflatable loveseat that unfolds to become a bed.  It's a nice extra piece of furniture/bed, but wish it had the internal pump which it doesn't.  Still, it is a serviceable spare seating and sleeping piece that can be put up quickly enough.  NOW, for this bed - back to my 22" height and I am SO HAPPY with that part of it.  When you are older, getting UP off something is harder than scooting down off that same thing!  Meaning that I have no problem getting on a bed (no matter what the height), but in the morning, when I'm groggy and not 100%, trying to push myself up off the 18" wasn't horrible, but it wasn't fun at all.  With this Intex 22" queen, my feet dangle just a bit off the floor and pushing myself off and DOWN is just so much easier.  I was also relieved that the pump is at the top (or could be the bottom, depending on how you orient the bed) as my outlet is at that spot on the wall behind the bed.  The IDOO had the pump on the side so the cord had to be put up under the bed...I didn't like that.  This Intex, like all the air mattresses with an internal pump, it inflates (and deflates) very quickly.  Around 5 minutes.  What's easy is taking down an air mattress - most of them come with a carry case as this one did - and if you flip the sides in, then do a fourths fold up, it will fit in the bag and isn't too terribly heavy even for me to carry.  The IDOO developed a leak and instead of trying to patch it, as I have slept on it for about 2 years, I deflated it, put it in the bag it came with and threw it away.  This Intex, I had it out of the box an fully inflated in less than 10 minutes.  Made the bed and laid down on it - aaahhhh!  So, if you are in need of a spare bed for overnight guests on occasion OR you have had it with your lumpy old "regular" mattress and having sticker shock over the memory foam, purple, pillow top and other replacements, you might want to try an air mattress.  Even if you only use it long enough to save enough money for one of those $500-$1000 mattress, this $75 mattress will allow you to sleep well, night after night after night.
reviewTitle: From an IDOO 18" to this Intex 22" queen air mattress
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2023

reviewDescription: I love this air mattress! I recently moved out of my exs house and was couch surfing between finding a new place and this air mattress is a life saver!it’s very sturdy and fits three people if you sleep sideways which is possible if you’re all short like me and my friends. It doesn’t sag in the middle when you wake up in the morning like every other air mattress I’ve slept on and I’m over 200 lbs. the attached air pump is easy to use and so convenient! The cord sometimes is hard to put back in the little hole but doesn’t matter to me. It is supported in the middle and pretty comfortable and made out of thick material so I don’t think there will be any holes anytime soon! It’s also tall so about the night of a normal bed + bedframe. All in all very pleased with this purchase, if I had a mattress topper I’d consider using it as a real bed in my new place haha

reviewDescription: Removed star because bag already had hole at seam when delivered. I'll contact the company and update. The bag isn't looking durable. Mattress does seem very durable. Ordered and used at daughter's for a week. Blew up and deflated as expected. It does have a plastically smell when you first inflate, and again when I deflated. I can't complain, it's plastic lol. If smells bother you, just inflate ahead of time in another space. Deflating smell was stronger of two. Again, just deflate in another ventilated space.The mattress didn't continue to smell with use. Make sure you have deep pocket sheets. There is no indent for the bottom of the elastic to go around. I only had to fix them once in 8 nights. I slept alone, so I can't say how it would be with two. I'll update when we sleep on our with two people. But I found it very firm and comfortable. I've been having some back & neck pain. It didn't cause any problems. Might have to add some air 2nd night as the mattress might stretch a bit first time using. Found it to be true queen size. Cord/plug a little tricky to store back in the compartment within mattress.Does take some time to deflat. It folds easily and compact, but I'll have to figure out the configuration of exactly how to fold it to get it to fit into the bag once I get a replacement. I believe you'll need two people to get it in the bag. It's heavier than the thinner mattresses. So much nicer having the higher height, especially if you're going to sleep on it for more than one night. I think I went with the 22".

reviewDescription: These work well. The battery lasts pretty well although I only use them about 20-30 minutes per night. The spotlight is strong. reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2025

reviewDescription: I really like this 2 pack of LHKNL Headlamp Flashlights. I've used them often in the 2 months I've had them. Mostly for illuminating electronics when soldering but also other close up work. Many times I have them on for around 20 minutes at a time. I've been careful about not letting the battery get fully discharged because this can shorten battery life. I'm also mindful of disconnecting once fully charged. I believe it was after the 3rd charging one of the 2 went from showing 4 bars (out of 4) on the charge indicator to 0 power in a very short time. I recharged it again and used it today. Same thing happened even faster this time. When I connected it to the charger, it showed to be 75% charged.The other one is still working great. I only use one of the 6 different types/intensities of light these provide but I like them so much better than my old AAA battery powered ones. Just a bit of a bummer that 1 of the 2 is already having problems.For comfort and functionality I give them 5 stars however because 1 of the 2 is already having issues, I have to say 4 stars. If I didn't like them so much overall, it would be 2-3 stars for value.
reviewTitle: Really like the light these provide but 1 of the 2 is already failing.

reviewDescription: I'm a caffeine fiend and love a good espresso but don't always have the time to swing down to Starbucks (or wherever) to get one. These pods are great as a daily alternative. A regular shot of espresso is typically 1 fluid ounce (a doppio is two) and costs around $1.25 at Starbucks. These pods cost about $1.30 but each pod makes 7.8 ounces, almost a full cup. So at Starbucks you're paying $1.25 per ounce where here you are paying $0.16 per ounce and that's a big difference. The coffee comes out just as tasty as it does at the coffee shop with its signature creamy head. Granted, you might not want to drink the equivalent of about 8 shots of espresso, but if you are combining it with stuff to make it a latte or something (which I occasionally do) it's great. You can also buy pods that make a lesser amount. You do have to shell out the money for the actual Nespresso machine, but it certainly pays for itself over time compared to swinging through the coffee shop every day. You can return the pods to recycle them (I'm sort of a tree hugger) which is a bonus.Pros* Great taste and texture* Great value compared to commercial coffee* Recyclable podsCons* You need to buy a Nespresso machine to use them
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2025
variant: Flavor Name: Intenso, Size: 30 Count (Pack of 1)

reviewDescription: ’ve tried a variety of Nespresso pods over the years, but Intenso has quickly become one of my absolute favorites. The flavor is exactly what the name promises—intense, rich, and full-bodied—but it’s also incredibly smooth with no bitterness. It has a deep roasted aroma and a satisfying crema that makes every cup feel like a café experience at home.Whether I'm starting my morning or looking for an afternoon pick-me-up, Intenso delivers that perfect balance of strength and flavor. It’s especially great for making lattes or cappuccinos—the coffee holds its own beautifully against milk without losing its boldness.Highly recommend this for anyone who loves a strong, satisfying espresso with a refined, well-rounded taste. I always keep a sleeve (or three!) stocked up.

reviewDescription: As a dedicated coffee lover, I’ve tried many coffee pods, and the Nespresso Capsules Vertuo, Solelio, Mild Roast Coffee has quickly become one of my favorites! If you’re a fan of a smooth, mild cup of coffee, this is definitely worth trying.Taste:The Solelio Mild Roast offers a beautifully smooth and well-balanced flavor profile. It’s not too strong or too weak—just the right amount of flavor to start your day off with a satisfying cup. There’s a subtle hint of nuttiness and a slight natural sweetness that really makes it enjoyable. I’ve found it perfect for those mornings when I want something gentle but still rich and flavorful.Convenience:I absolutely love the convenience of the Nespresso system, and these pods make my mornings so much easier. The 30-count box ensures I’m stocked up for a while, and with the Vertuo machine, each pod brews perfectly every time. The capsules are easy to use, and there’s no mess or fuss with grounds—just pop it in, and the machine does the rest. Plus, they brew a generous 7.8 oz of coffee, which is ideal for my morning cup.Quality:Nespresso never disappoints when it comes to quality, and these capsules are no exception. The coffee is consistently fresh, and the aroma when brewing is incredible. The pods are sealed well, keeping the coffee inside fresh until you’re ready to brew. I’ve tried other mild roasts, but none have had the same depth of flavor and smoothness as the Solelio.Sustainability:Another reason I love Nespresso is their commitment to sustainability. These pods are recyclable, which makes me feel better about my purchase, knowing that I’m supporting an eco-conscious brand.Overall:If you enjoy a smooth, mild roast that’s full of flavor but not overwhelming, the Nespresso Capsules Vertuo Solelio is a fantastic choice. The convenience of the pods, paired with the delicious taste and Nespresso’s quality, makes it a standout in my daily coffee routine. I will definitely be buying this again and recommending it to fellow coffee lovers!
reviewTitle: Perfect Morning Brew - Smooth, Flavorful, and Convenient!

reviewDescription: I have been using Neutrogena Facial Wipes at night, only, for about three years.  I should mention, first and foremost, that I am seventy-five and have always had dry skin. A physical condition I have has made all my skin drier than ever and I did a great deal of research before choosing these makeup removal pads. Prior to this, I used Cetaphil face wash at night.  My skin is so dry, I've always used just use a splash of water on it in the morning.  I started using these strictly because said condition makes my back pain much worse at the end of the day. I wear lipstick all the time and don't use very much makeup: just a skin serum and moisturizer and tinted moisturizer with SPF, occasional blush and no eye makeup. I particularly like the fact that these have no scent and unlike what some find, I don't feel any greasy residue on my face after use.  I also like that they are biodegradable. Sometimes, particularly in the Winter, my facial skin will actually hurt from being dry and the last time it happened, I stopped using these but saw no difference. I bring one of these wipes, my facial serum and my moisturizer in at night and use them while I am watching television and they have proved to be just what I was looking for.
reviewTitle: These have worked well on my very dry facial skin when used once a day!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2025

reviewDescription: And so it begins! My son just turned 6, and the one thing he REALLLLLLLLY wanted was a “Stanley.” I can’t believe kids that young are already so amped up about a trendy-expensive water bottle. I don’t even have one! 😒I looked at all the different styles. I know he prefers a straw cup vs an open mouth style. I also know he’s really forgetful and might not remember to bring it home if it doesn’t fit easily in his backpack,  so one with a giant side handle probably wouldn’t work. I found this one and fell in love with the size (20oz) and the cool top handle that flips down. It’s totally a “big boy cup.” The straw is perfect for him, too.It’s a big change going from his lightweight & easy to use ZAK cups to something so heavy-duty, but he loves it! Just keep in mind these cups get super heavy once ice and liquids are added. His entire backpack was weighed down! Ice is staying frozen the majority of the day as long as there’s at least 4 cubes; one or two melted within a couple hours.Is it spill-proof?? Only if the straw is shut. If it’s open, it leaks EVERYWHERE.I’d say this will work ok as a “home” cup for younger kids, although they may need help opening the straw (it’s pretty stiff). Age 6+ will like it at school!
reviewTitle: Perfect school cup for my 6 yr old! 💧

reviewDescription: I’ve been using the Amazon Basics Cotton Swabs, 500 Count, for several months now, and they have exceeded my expectations in every way. reviewDescription: I purchased these shirts hoping to replace another brand which went downhill. Truly I lucked out!These shirts are breathable, but not too thin. I’m 5’11” with both long legs and a long torso. Usually I’m wearing high waisted jeans and hoping to find a shirt that will be long enough so it doesn’t seem like I’m always wearing a crop top. This is it! If I need to tuck the shirt in, it doesn’t pop out and when sitting down, the shirt doesn’t ride up. What a dream! I will say that they run a little bit big. Usually I order a medium in T-shirts. This medium looks a bit loose fitting, but there’s still some form to it. Maybe order one size down if you want a tight, more form fitted t-shirt. Plus, when I have to tuck it in, the shirt goes all the way down to my waist. Crazy! I can’t remember the last time I found a shirt long enough for me. Even those shirts made “long” or “tall” usually aren’t long enough.I would recommend giving these a try!

reviewDescription: This wonderful old Hitchcock movie received an excellent restoration, prompting this purchase. I am glad the team at Paramount, headed by Charlotte Barker, took the necessary care to bring the film back to life. Grace Kelly and Cary Grant head  the cast. The other star of the film is the French Riviera. It was Hitchcock’s  wife who suggested a unique filming technique for the time-  put the camera in a helicopter! The resultant aerial perspective of the Grand Corniche is quite spectacular, given one of the earliest uses of VistaVision to maximize image detail. .

reviewDescription: Certainly nothing to complain about.  It's well worth the money.  For those who already have the standard blu-ray, yes it's a nice upgrade although it's not an earth shaking upgrade.  The benefit of 4K varies depending on the scenes.  Some scenes it's not very noticeable at all if any, and other scenes it looks noticeably better.  All in all, I've had the DVD, the standard blu-ray and now the 4K disc, and I'm very happy that I made the choice to upgrade.  Of course, it's miles ahead of the DVD.  In fact once you've had even the standard blu-ray, it's difficult to ever watch the DVD again.  So yes, if you are lucky enough to own a 4K UHD blu-ray player, then by all means, buy this new 4K UHD upgrade.  On a Hitchcock film, any improvement in image quality, however incremental, brings you closer to the original experience the audience had in the theater back when it was first released.
reviewTitle: The 4K UHD blu-ray is very nice
