reviewDescription: Beijos de Sol is such a gentle fragrance, with way more of a “skin smell” vibe than other Sol de Janiero mists in my collection. It’s like a delightfully beachy, bright mixture of peach & coconut milk carried by solar florals. It brings a lot of beautiful sunny tropical warmth without becoming sweet or cloying, which I love!!It’s a perfect soft, warm summer fragrance that brings happy beachy vibes & memories of summers past (at least for someone raised in CA) but isn’t artificial smelling or overwhelming, even on a super hot day where fragrances can get sickening quickly. Its softness can also be its weakness though, as it remains faint no matter how often you reapply it! It has very low projection/ silage & seems to fade from mildly there at onset to barely detectable levels extremely quickly, even for Sol mists which don’t have great lasting power in general. Which is such a shame because for a few beautiful fleeting moments between the alcohol dry down & the nearly immediate fading of the fragrance it smells almost exactly like HARAJUKU LOVERS G PERFUME from the early 2000’s which I LOVED.It has that same good beachy coconut note where it sits between fresh coconut milk & warm suntan lotion coconut smell, but avoids the gourmand toasty/nutty/sweet quality that a lot of other coconut fragrances have & instead stays in the sunny/creamy/fresh but warm tropical lane.You definitely smell the fresh juicy brightness of the peach at initial spray, with no candy or artificial notes, it really smells like a fresh super ripe juicy peach which sadly does not stay & fades into a barely detectable but warm fruity note in the dry down.There is also a super slight pear note that others have mentioned but it sits under the peach note from initial spray to dry down. Also, as someone who finds flowering pear trees to stink, (IYKYK) this pear note did not turn on my skin like some others had mentioned. I was super worried about this element but the pear is barely there & for me thankfully did not go into rancid stink, but seems to be a risk factor for some if you’re sensitive to that.The frangipani petals honestly are where most of the warmth to this fragrance comes from, & they definitely live in that solar warm floral arena, NOT in the sugar warm floral aspect of frangipani that a lot of mists lean into to. However it is still a sweet/sunny/honey smelling flower like alyssum & brings in the warmth through that aspect but at no point does it overwhelm the coconut milk & peach notes, & instead comes in & gently rounds them out without removing them.I can see why many people were surprised by this mist, but also why I love it: it is definitely NON-gourmand, but rather a fruity sunny floral, coconut fragrance. It’s gentle, tropical, & warm while still staying fresh, fruity & uplifting. I only wish it wouldn’t fade so quickly, & would retain the initial brightness of the peach throughout the dry down. The lack of silage might keep me from buying again, but also the well-balanced, barely there yet delightfully beachy fragrance might bring me back, at least until I find a better G dupe. Faint but lovely!!

reviewDescription: Okay, confession time: I am absolutely, unapologetically *addicted* to long, steamy showers and near-boiling baths that toe the line between self-care and cooking up human consommé. Seriously—if there’s steam clinging to the ceiling and fog rolling off the mirror like a Victorian ghost scene, I call that Tuesday.But the aftermath? My mirror’s so foggy I could summon Bloody Mary three times and still not see her. And baby, when I’ve got a face to beat and no time to wait for the fog to clear? Enter: this slick **Stainless Steel Shower Squeegee**, aka my new ride-or-die.This thing glides across glass like it’s auditioning for *Dancing with the Squeegees*. Ten inches of fog-busting, tile-loving, mirror-clearing magic. Comes with two adhesive hooks so it’s always right where I need it—no rummaging, no drama, just *squeeg* and slay.And yes, I did just invent a new verb. To squeeg: *verb* — to dominate one’s post-shower steam scene like a sassy domestic ninja.Get this. Love this. Squeeg your heart out.

reviewDescription: Estoy realmente impresionada con esta escobilla de ducha de acero inoxidable. reviewDescription: If you’re looking for an affordable, comfortable, and beginner-friendly yoga or exercise mat that doesn’t compromise on quality, the Amazon Basics 1/2-Inch Extra Thick Exercise Yoga Mat is a fantastic option. After using this mat consistently for several weeks, I can confidently say it delivers exceptional value and comfort, especially for those who need a little extra cushioning and support during their workouts or stretching routines.🧘‍♀️ Comfort & Cushioning – Perfect for JointsWhat really sets this mat apart is the extra-thick 1/2-inch padding. The high-density foam offers a plush, supportive surface that’s ideal for exercises that involve kneeling, sitting, or lying down. Whether I’m doing yoga poses, Pilates, stretching, or even light bodyweight training, the mat provides a shock-absorbing cushion that reduces stress on my knees, elbows, wrists, and spine.If you have joint sensitivity or simply prefer more comfort than what a typical yoga mat offers, this thickness is a game-changer. It strikes a great balance between soft and firm—it cushions well without feeling like you’re sinking into it.🧼 Easy to Clean & MaintainThe textured, moisture-resistant surface makes the mat super easy to clean. I usually wipe it down with a damp cloth after each use, and it dries quickly without holding on to odors or stains. The material doesn’t absorb sweat, and the surface texture also adds a bit of grip—enough to keep me grounded during poses and stretches, though it’s best suited for low- to medium-intensity sessions rather than fast-paced or hot yoga where more traction is required.👜 Lightweight & Portable with StrapAnother thoughtful feature is the included carrying strap. It’s a simple but useful addition that makes it easy to roll up the mat and sling it over your shoulder for transport. The mat itself is lightweight, which means I can easily carry it to the gym, a yoga class, or even to the park for an outdoor session. It stores compactly when rolled up and doesn’t take up much space.💪 Versatile for All ActivitiesThis isn’t just a yoga mat—it’s great for a wide range of floor exercises. I’ve used it for stretching, strength training, core work, foam rolling, and meditation. The generous thickness makes it especially good for lying exercises, offering comfort and insulation from hard or cold floors.At approximately 74 inches long, the mat provides ample space even for taller individuals. I never feel like I’m running out of room when stretching out fully or moving through different positions.🧩 Durable and Holds Up WellDespite its softness, the mat is remarkably durable. It doesn’t tear, flake, or wear down easily, even with daily use. The foam retains its shape well and doesn't compress too much over time. It lies flat on the floor without curling at the edges, and the finish hasn’t shown any signs of peeling or cracking.✅ Final ThoughtsThe Amazon Basics Extra Thick Exercise Yoga Mat is a standout in its price range. It offers the comfort and functionality of more expensive mats without the high cost. Whether you’re a beginner looking for a soft introduction to yoga, someone needing joint-friendly padding, or simply want a reliable mat for home workouts, this one checks all the boxes.With its generous cushioning, lightweight portability, and multipurpose design, it's a solid addition to any fitness routine. It's also a great gift idea for anyone starting out in fitness or looking to upgrade from a thinner or worn-out mat.Highly recommended for comfort, quality, and value. 🧘‍♂️✨

reviewDescription: UPDATE: I've been using this since  December 29th 2024, I reviewed this in March.It's still great and despite damage due to dog nails doesn't have heavy tears. Using it outside hasn't done big damage on concrete or stone flooring. I will mention that I hose it down in the shower or outside to clean it and she's even (unfortunately) thrown up on it and it's been a quick clean and dry. If you want to use this for your dogs for any reason this is a great solution, especially if you're working with dogs that might eat bedding but won't touch foam!ORIGINAL:I ordered this yoga mat and cut it in half to use it as a portable place for my dog until we have the space for an indoor cot or KILMB. The benefit is I can also use this on the go like in dog training or when we go on training outings!So far though her nails have done some damage to it the mat has been very comfy and easy to clean if you're using it for your pets. The size is fantastic so if you'd want to use this for yoga I'd say this works for almost all heights! It's not very slippery but light enough to nudge with your feet if you need to. I can't speak to the support but my dog likes laying on it vs the floor (especially in cooler periods) so it must be more comfortable. She eats up beds so I'm waiting for her to grow out of it to have a bed in the living room as she doesn't sleep on the floor or her crate at night.As you can see her tail is going a mile a minute in the photo as she loves things for her and she loves being asked to do something if it makes her feel helpful! The photo was before i trimmed it in half but it's still got a great space range for an amstaff mix that's around 60 lbs even when cut in half if you want to use it as a crate mat or support/cushioning for a dog cot.Genuinely? I might actually buy this for myself to help with my knee injury exercises.

reviewDescription: I bought this because my Contigo bottle's straw wouldn't let me suck any water up when the lid was screwed all the way on. This bottle completely avoids that issue due to the large hole for pouring, and is very convenient at the gym where I want a mix of chugging and sipping water. reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2025

reviewDescription: I truly LOVE my Owala bottle. I kid you not, in the first week I was drinking 3-4 full bottles of water each day! That’s 120 oz to 160 oz of water per day which is mind boggling because before that I was struggling to finish at least to 32oz bottles. It’s all in the spout, whether you sip or chug, it is so easy to drink water without stopping. I was previously using a Camelbak Eddy+ and I loved that bottle but I found compared to the Owala the bite valve stopped you from getting a continuous flow of water between breathes.Plus it has a lid to cover the sip part which opens decently easy. I have found after the first few washes the lid catches when it goes to open, meaning it takes an extra second to pop open. It keeps the mouth piece clean even when dropped. If I dropped my Camelbak on the ground it would end up getting dirt, sand or mud depending on where it was dropped and the bite valve would need to be cleaned.The bottle comes apart and is easily cleaned.My main gripe is WHOEVER takes the product phots for Owala SUCKS!! Not once has a color way online matched what I have seen in store or received from an online order. If you want a particular color I recommend going to the store to pick it out and don’t rely on the product photos.Overall I highly recommend this bottle, I just wish the price was a bit lower and the colors were represented better.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2025

reviewDescription: This bottle has genuinely become my most favourite water bottle I've ever owned. Such a cute design (although I can't speak for some of the others... lol), and the handle makes it very comfortable to carry. I love the straw and the fact that you can choose to sip or chug from it! It also keeps water cold for such a long time. Unfortunately, I've dented my bottle already by dropping it (about a metre drop), so it isn't the most dent-proof but you can always get a silicone boot to protect the bottom. After reading some reviews, I was worried that the bottle might come dented, but thankfully it was sent in a padded mailer and in great condition! My Owala literally comes everywhere with me now and I honestly can never go back to my other bottles. Although it may be a bit pricey, it is 100% worth the money as you'll get so much use out of it. Also reminder to take all the silicone bits out and wash them individually to keep everything clean! Definitely recommend this bottle if you haven't bought it already.

reviewDescription: A Game-Changer for Restoring Headlights – CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration KitIf you’re someone who’s tired of dim, yellowed, or foggy headlights that affect the clarity of your night driving, I highly recommend the CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit. This kit has been an absolute game-changer for me, bringing my headlights back to life and making them look just like new again—without the need for power tools. After years of battling cloudy headlights, I can honestly say that this is one of the best products I’ve used for headlight restoration. Here’s why.🧽 No Power Tools Required – Easy to Use for Beginners and ProsOne of the first things I loved about the CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit is that it doesn’t require any power tools. Unlike other headlight restoration kits that demand power drills or polishing tools, this kit is as simple and straightforward as it gets. Everything you need to restore your headlights is included in the kit, and the process is easy to follow. Whether you’re a complete beginner or an experienced DIYer, you’ll find this kit to be incredibly user-friendly.The kit comes with 10 wipes—each wipe is individually sealed to keep it fresh until you’re ready to use it. The instructions are clear and simple, so you won’t be left guessing how to use the product. It’s a no-hassle solution that can be completed in the comfort of your own driveway or garage, saving you time and money compared to taking your vehicle to a professional.🌟 Restores Headlights to Like-New ConditionThe most impressive feature of the CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit is its ability to restore cloudy, yellowed, or foggy headlights to a like-new condition. I was honestly amazed at the transformation of my headlights after using this kit. They went from looking dull and hazy to being clear, bright, and crystal clear, which not only improved the aesthetics of my car but also enhanced my visibility while driving at night.The kit works by removing oxidation, grime, and dirt buildup from the surface of the headlights, followed by applying a ceramic coating that protects the headlights from further degradation. The result is headlights that look brand new—as if I just got them installed—giving my car a refreshed and well-maintained appearance.🛡️ Long-Lasting Protection with Ceramic CoatingAnother standout feature of the CERAKOTE® Headlight Restoration Kit is the ceramic coating it applies after restoring the headlights. The coating forms a protective layer that not only brings out the shine but also protects the headlights from UV rays, dirt, and water. This helps to prevent yellowing and cloudiness from reappearing, keeping your headlights looking new for a long time. The ceramic protection also helps repel water and keeps the headlights clear even after exposure to rain and moisture.The manufacturer claims that the results will last as long as you own your vehicle, and based on my experience, I believe it. The coating acts as a shield, preventing future oxidation, which is the main cause of yellowing and clouding of headlights. I’ve used other headlight restoration products in the past, but they only lasted a few months before the yellowing came back. With the CERAKOTE® Ceramic Kit, it feels like my headlights are permanently protected.🧴 Gentle Yet Effective – No Harsh Scrubbing RequiredUnlike other restoration kits that can require intense scrubbing or buffing, the CERAKOTE® Kit takes a gentler approach. The wipes included are formulated to be effective without requiring you to apply excessive force. The wipes are designed to remove oxidation, restore clarity, and apply the ceramic coating in a way that doesn’t damage the headlights or create unnecessary mess. Even if you’re dealing with headlights that have been neglected for a long time, this kit makes the restoration process feel easy and effortless.There’s no need to worry about abrasive tools or making a mess, as the wipes are disposable and won’t leave any residue or marks on your car. Simply wipe down the headlights, and you’re done! It’s easy to apply, and the whole process is completed within a short period—typically around 30 minutes per headlight.⚡ Instant Results – Fast and ConvenientWhen I used the CERAKOTE® Headlight Restoration Kit, the results were immediate. I could literally see the transformation happening right before my eyes. The wipes are saturated with just the right amount of solution to make the restoration process fast, and I didn’t have to wait for hours or deal with complicated steps. Within 30 minutes, both of my headlights were restored, and I was left with a car that looked like it had just been detailed.The fact that this is a quick and efficient process makes it perfect for those who are short on time or just looking for a DIY solution that doesn’t take all day.👌 Cost-Effective – Save Money on Professional Headlight RestorationOne of the most appealing aspects of the CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit is the cost savings. Professional headlight restoration services can be expensive, often costing anywhere from $100 to $150 per headlight. In comparison, this kit is affordable and allows you to restore your headlights yourself, at a fraction of the cost.Plus, you get 10 wipes in the kit, so you can use it for multiple vehicles or keep the extra wipes for future maintenance. This makes it a cost-effective investment for anyone looking to keep their headlights in great shape without the ongoing expense of professional services.🌈 Sleek and Convenient PackagingThe packaging is another thoughtful feature of the CERAKOTE® Headlight Restoration Kit. The individual wipes are neatly packaged and sealed, so they stay fresh and ready to use whenever you need them. The kit itself is compact and can easily fit in your car’s glove compartment, making it perfect for emergency headlight restoration while on the go.It’s also worth mentioning that the wipes are easy to store and don’t take up much space in your toolbox or garage, which adds to the convenience and portability of the product.✅ Final Thoughts – A Must-Have for Car OwnersThe CERAKOTE® Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit has completely transformed the way I maintain my headlights. It’s an easy-to-use, effective, and long-lasting solution for restoring clarity and brightness to headlights, and the ceramic coating ensures the results last for years. I’ve already recommended this product to several friends and family members, and I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for an affordable, high-quality headlight restoration kit.Whether your headlights have been affected by years of exposure to the elements or you just want to bring them back to life, this product will give you outstanding results. It’s a must-have for any car owner who wants to maintain their vehicle in top-notch condition and improve nighttime visibility.Five stars—I’m thoroughly impressed with the performance and convenience of this kit. It truly delivers on its promise to restore your headlights to like-new condition with long-lasting results!

reviewDescription: ...foggy, yellow headlight syndrome? If so, there's still hope! If you have dealt with in the past or are currently dealing with this silent but frustratingly annoying problem, just know that you are not alone! You understand not only how terrible it looks but also more importantly how it can restrict the amount of light that shines through at night time while trying to drive! Well finally there is hope! Finally there is an inexpensive and unbelievably effective solution!So if you or a loved one understand the frustration of not being able to solve what seems like such a simple problem without using methods that require a "professional" to charge you ridiculous amounts of money for a solution that may or may not even work. Or if you've fallen victim to "As seen on TV" promises or that quirky yet engaging young man who approaches you at your local gas station with claims (and quite effectively to be fair) to be selling the "next big thing" in headlight restoration... THERE IS FINALLY AN EFFECTIVE SOLUTION!!!Ok, all joking aside, plus I wanted to make sure I got your attention. First and foremost I could understand how this review may come across as some type of paid promotion or that I am gaining something from submitting such a lengthy review that unabashedly shows love to this amazing product. Well rest assured I am not! I am just your average dude who decided to give this product a shot because quite frankly nothing else works! The reviews for this ceramic headlight restoration kit we're very positive and provided me somewhat skeptical optimism but I figured all these other dudes and dudettes are showing pictures and talking about how great this product works that I figured for the price it was definitely inexpensive enough to give it a shot. Why not?! Over the years I've probably spent at least 15 to 20 times that amount trying to remedy this really annoying problem! Seriously folks it is an issue. If you have no one idea what I'm talking about and have never had to deal with it then you are very lucky, but if you're here reading reviews and thinking about buying this product then you just know. You just know that it can really make your car look dirty and old, but most importantly it can be a legitimate safety issue! If your headlights can get as foggy and yellow as mine it can seriously effect the amount of light my headlights are shining onto the road in front of me and to the cars coming towards me. That's pretty scary!  It has gotten so bad recently that I have questioned whether my headlights are even on or not because the lack of light shining from my headlights! That was when I decided to do yet another dive into finding a product that would actually work. Well I found it, and this Cerakote ceramic headlight restoration kit is the answer!A couple things of note when using/applying this product. Pay attention to the manner in which the instructions tell you to apply or scrub. The first step you're using a small circular motion with pressure, and then the second step you're supposed to use short back and forth strokes, and then the third step requires a different method of applying as well. I only mention this because it was easy for me to get distracted or lose focus and start using circular movements when I'm supposed to use back and forth movements or vice versa. The manner in which you do each step is important so keep that in mind.The most important thing I can suggest about this restoration kit, is to keep the faith! My headlight didn't look foggy after the first step as stated it would so that started making me skeptical that I've been had yet again, but stick with it! I stated above there were times where I kind of just lost focus and wasn't applying the cleaner or scrubbing the cleaner the proper way and then with my headlights not being foggy after step one I thought I was just kind of going through the motions and what was the point?! Even through me trying to sabotage the application and the cynical and skeptical thoughts creeping back in my head yet again this product still delivered way way above and beyond what I had hoped for! What I don't understand is how this product doesn't have five stars across the board and isn't promoted more heavily, because it is legit and it works!Trust me guys I get the frustration of product after product failing to come through, but this product delivered in every way possible and obviously I cannot recommend it enough!! If you're tired of your foggy, yellow headlights, or getting more and more nervous driving a night because the light projected in front of you seems to dissipate more and more over time. Just buy this headlight restoration kit! I promise you will not regret it!!After literally years and years (and different products) of trying to find a solution this Cerakote ceramic headlight restoration kit is the solution I have been looking for all along. This company has earned a lifelong customer and fan and I would hate for other people to continue to struggle to get their headlights clean when there is a very inexpensive and super, super effective solution!

reviewDescription: Alright, let preface this by saying, I am not a doctor or medical expert, I can only speak to the results, I myself have experienced.Back Story:So about 2 years ago, I started getting dry skin around my mouth, nose, eyebrows, and occasionally my ears and cheeks. It was pretty mild, so I never went to a dermatologist. However, before this time, never did I have to lotion my skin regularly, so this was a change for me.When this started happening, I used Aquaphor Healing Ointment (Advanced Therapy), and while it made me look greasy or like I was sweating for a couple hours, lol, it wore off enough, and would leave me looking normal the rest of the day. The only time my skin was really irritated was right after I would shave. However, dryness/peeling would get real bad if I did not at least lotion all those areas of my face after I showered. While I did some minor Googling about the issue, I was clearly too lazy to do anything about it, and the lotion solution sufficed for me. Dumb, I know.Anyways, fast forward to about 1.5 months ago. I started to notice a white growth under my left thumbnail that started to detach my nail from my nail bed. For some reason, this concerned me more than the dry skin on my face. So after Googling again, I found ti could be a problem with yeast growth under my nail. Then, I remembered reading that yeast growth could be causing my face problems. After connecting the dots, I decided to find a possible solution, to possibly kill two birds with one stone.After some searching, I stumbled onto Nizoral. After reading all the reviews, I was encouraged. I purchased this product and it has helped me tremendously. I could not be happier. It says to use it only every 3-4 days, which I say you should stick to, because I would use it on back to back days and it would seem to dry my skin out, but that could have been in my head.My Use:So, I know this is shampoo, but I almost treat it like liquid soap. I rub it on my skin/scalp and leave it there for 3-5 minutes. For my fingernail, I would lift it, since there was a gap and the nail was coming up. I put Nizarol directly in the ever so small opening between the nail and nail bed, and left it for 3-5 minutes. I am not sure if that was smart for the fingernail, but it worked for me.Results:TLDR: It worked everywhere, lol.Mouth/Upper Lip: This area was the worst of my dry skin issues. Like said, it was especially bad after shaving. Sometimes, my skin would be patchy red and inflamed after shaving, especially on the top of my chin and right below my lip. It would look gross for like an hour. In addition, when I did not shave, but did not lotion my skin, this area would eventually get pretty flaky before the end of the day. I also had issues with the corners of my mouth, especially after eating. My upper lip generally did not have any issues, but sometimes I would in very cold/dry weather.So, after using this product, I have seen a great deal of improvement. For the first time in almost 2 years, I do not have to lotion my face every single day. The patch below my lip still is not where I want it to be, but it is very much better. My skin feels dry after a shave, but now it does not look red or inflamed. It is getting better, and I think it will continue to get better. The corners of my mouth have issues if I do not lotion for 2 days or so, but they are much more minor to what they used to be. The minor issue above my lip is currently non-existent, however, we have not had any cold weather yet. This was the most noticeable problem I had with my dry/flaky/peeling skin, and I am happy to say, Nizarol has worked wonders. I now can use regular lotion instead of Aquaphor, which I still adore.Eyebrows: This was my second worse area, and I say eyebrows, but it was actually the area in between my eyebrows would flake worse than my eyebrows. I rub Nizarol into my eyebrows, in between them, and around my eye sockets. Nizarol has pretty much cleared up this issue, and I am thrilled Nizarol has basically eliminated the second worst dry area on my face. If I do not use lotion for several days, it does flake, but in a very minor way. Side note: be careful around your eyes, it burns pretty good if you get the shampoo runoff in your eye, lol.Nose/Nostrils: This was my third worst area. I would have dry skin on the sides of my nose, the point of my nose, and even on the inside of my nostrils! First off, putting Nizarol in your nostrils may not be safe. If you do do it, don't huff the Nizarol when it is in your nostrils, breath through your mouth. My nose area has improved, but is now more of an issue than my eyebrows. Still it is much better, and I can go a couple days without using lotion. It is also more of the inside of the nostrils than the outside of my nose. I think if I were willing to put Nizarol further up my nose than just the inside rim, I could eliminate the problem. But, at what cost? Lol. I don't want to ingest this stuff, lol. Either way, I am still happy!Head/Scalp: I have never had much of an issue with my scalp other than minor dandruff, for which I have always used Head & Shoulders. Despite this, I use this shampoo, as intended. I can not honestly tell if it is making any difference. Also, I have very short hair, so I cannot tell if this makes my hair coarse like everyone else says. If it does, I would use a conditioner like other reviews suggest.Ears/Earlobes:  So, while it was more rare, but sometimes, my ear lobes and the bottom crease where the ear connected to my face would get dry and flake. I rub Nizarol on my ears, on the inside of my ears, and behind my ears/ear lobes. I have zero issues here now and never have to lotion this area any more.Forehead/Cheek Areas:These were not really problem areas unless it was cold/dry/windy. We have not had that type of weather, but I really do not think it will be a problem.Pelvic Area: I know this is a touchy subject, lol, but  what I have to say is tame and could help some people. So several months back, something new happened, I noticed my pelvic area was dry as well, after using clippers. I used Nizarol in the creases of my leg, and in in my pelvic area, including directly on my -----. Results? Well, this has virtually eliminated the dry skin everywhere. Even better, I am chaffing less when running, which is awesome! I figured Nizarol was working everywhere else, so what the hell? Luckily for me, this was another minor issue it helped.Fingernail: Getting back to my fingernail, I had this white chalky/flaky formation under my fingernail. It had got to almost halfway down my thumbnail. It was causing my nail to lift. It did not hurt, but I thought it was unsightly. So I lifted the nail and put Nizarol in there. Again, possibly not safe, but a couple weeks in and my nail is almost back to normal. I eventually started cutting deeper into my nail to get the Nizarol farther back, which has worked. My nail almost looks normal and it looks like it is pushing the last of white to the font of my nail. So the growth stopped moving backward and it has improved. Another win!Others Uses?: As you can tell, I pretty much use this stuff all over. I put it on my elbows, the knuckles of my toes, and the point of my ankle bone. I think it is helping, but I am not 100% sure. What I can tell you is that it seems that it seems easier to get the dry skin off after applying the shampoo. A pedicure is on the docket and if I remember, I will update this review.Conclusion:Nizarol has worked way better than I could have hoped, and I did not even have to go to the dermatologist. I am hoping within a couple months, my skin will go back to normal. I am not sure if that will happen, but I love what Nizarol has done for me. I encourage anyone that has some of the issues I had to give it a try. Again, my issues were mild compared to some of the pictures I have seen, but I imagine if you are struggling with mild to intermediate issues, and you have not gone to a dermatologist, this could help you.I hope all this helps! Good luck!****Update: 7/25/2017***Fingernails: Nizoral completely fixed my nail problem!Face: So, when I first started using this product, I saw quite a bit of improvement. I no longer have red patches anywhere on my face. The only issue is that there have been diminishing returns. Nizarol has helped tremendously, but I still have dryness and dead skin issues. It is much more mild now, but still exists, however, I am grateful for the continued results.Scalp: Lol, I still cannot tell if this is helping or not. I still have minor dandruff. Nizarol has had no effect on my scalp as far as I can tell. Not a big deal for me though...

reviewDescription: I am highly amazed! I’m 37 and Had serious dandruff for months where it made me not even want to style my hair or even go anywhere. Right now I keep running my fingers through my hair it’s so refreshing. I washed my hair upside down with this shampoo, rinsed and washed again , rinsed. I didn’t like how dry and ruff it felt so I used a pack of argan oil deep conditioner for a minute then rinsed and my hair was amazing from the duo. My hair felt so light and nice even before completely air drying and I was hesitant to check it out until completely dry. But holy *********!!! This product removed all dandruff in 1 single wash session as directions were actuate saying wash,rinse , repeat.I do not see one single dandruff piece in my hair at all. And it was extreme to the point I am not exaggerating. I tried oils and conditioning before but nothing made it go away. I’m honestly not sure how my hair would feel without adding a deep conditioner afterwards but Walmart sells the one I used for less than $2 a packet. My hair now looks so refreshed and styled when all I did was let it air dry after using this dandruff shampoo and deep conditioner!! Trust me your be amazed at results! My hair can breathe again, it’s dandruff free, weightless, and full of life I’m so happy!! It doesn’t have a bad smell at all. Also you do not need a lot of shampoo at all as it lathered and foamed up thick while shampooing so well. I didn’t leave it in at all either. I’m surprised it’s not more expensive honestly and was really expecting to have to use it until bottle was empty not have it work just after one time. Thank You for giving me my hair back that I haven’t seen in months bc of such annoying dandruff that I never had so bad before. This product is a blessing!
reviewTitle: This product is a blessing and worked after 1 wash session!!

reviewDescription: * Disclaimer, this is a long review, but I'm so incredibly happy with the results that I want you to know how upsetting it was that nothing worked longer than a day until I bought this shampoo.I started getting dandruff in my late 20's. I'm 36 now. At first it wasn't bad and then it got noticeable to the point I was embarrassed. For reference I have really dark brown hair, thick and very long. I had literally tried every kind of dandruff shampoo and conditioner from stores to online to salon recommended. From $5 bottles to $35 plus. The only way they would remotely work is if I used them daily, but by the end of the day or next morning, I'd have the ugly white flaking or white piece stuck in the middle of a strand of hair. If I went two days without using them, it would be enough to notice even with my hair in a bun And headband. And I usually wash my hair every 3-4 days because I never needed to wash it daily.I randomly searched on Amazon again about a month or two ago for dandruff shampoo because now it was getting itchy and I was so upset every day to see my hair. I found this product with high reviews, Nizoral. I said to myself, I'm desperate and I'll try anything. I purchased it. When I first went to use it, it was super blue and I wasn't sure how it would leave my hair, but I scrubbed it all around my scalp, only one wash. Then I used my normal conditioner, Nexxus, not any kind of anti dandruff conditioner (because I have those too). I wanted to see what the Nizoral would do without also having to use an anti dandruff conditioner. And for another reference (there's a lot of these), I first used it after not washing my hair for about 3-4 days, with only using dry shampoo in between. I got out of the shower and didn't see white flakes. I let my hair dry naturally as I wasn't going anywhere and drying it is a 30-40 minute process which I don't like doing lol. But I love my long hair; it's a love/hate relationship.Anyways, back to this magical shampoo, I woke up the next morning and no flakes, no white stuck in strands of my hair, no grossness falling out of my hair onto my sink or clothing when I ran my hands through my hair or brushed it, nothing! I was so excited, but hesitant because I said let's give this the day test. Checked back at night, nothing. Checked the next morning, nothing. I went 4 days without one single flake before my head was a little itchy because of just needing to be washed.I repeated the Nizoral shampoo with my normal conditioner again, and same thing. Days and no flakes or itching. I literally cried I was so happy and couldn't believe the type of sorcery this product had bestowed upon my head.I am now on month 2 or 3 I think, and I use this once a week with my regular conditioner and the dandruff is just gone. And that is days in between without washing my hair. It also doesn't make my hair dry or feel gunky or anything. My hair is always soft and smells nice. I was worried something like this would give off a weird medicated kind of smell, but not at all!If you have dandruff and nothing has worked or your tired of having to use something every day in order for it to work, just stop and buy this. It's not even that expensive and I have had two months of use from ONE bottle; again with that reference, I have hair down to my bum that takes 40 fricken minutes to dry with a blow dryer because it's so thick.Hands down I would literally promote this shampoo anywhere, even though my dandruff has been a really embarrassing condition for me. I wish I had before and after photos, but my dandruff was pretty much gone after the first use. So I couldn't even get a before picture now and it hasn't come back.Seriously, if you made it this far, Just buy it!** Also, quick footnote, I do shower daily. I just don't wash my hair every day. It goes up in a tight bun on my hair days off in the shower, which usually will stay up the rest of the day because I work from home and between being a single Mom getting a 7 year old up and ready for school and morning chores and then working for 10-12 hours, I'm too lazy to style my hair. Now, I do use a  normal dry shampoo in between hair washes. But I had that routine before I bought this product, so I know 100% the only reason my dandruff is gone is because of the Nizoral shampoo.*** Second footnote, I'm not being paid to write this nor was this some kind of promotional item I got to use to write about. I'm just that impressed and so happy with the results and I know there has to be someone else out there that is going through that struggle I did and I just want that person to feel the happiness I do right now.**** This is the longest review I've ever written in my life.

reviewDescription: The BIODANCE Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask is a popular skincare product designed to offer intense hydration, improve skin elasticity, and reduce the appearance of pores. It’s an overnight hydrogel mask, meaning it is meant to be applied before bed and left on overnight for maximum benefits. Here’s a detailed review of the mask based on its features and user feedback:Key Features:1. Hydrating Overnight Formula: The mask is designed to be left on overnight, allowing the active ingredients to deeply hydrate and rejuvenate the skin while you sleep. It’s formulated with bio-collagen and hydrogel to ensure moisture retention and skin nourishment throughout the night.2. Pore Minimizing: One of the claims of this product is its ability to reduce the appearance of pores. The mask helps refine skin texture by moisturizing deeply and tightening the skin surface, which can give pores a more minimized look over time.3. Elasticity Improvement: The bio-collagen in the mask is designed to boost skin elasticity, improving the overall firmness and resilience of the skin. This may be especially beneficial for those concerned with signs of aging or loss of firmness.4. Hydrogel Technology: The mask uses a hydrogel base that allows for better absorption of the active ingredients compared to traditional sheet masks. It adheres closely to the skin, creating a barrier that prevents the ingredients from evaporating and ensures prolonged hydration.5. Gentle & Non-Irritating: The formula is designed to be gentle on the skin, making it suitable for most skin types, including sensitive skin. It is free from harsh chemicals and artificial fragrances, which can often irritate delicate skin.Pros:• Deep Hydration: Users report that their skin feels incredibly moisturized and plump after using the mask, especially in the morning. The hydrogel technology helps lock in moisture overnight.• Improved Skin Texture: Many find that after consistent use, the mask helps improve skin texture, making the skin feel smoother and softer. The pore-minimizing effect is also noticeable for some users.• Elasticity & Firmness: Regular use is said to contribute to more elastic and firmer skin, particularly beneficial for those dealing with early signs of aging or skin laxity.• Non-Greasy & Absorbs Well: The gel-based texture is lightweight and non-greasy, which makes it comfortable to sleep in without worrying about residue or discomfort on the pillow.• Suitable for Sensitive Skin: It’s designed with sensitive skin in mind, and many users with sensitive or acne-prone skin have found it to be gentle and non-irritating.Cons:• Price: Depending on where it’s purchased, the mask may be considered on the pricier side, especially given that it’s an overnight treatment that may need to be used multiple times to see visible results.• Effectiveness May Vary: While many users report positive results, others may not notice a dramatic change in pore size or skin elasticity immediately, especially if they have more significant skin concerns.• Can Be Messy: As with some hydrogel masks, the texture can sometimes be a bit slippery, making it prone to sliding off during the night. Users need to ensure they apply it evenly and securely.• Not for Everyone: Although generally well-tolerated, there’s always the possibility that those with specific allergies or skin conditions may experience a reaction. Patch-testing before use is recommended.User Feedback:• Positive: Many users rave about how their skin feels soft, hydrated, and refreshed the morning after using the mask. It’s especially popular for people with dry skin or those looking to boost hydration levels during the colder months.• Mixed: Some users have noted that while the mask is hydrating, they didn’t experience a dramatic reduction in pore size or significant improvements in elasticity. However, others found that these benefits became more noticeable with consistent use over a few weeks.Final Thoughts:The BIODANCE Bio-Collagen Real Deep Mask is a promising skincare treatment for those looking to hydrate, improve skin elasticity, and minimize pores. Its overnight hydrogel formula is convenient and effective for moisturizing the skin deeply while you sleep. While it may be slightly more expensive than other options, many users find it to be a worthwhile addition to their nighttime skincare routine, particularly for dry or aging skin. However, as with any product, results may vary, so it’s best to give it consistent use over time to see its full benefits.

reviewDescription: I first saw these on a Facebook ad, and decided I wanted to try them. As a 43 year old peri-menopausal woman, I feel like I'm constantly looking for something to increase hydration. This dry skin thing is no joke! This is one of the only face masks I've found that leaves my face so soft and hydrated, I don't need to worry about any flaking or reapplication of lotion on a daily basis.There is a learning curve when you apply the mask. It's very fragile (I poked more than one nail hole into the first one I used) and also very slippery. I suggest applying the bottom part first, then layering the top over it. If you apply 2 hours before bedtime, it will stay in place, and it will not stain your bedding. I have been able to sleep comfortably every time I've used it (which has been on a regular since I found it.) I've been giving these to all my friends to try too.If you're on the fence, just try it. I hope you'll be as delighted as I am.

reviewDescription: i heard about these through instagram and was not sure if this was a gimmick or actually worked. reviewDescription: Having purchased the Rain-X WeatherBeater Wiper Blade (20") recently, I'm quite satisfied with its performance. For those of us who prefer these traditional-style blades over beam blades, they are a solid choice. I've often found that beam blades tend to concentrate their pressure at the edges, sometimes leading to streaks and water trails in the center of the windshield. These WeatherBeaters, on the other hand, provide a more consistent pressure across the blade, resulting in a cleaner and more thorough wipe.The fact that they "Meet Or Exceed OEM Quality And Durability Standards" also gives peace of mind regarding their longevity. Installation was straightforward, and they've performed reliably in various weather conditions since I installed them.If you're like me and appreciate a wiper blade that maintains even contact across the glass, avoiding the center streaks that can sometimes occur with the edge-focused pressure of beam blades, the Rain-X WeatherBeater is definitely worth considering.
reviewTitle: A reliable wipe in all weather

reviewedIn: Reviewed in Australia on February 6, 2020

reviewDescription: Buying these "wiper blades" was the first time I've replaced blades on a modern car with this particular system of blade design. On my earlier cars it was just a long thin strip of rubber that (sometimes with two thin strips of steel support down each side) that one would reply.I was suspicious at the whole idea of needing to reply a the entire metal blade holder just to get new wipers. In my ignorance I ordered these new Rain-X "blades". I'm happy with the new blades, in that they perfectly, no noice, perfectly remove the water, etc. I can't comment on the longevity, as I've only had them on a few days.BUT HERE'S THE CATCH. This is daylight robbery. It's a huge waste of money and resources. How on Earth did the automotive industry get away with making car owners replace the entire blade holder (which is very solidly made out of steal), which is perfectly fine, just to get a tiny little strip of new rubber?It's the equivalent of having to change the entire wheel (hub and all) every time you need a new tire. That would never be acceptable.After cringing at the fact I was now the owner of wasteful and expensive wiper blade arms / holders that have little purpose except to go into landfill, I did some digging around. Yes, thankfully, It is possible to buy just the rubber (or silicone) strip, and install it into an existing blade arm / holder. One option I see here on Amazon goes for around AU$22 for 4 (https://amzn.to/460FYe6). They are referred to as "wiper REFILLS". Failing to put "refill" into the search will likely result in only seeing expensive full blade and blade holder replacements like this product from Rain-X.Welcome to the world of car part scams and cons, for the ignorant (as I was).
reviewTitle: Great blades, but what a waste!

reviewDescription: I recently treated myself to Tree Hut Vanilla Shea Sugar Exfoliating Scrub, and it has completely transformed my shower routine! From the moment I opened the jar, I was greeted with the most delicious vanilla scent - not artificial or overpowering, but warm and comforting like fresh-baked cookies.The texture is absolutely perfect - the sugar granules provide excellent exfoliation without feeling harsh or scratchy on my skin. I love how it buffs away all the dry, flaky skin on my legs and elbows, leaving everything incredibly smooth. The shea butter in the formula balances the exfoliation by providing deep moisture, so my skin feels both polished and nourished after use.What impressed me most is that the moisture actually lasts. Unlike other scrubs I've tried that leave my skin feeling dry again within hours, the hydration from this Tree Hut scrub keeps my skin soft well into the next day. I've even been able to cut back on body lotion on the days I use this.The jar is generous in size and a little goes a long way, making it excellent value. I've been using it twice weekly for about a month and have barely made a dent in the container.For anyone looking to elevate their shower experience while getting truly effective exfoliation, I can't recommend the Tree Hut Vanilla Shea Sugar Scrub enough. It's become my little self-care luxury that I look forward to every time!

reviewDescription: I recently tried the Tree Hut Strawberry Shea Sugar Scrub, and it’s been a delightful addition to my skincare routine. The scent is a refreshing blend of fresh strawberry, pink pineapple, and peach blossom—sweet but not overpowering. It leaves my bathroom smelling like a summer fruit basket!The scrub’s texture is just right—not too coarse, yet effective in sloughing off dead skin cells. After each use, my skin feels incredibly soft and hydrated, thanks to the shea butter and natural oils like avocado and macadamia. I also appreciate that it’s vegan and free from parabens and sulfates.One of the standout features is its no-slip formula, making it safe to use in the shower without worrying about slipping. Plus, the long-lasting fragrance lingers subtly on the skin, which I love.Overall, this scrub offers a luxurious experience at an affordable price. If you’re looking to pamper yourself with a product that delivers both in scent and performance, I highly recommend giving this one a try.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2025

reviewDescription: I recently tried the Tree Hut Raspberry Fizz Shea Sugar Scrub, and overall, it’s a really great product—but with one small drawback (literally!).First off, the scent is amazing. It’s a perfect blend of sweet raspberry with a fizzy, slightly citrusy kick that makes your shower smell like a refreshing fruity soda. It’s not overly perfumed or artificial—just fresh, fun, and uplifting. The scent lingers softly on your skin after use, which a lot of people (including me!) love.The texture is exactly what I’ve come to expect from Tree Hut. It has that thick, gritty sugar consistency that makes exfoliating satisfying without being too harsh. It scrubs away dead skin cells well and leaves your skin noticeably softer and smoother. It also contains nourishing ingredients like shea butter, which helps keep your skin moisturized—not dry or stripped after rinsing.The shimmer is subtle but cute. Some people mentioned they noticed a light sparkle left on their skin, which adds a nice, summery glow. It’s not glittery or over-the-top, just a tiny bit of fun if you like that extra touch.Now, the one downside: the size. This particular scent comes in a smaller tub than the usual 18 oz Tree Hut scrubs—more like 8.4 oz. Many reviews mention being surprised or disappointed by the smaller size, especially since the price is still fairly high. It’s definitely not a great value if you’re expecting the same amount as the standard jars. If you're someone who uses scrubs regularly, you'll go through this one pretty fast.Final Verdict: 4/5 stars.The Raspberry Fizz scrub is delightful in scent and performance—it leaves your skin smooth, fresh, and smelling great. But be aware of the size before you buy. It’s perfect if you want to try something fun or give a cute gift, but maybe not the best deal for everyday use.

reviewDescription: I pruchased this to use in my vehicle to get into those hard to clean areas. I ended up using it in my dad's work truck to really put it to the test. He is working in a very dusty area with the red dirt....his truck was covered in the thick dust, so a perfect test of the product. He and I cleaned what we could with rags, but I wanted to try this stuff out on the creases and vents. It worked alright. Here are the pros/cons of the product from my initial test:Pros:- Ease of use: This is very easy to use. Just open it up, pull it out, and start dabbing it into the dusty areas. I found that tapping the dust to get the worst of it off before dragging it over a second time worked best.- Cleaning: This is good for loose dust. It worked really well at removing the dust in the vents and some of the corners you could not get a rag into.Cons:- Cleaning: This did not remove some of the stuck on dust that a rag would have removed. I also found that getting in tighter crevices did not work very well either. It also left a little greasy feel that may attract dust or that some people may not like on their dashes or inside their vehicles.- Cleaning the product: With as heavy of dust that was in my dad's truck, the gel got pretty dirty. I am not sure the best way to clean it, or if you can even clean it. Rags and towels are easy...just throw them into a washing machine. I'm guessing this is use until completely dirty and throw away.- Messy: This also leaves a greasy feel to your hands. With rags, you can usually minimize this, but this stuff gets all over your fingers, especially the finger you use to press it into vents.Overall, this is something that is a neat idea, but it really is not great. It worked okay at getting loose dirt and dust off of surfaces, but you could also get the same results from using something like tape or wrapping a small tool with some cloth and using cleaning agents. This might make a cheap, fun stocking stuffer if you want to get something that is different. Personally, I don't think I'll buy this again and just use rags.

Thankfully, I quickly realized it’s meant for cars and other dusty surfaces, not my backside. Once used properly, it worked great! Thanks, Pulidiki—I’ll definitely be a return customer!

reviewDescription: This is an excellent stocking stuffer. I got this for my brother and he loved it. It gets all the dirt in very hard to reach places in your car. Definitely worth the money
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2025

reviewDescription: I originally brought these as Christmas gifts for my service technicians to use in their work trucks. Figured it would be something different and fun at the same time. They all raved about them and thought they were awesome. So I had to try them for myself and get some for me!This putty gets into all those weird tiny cracks and hard to reach crevices. it doesn't leaves any residue or weird marks on any of the surfaces that I tried in my car. I obviously didn't try it on the audio screen or clock. The instructions say not to do so which totally makes sense.Some reviews say it leaves hands slimy, I didn't experience that. It has a different feel to it, like a silly putty feel.There isn't really any directions for cleaning the product. So I choose to try something out. I took some heavy duty paper towels and ran it under warm water, rang it out pretty well. I opened up the paper towels and laid out on the counter. I took the putty and quickly rolled it around the wet paper towel. It really cleaned off most of the dirt and all the larger particles the putty had stuck to it. I did not soak the putty in water. Just a few quick rolls around the paper towel. after i did that, I put it back into the air tight jar it came in. After a few days, I opened it up to use it again and it worked the same way it did the first time! It wasn't dried out or anything. Still picked up dust and particles like before.I was happy with this product. I would recommend this to anymore that likes to keep the surfaces in their car clean on a daily basics. I am not sure how well this putty would do on like extremely dirty surfaces and used more frequently on those heavily soiled surfaces. But for me this was a great purchase at a great price and perfect for my need in my car!

reviewDescription: Used it to clean my fan which has collected a lot of lint and dust and it worked wonderfully!Here are a few tips that worked for me:1. Make sure the gel is cold, not warm, not hot. The warmer it is the more liquid it'll be, and the messier things will get.2. When you're cleaning things with spaces (like fan vents or keyboard keys) or things with holes, I placed the gel on it and pushed it gently, then waited for 5-10 seconds for the gel to seep into the spaces.DON'T LEAVE IT IN FOR MORE THAN 10 SECONDS! Otherwise you risk it going in too far and getting stuck inside.3. Rely on the fact that the gel sticks to itself more than anything else. If a few pieces get stuck between spaces, dont try to pull them out with your fingers. Use the rest of the gel and make it have contact with the pieces of gel for a few seconds before yanking out the entire thing. It should pull the pieces with it.4. Whenever you're trying to pull it out, try to either yank it up as one piece, or slide it in one direction so that it doesn't rip in one side.At first, I just dabbed it on the fan, and it didn't seem to do much, until I actually let it sit for a few seconds before peeling it off. This made the dust and lint pieces adhere to the gel.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United Arab Emirates on June 20, 2023

reviewDescription: ANOTHER UPDATE ~ These lotions really got me going through it. After trying all scents I have a solid ranking that can help others.1. Fresh & Cozy2. Strawberry Dream (Fresh & Cozy and Strawberry Dream are interchangeable but Fresh & Cozy seems more universal and versatile)3. Coconut Waters (Coconut Waters was 4th before because Pink Champagne is more exotic smelling and I’m trying to give a more universal rating but it’s definitely more my personality so I had to switch it.)4. Pink Champagne5. Vanilla Cashmere6. Jasmine Peach7. Pomegranate Raspberryeos Shea Better Fresh & Cozy Moisture Body LotionMorning light, dewy cassis and sheer muskThe fragrance of “Fresh & Cozy” is so simple yet anything but underwhelming. When you focus on the scent, it, to me, is the epitome of comfort. I highly appreciate it. This is the best out of the ones I’ve tried for the versatility. It’s not the loudest scent out of the line. It’s also not prettiest or overtly feminine scent in the world. But it’s the prettiest universal “clean”/low key scent I’ve ever smelled. It’s like pretty linens not just linens and that is obviously attributed to the cassis. I don’t have anything as refreshing yet feminine as this. Makes no sense how comforting it smells.eos Shea Better Strawberry Dream Moisture Body Lotionsparkling strawberry, pink sugar, and vanilla creamI initially was disappointed by this scent because the strawberry note is not as strong as I was expecting and it doesn’t last on the skin but this is the best scent for my body chemistry and i really like the slightly creamy pink sugar smell that remains for hours, even until the next day, on my skin! It makes me feel really cute yet it’s not immature to me! It is BY FAR the longest lasting fragrance out of the ENTIRE line on me and It’s actually my favorite now after prolonged use. I get it now I was just impatient. I wanted to make it #1 but everyone’s taste is different.eos Shea Better Pink Champagne Moisture Body Lotionpear champagne, ruby pomegranate & plum suedejuicy, different. pretty. feminine. I had my mom put it on and it reaffirmed my opinion of it. the sillage and projection is much stronger on her. Smells very good and exotic. I haven’t always been into scented lotions so the notes in this are very intriguing to me. It’s just so good! It’s notes are loud and distinct on my skin yet the overall exotic scent doesn’t last as long on me. this definitely can be in 3rd place. but it’s not as versatile for my personality. It’s VERY pretty and unique. It doesn’t stand out on my skin as distinctly or as long as Strawberry Dream. It actually leaves my skin in an hour and what remains is a sheer pear/plum musky smell for an additional hour. Interesting. I don’t like categorizing scents by seasons but it definitely gives off summer vibes. I’m a Autumn/Winter girl.eos Shea Better Coconut Waters Moisture Body Lotioncreamy coconut, lush hibiscus and solar muskI am most surprised by this lotion as I tried to stay away from coconut scented products because they always smell like piña colada. I don’t want anything tropical. Like I mentioned before I love milky and creamy scents and I was hoping it would smell like coconut milk and for now this is as close as I’ll get. it is more creamy and musky than tropical and it’s overall really pretty. I like it more than Pink Champagne and wear it more. So creamy! The hibiscus in this definitely helps it. I find this to be more interesting than the vanilla cashmere as that one to me just smells like caramel. I also put a baby oil on top of this and i’m telling you it smells so creamy and yummy.eos Shea Better Vanilla Cashmere Moisture Body Lotionwhipped vanilla, soft musk and cozy caramelI love vanilla, I love cream, I love milk scents. This isn’t bad but I can see how someone sensitive to scented products would smell burnt plastic instead of caramel. It’s more caramel than vanilla. Surprisingly my least favorite. A true vanilla lotion would be the one from The Lotion Company. That one is straight vanilla bean. The caramel isn’t cozy to me and is too sweet. A very gummy burnt (not in a bad way) caramel scent. I like smelling like a snack but it’s a bit too much for me. It actually gives me a headache. There’s nothing soft or cozy about this. I think I find this to smell a bit too juvenile for me. It’s clearly about personal taste. I know many adults who like this. I think teenager every time I smell it. Strawberry Dream has a creaminess mixed into so I can take it a bit more seriously i guess.eos Shea Better Jasmine Peach Moisture Body Lotionapricot nectar, sparkling jasmine, and vanilla sugarI was looking for some thing similar to the Johnson baby lotion in the pink bottle but without the green leafy note. It’s a bit feminine, but not powdery and babyish. You get more jasmine than peach. It’s basically jasmine with a sour undertone. It’s, so far, the least impressive out of the bunch. it’s also a bit screechy/pissy on me sometimes. Fresh & Cozy is stronger and lasts longer than this. The smell goes so fast and it’s not even that noticeable so I’m returning. I keep going nose blind to it. When I do smell it I’m just sure you can find something stronger and less simple at bath and body works and i don’t even shop there. It’s just not that good and I personally like jasmine as a fragrance note in perfumes. My mother likes it. It smells like grandma to me and I usually like scents that lean more sensual and/or mature.eos Shea Better Pomegranate Raspberry Moisture Body Lotionluscious pomegranate blended with tart raspberries and lotus blossomIt’s not bad. It’s not for my personality. Unlike Jasmine Peach, you can smell this one easily. Not interested in tart scents but thought I’d try anyway. It reminds me of a scent of hand sanitizer I would’ve gotten from bath and body works. It’s an average lotion scent and it’s not bad. Not my choice. if Jasmine Peach Was better I would prefer it over this if I was forced to choose.~ OLD Update: I raised it a star. I like strawberry dream but when it dries it’s just pink sugar. Not much cream. no strawberry. It’s cute. not that interesting but my nose welcomed the smell a bit more and i won’t return it. i’m not *AS* disappointed. ~OLD REVIEW ~It’s more sugar and cream and hardly any strawberry. I can’t believe I like Pink Champagne more than Strawberry Dream. It’s not bad but it smells like sugar cookies or biscuits. I was hoping for a strawberry cupcake vibe. There’s no strawberry once rubbed in. You only smell it right out of the bottle. For Pink Champagne I give it 4.5 stars because although I don’t usually like fruity smells, plum is not that common of a fragrance note for me to associate it with anything childish or juvenile. Plum and pear smell quite good. Lol i’m only 23 but i don’t like smelling like Skittles. I really don’t regret buying that one! Especially because I have others in my collection so it’s a good addition. Vanillas, milks, and cream scents are really nice and Strawberry Dream is a basic sugary scent that I’m unimpressed by. Disappointing. It doesn’t smell bad it’s just not as interesting or strong as the other lotions. Even Fresh and Cozy is more unique than this. Good thing is these lotions are the only lotions I feel that don’t leave my skin dry or absorb instantly. It leaves a bit of lubrication behind on the skin and not just a thin “dry” layer of oil. A nice silky finish on the skin. Comfortable and good value.

reviewDescription: IF you are buying this for that fragrance, the reason that I bought it, you will be sadly unhappy! The lotion itself is very nice, it is very hydrating and moisturizing to the hands! But there is not that signature fragrance, but I found in the body lotion! This one has absolutely no scent whatsoever to me, you have to really stick your nose up on it when it's on your hands to even get a tiny with of anything! So for that reason I will not be repurchasing this! Since the whole reason I'm buying it is because I wanted that strong vanilla cashmere fragrance, that I have found to love in the body lotion that I use daily! But I will also give a warning as far as the body lotion goes, the ones I buy in the store have that Heavenly fragrance, when I have ordered them offline here on Amazon they do not have that same smell! As a matter of fact the one that I bought last time here on Amazon the body lotion, it had a almost plastic nasty smell! The bottle was also damaged, so I contacted Amazon and they sent me a replacement! The replacement was in much better condition as far as the packaging goes, and the fragrance was a little bit there, but not like it is when I buy it in the store! I'm not sure why that is? I don't know if it's because they're older products? Or if it's because they're knock-offs possibly? Or if it's because of where they're they're keeping them in storage? I really don't know why it is it's very odd! Either way I'll continue to buy it at the store, and I will avoid buying that product here on amazon! Because the fragrance once again is the whole reason that I'm purchasing it, there are plenty of body lotions that give you that moisture and hydration that you need, but I buy this one specifically for the fragrance only! I have also read and found that, supposedly they have changed or are in the process of changing the formulation because some people were whining about the fragrance being too strong! IF that is the case, I will no longer be buying this product because for some of us it is the fragrance that we are buying it for! The whole purpose some of us buy these products, is because we're looking for that strong fragrance that will linger on our body all day! And when you find the right one with this brand, you absolutely get that! But just be careful where you purchase it! Even at the store I highly recommend that you open the bottle and stick your nose to it! Because you want to make sure you're getting the one that actually has that strong fragrance, if you're in it for the fragrance only like myself! As far as everything else the formulation is very nice very hydrating very moisturizing I can't complain on those points! Once again my review is based on fragrance only!

reviewDescription: I am so impressed with the EOS Cashmere Vanilla Body Lotion! I’ve tried several body lotions over the years, but this one really stands out. From texture to scent to how my skin feels hours later — it checks all the boxes.Scent (5/5):The vanilla fragrance is warm, cozy, and not overpowering. It reminds me of a soft cashmere sweater on a cool day — hence the name, I assume! There’s a hint of sweetness, but it’s balanced and sophisticated, not overly sugary or artificial like some vanilla products can be. It lingers just enough to feel fresh and feminine without clashing with my perfume.Texture and Absorption (5/5):The lotion is rich but not greasy. It spreads easily and sinks into my skin within seconds. I can get dressed almost immediately after applying it, which is a big win. It leaves my skin feeling silky smooth and moisturized without any sticky residue.Hydration (5/5):This is where it really shines. My skin stays soft all day long, even in dry weather. I’ve noticed a visible improvement in texture, especially on my elbows and knees, where I’m usually the driest. It feels like my skin is drinking it in, and the softness lasts well into the next day.Packaging (4.5/5):The bottle design is sleek and fits easily in my hand or on a bathroom shelf. The pump works well and dispenses just the right amount. My only tiny gripe is that I wish it were a little more eco-friendly or refillable — but that’s me being picky.Final Thoughts:Whether you’re looking for something to combat dry skin or just want to smell amazing all day, I highly recommend giving EOS Cashmere Vanilla a try. It feels like self-care in a bottle — luxurious, comforting, and clean. Definitely repurchasing!

reviewDescription: The NOCO Boost Plus GB40 is a compact yet powerful jump starter that delivers reliable performance when you need it most. Rated at 1000 amps, this lithium-powered device can safely jump-start dead batteries in seconds, making it an essential tool for drivers of gasoline engines up to 6.0 liters and diesel engines up to 3.0 liters.One of its standout features is the UltraSafe technology, which ensures spark-proof connections and reverse polarity protection, eliminating the risk of incorrect hookups. This makes it user-friendly even for those unfamiliar with jump-starting procedures. Beyond its primary function, the GB40 doubles as a portable power bank, allowing users to recharge smartphones, tablets, and other USB devices on the go. The integrated 100-lumen LED flashlight with multiple modes, including emergency strobe and SOS, adds another layer of practicality, especially in roadside emergencies.Designed for durability, the GB40 features a rugged, water-resistant enclosure rated at IP65, ensuring it can withstand tough conditions. Its rubberized casing prevents scratches and enhances grip, making it easy to handle. Despite its robust build, it remains lightweight and compact, weighing just 2.5 pounds, which makes storage convenient.While the GB40 is highly effective for most standard vehicles, its jumper cables are relatively short, which may require positioning adjustments when connecting to certain battery terminals. Additionally, while it holds a charge well, users in colder climates may need to top it off periodically to ensure peak performance.Overall, the NOCO Boost Plus GB40 is a reliable and versatile jump starter that combines safety, convenience, and durability. Whether you're dealing with a dead battery or need a backup power source, this device is a solid investment for any driver looking for peace of mind on the road.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2025

reviewDescription: I've been using the NOCO Boost Plus GB40 for a while now, and it has proven to be an invaluable tool for my car. Here are a few reasons why I highly recommend it:Compact and Portable: The GB40 is incredibly compact and lightweight, making it easy to store in your glove box or trunk. Despite its small size, it packs a powerful punch.Powerful Performance: With 1,000 amps of peak current, this jump starter can easily jump-start most vehicles, including cars, trucks, and even motorcycles. It can perform up to 20 jump starts on a single charge 1.Safety Features: The GB40 includes advanced safety features such as spark-proof technology and reverse polarity protection, ensuring safe and foolproof operation 2.Multi-Functional: Beyond jump-starting, the GB40 also functions as a portable power bank. It has a USB port for charging your devices and an integrated LED flashlight with multiple modes, including SOS 2.Durable and Reliable: Built to withstand harsh conditions, the GB40 operates effectively in extreme temperatures, from -20°F to 140°F 2. Its rugged design ensures it can handle repeated use.Overall, the NOCO Boost Plus GB40 has exceeded my expectations. It's a reliable, versatile, and powerful tool that provides peace of mind, especially during road trips or emergencies. Highly recommended!
reviewTitle: Works great in the cold with a dead battery.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2025

reviewDescription:
The media could not be loaded.
                
            
                
            
            
        
    
    








  
  
    Just wow! I was spring cleaning and got to my car. It had been sitting over winter and the battery fully died so I would have needed help. This thing is AMAZING!!! Sadly, I couldn’t capture it correctly since I had started it already, but I wanted to show how quick it works. I showed in the video that my car lights weren’t even turning on (shows just how dead the battery was). How the device is supposed to work is how it did in the video. Originally I was a special case. When I hooked up the cables, the lights didn’t cycle. If you are connected properly, hold the (!) button to override the safety and try starting now. That is what I had to originally do. If in the other case like in the video, the battery is dead but not entirely drained so it works as intended. I used it a few times getting the video properly and it still has 4bars (full battery). I appreciate how small and portable the device is. You could almost mistake it for a regular power brick if it weren’t for the text on the device. Overall, I would purchase it again, but I doubt I will ever need to. It will probably outlive me!My unit didn’t come with instructions so I had to look them up… Here is what to do in detail:1) Check if car will start without help2) If car won’t start, open hood of vehicle3) Take NOCO jumper and attach jumper adapter to device4) Connect clamps to car battery terminals, black-to-black and red-to-red (order doesn’t matter since the clamps are not powered yet)5) Turn the NOCO device on6) The white light below the power indication bar should turn solid and the power indicator lights should start to cycle6.5.1) If the clamps are connected properly and the previous step didn’t happen (power lights stayed solid and no white light), then either you didn’t connect properly or the battery is below 2v (completely dead). In this case you need to override the unit to force to start the process. Hold the (!) button for a few seconds6.5.2) The white light previously mentioned will flash instead of stay solid and the power indicator lights will cycle7) Attempt to start vehicle7.5.1) Vehicle should start without delay. If it doesn’t, your battery’s terminals might have corrosion on them interfering with the connection of the device. Power off the device and remove the clamps, in that order7.5.2) Clean the corrosion off the battery’s terminals7.5.3) Start again from step 48) Let the vehicle stay on to charge battery.9) Turn off the NOCO and remove the clamps, in that order10) Store NOCO device as desired, preferably in its included drawstring pouch and in a cool, dry location11) Either drive the vehicle for a while or turn the vehicle off after some time to save up some battery charge for later

reviewDescription: Veo mucha confusión en cuanto a la autenticidad del producto. Así que voy a dar mi opinión con base en eso y no a los resultados porque apenas me llegó ayer.Lo pedí con mucha inseguridad ya que en muchos comentarios se menciona que es falso principalmente por el código azul que tienen las botellas de The Ordinary. Pero ayer que me llegó investigué en YouTube y en blogs en línea.  La caja debe de ser de un material que se siente aterciopelado al tacto y el blanco es un blanco mate muy suave, y de un cartón más duro que por ejemplo una cartulina, la línea gris de la caja y de la botella son de un gris brillante pero igual aterciopelado. El código azul ya no es un indicio, ya que según algunas chicas que compran estos productos constantemente mencionan que The Ordinary cambia sus empaques después de cierto tiempo y el código de serie puede venir tanto en azul como en negro y en diferentes posiciones, lógicamente porque la producción se tiene que ir renovando. Uno se da cuenta en la tipología de la letra  que de hecho no debe ser irregular en ciertas partes de la caja. Es decir uno ve cuando las letras están chuecas o barridas de ahí uno se da cuenta inmediatamente. El que me llegó ayer incluso tiene una etiqueta que fue distribuido por Sephora México que hasta donde sé es la principal en traer a México la marca. Así que si me lo preguntan no hagan mucho caso a esas reseñas de que si el código azul y el código de barras está en otra posición etc. Porque lo repito The Ordinary no se queda con un solo diseño por más de un año pero hay patrones que claramente pueden ayudar a decir si es original o no como por ejemplo lo aterciopelado de la caja blanca. Así que por ahora puedo decir que si es original o al menos eso es lo que se ve, huele y se siente.En cuanto use el producto más tiempo ya daré mi opinión si funciona o no.Saludos
