reviewDescription: This is now my standard oil for my 2014 CRV.  Has reduced, but not totally eliminated, oil consumption (not a leak) I experienced using Mobil1 Advanced or Extended, or other synthetic 0W20 motor oils I've tried in the past.  My purchased new CRV has over 145,000 miles, & to be honest my oil change intervals were too far apart in earlier years.  It wasn't taken care of well enough then, trying to reduce wear and extend vehicle life now as long as possible.  MPG is not as good as with Mobil1, but 2 years (4 oil changes) of oil change analysis from BlackStone Labs shows sub 5PPM metal(s) per 1,000 miles, which is considered a good level of engine wear for a vehicle after break-in.  I'm changing this oil every 6 months, and approximately 6,000 miles.  Oil change analysis shows I could go longer, but I don't want to.  Low cost quality motor oil I can affordably change every 6 months, along with a Mobil 1 M1-110A Extended Performance Oil Filter.  Oil analysis shows this is a good combination on a car that wasn't given enough love earlier on in it's life.  This review is specifically for Valvoline Extended Protection Max Life 0W-20 Full Synthetic Oil.
reviewTitle: Great Oil for my Not-so-Well-Taken-Care-of 2014 Honda CRV - Confirmed via Oil Analysis

MaxLife Technology: The advanced formula works to fight the effects of aging engines. It reduces oil burn-off, minimizes leaks, and helps restore seals, which is especially crucial for older cars.2. Enhanced Protection: This oil offers superior protection against wear and tear, which can be a big concern for high-mileage engines. It keeps the engine running smoothly, reduces friction, and helps prevent sludge buildup. My engine feels like it's running with the same performance as it did when it was newer.3. Cleaner Engine: The cleaning agents in this motor oil help to keep the engine cleaner for longer. Improved Performance: After using this oil, I noticed smoother acceleration and a quieter engine. It helps your car run better, reducing engine stress and improving overall performance.Final Thoughts: If you're looking to extend the life of your high-mileage vehicle and keep it running smoothly, Valvoline High Mileage with MaxLife Technology Motor Oil SAE 5W-20 is definitely worth considering. reviewDescription: I recently tried the Maybelline Lash Sensational Sky High Washable Mascara in Cosmic Black, and it has quickly become my go-to mascara! This product truly delivers on its promises of volumizing, lengthening, defining, curling, and multiplying my lashes.The buildable formula allows me to achieve the perfect lash look, whether I want a natural daytime look or dramatic evening lashes. The exclusive Flex Tower brush bends to reach every single lash from root to tip, ensuring full coverage and incredible length.Infused with bamboo extract and fibers, this mascara feels lightweight and doesn't weigh down my lashes. Plus, it's ophthalmologist and allergy tested, making it suitable for sensitive eyes and contact lens wearers.The washable formula is easy to remove at the end of the day, which is a huge plus for me. The Cosmic Black shade is intensely pigmented, giving my lashes a bold and striking appearance.Overall, I highly recommend the Maybelline Lash Sensational Sky High Mascara for anyone looking to elevate their lash game. It's a fantastic product that offers great value for money.

reviewDescription: Okay so I bought this to pair with the Maybelline Sky High Waterproof Mascara, and I didn’t expect to love it this much. I was just hoping for a little fun sparkle on my lashes, but it actually turned out way better than I thought.Here’s what I learned while playing around with it. If you use it like regular mascara and just comb it through your lashes, it gives you a really subtle shimmer. It’s pretty, especially during the day or if you want something low-key. But if you want that glitter to actually show up, the trick is to press the wand gently against your lashes instead of brushing it through. I know it sounds a little weird, but it makes a huge difference. Just kind of press and blink, then press again, and suddenly your lashes look like they were kissed by fairy dust.Also, let each coat dry before going in with more. Same goes for your base mascara if you're layering it. I didn’t wait the first time and it got a little messy. Now I take my time and it applies so much better.The sparkle shows up the most in direct light. Like, if you shine your phone flashlight or catch sunlight just right, you can really see it twinkle. In regular daylight you can still see it, it’s just a lot softer. So it depends on the lighting, but I love that you can kind of choose how bold or subtle it looks.I seriously had so much fun trying this out and now I’m obsessed. Definitely recommend pairing it with your favorite mascara, but on it's own, it's cute too. It make my lashes look so pretty, and it just makes me feel extra cute.
reviewTitle: Glitter lashes are my new favorite thing!

reviewDescription: Pretty good! reviewDescription: I love this! I tried burgundy for something to make my hazel eyes pop a lil more, and wanted something on the 'natural' side. The spooly wand is VERY flexible and easy to use for me, if you prefer firm spooly wands you might not like that feature. Pictured - one coat in indoor light and direct sun light. No primer or other products used, and no curling. I love the pigment; it's not bright burgundy, it's very natural looking burgundy/brown. I think the formula and wand shape helps curl the lashes on their own, but my lashes aren't pin-straight, so I'm not sure if the product is curling or if it's just my natural lashes and application method (gently shaking side to side through the lashes while blinking and pulling the spooly through the lashes, looking down, using the curve of the wand to help shape the lashes)... regardless - it works perfectly for my needs. ⭐L⭐O⭐V⭐E⭐

reviewDescription: The people with bad reviews are misleading because they're not doing it correctly and their expectation is wrong. Any peal off lipstain is tricky to work with and can make a mess. Yess it gets on your teeth if you're applying all over. You do have to brush your teeth when you're done. It wont come off it one clean peal if you apply all over because it wasn't intended to be used all over. It comes off in one clean peal if you're using it as a liner only and allow it to dry completely. If you have alot of peach fuzz on your upper lip, it will pull your hair if you over line. Obviously. It you have dry skin pealing on your lips, it will pull on it if your applying it over it. Obviously. Some of these reviews are like...... really?!? I mean come on. There's a reason it advises to clean and exfoliate before use. If your lips are pealing, don't use it at all unless you're ready for a little sting. If used correctly, this product is fantastic!!! There are different types of skin around our lips and the stain will last different amounts of time depending on where you're applying it. The outer area where we line holds stain longer than the middle areas of our lips. The closer you get to the inside of your mouth, the less it's able to hold a stain. That has NOTHING to do with the stain and everything to do with your skin. I use this product all over my lips. I have learned (over the last 6 months of using it) that it works it's absolute best if you don't overline much. Remember, the skin above our lip is different than the skin of our lip! If you clean your lips and exfoliate as directed, apply a thin THICK line along the actual lip line, let dry for at least 5 minutes or longer, and then slowly peal, it works as expected. If you're applying all over, line first and then fill it. THICKLY. Once you peal it, it is NOT FINISHED. You have to take a cotton pad or washcloth and clean it up and blend. Then, if you applied all over, you will need to brush your teeth to make sure it's cleaned up. I usually take a q-tip and clean around my lips a second time to make sure it's perfect. Depending on how much stain I leave after cleaning it up and blending, it can last anywhere from a couple hours to all damn day. It really depends on how I did it. The color is gorgeous and nothing else compares in my opinion. I usually put a little elf stain over it if I'm just lining my lips with it. It looks beautiful and natural and there's nothing like it.Again, the bad reviews are from people that don't really know how to use it. Period.
reviewTitle: People not using it correctly and leaving bad reviews....
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2025

reviewDescription: This is my favorite lip stain/liner brand. I previously purchased the shade Noohde and this time I ordered SINamon. The product works as intended, lasting for hours without need for reapplication. It is mess-free and cleans up easily with micellar water if you make a mistake while applying it. It helps to create a flawless look and is very easy to use. The SINamon shade is more on the red side, and not so much on the brownish/burnt orange side as it appears in the photo but that’s okay because it’s a pretty shade and blends well with lipstick/gloss. There is no sticky residue after peeling the liner off and doesn’t have any strong tastes or smells. It is a light texture and doesn’t feel heavy on my lips. I took away one star from my review because the first one I bought dried up in the tube pretty quickly after purchase but in all honesty, that could have been an error on my part. I may have not sealed it tightly enough at some point. So I can’t say that it is a product problem, but I thought I’d mention it so you’ll be aware that this can happen if you don’t close the tube tightly enough. Otherwise, I am very happy with this product and will be buying more shades in the future. It is the only brand that I can find that truly lasts on my lips this long.

reviewDescription: This product is life-changing for anyone with very pale lip borders, like me. I have decent lip volume but non-existent lip contour and this product gives me natural lip lines and lasts almost all day!Many people here are having problems because they are using it wrong. Here are my tips since I have been using these in different colors for 3 months:—make sure you get a color matching your lip color IF YOU want a natural lip contour. Nude matches my lip 1 to 1 and Pinked is slightly more pink so I use it for bolder looks.—You have to be very precise in application. This is a lip stain so by definition it will stain your lips. If your application is imprecise it will look like that. Do not touch it with your hands until it is dry and careful with your teeth; it will stain both.—make sure your lips do not have dead skin or that your lip hairs are shaved because it will stick to the dry skin and hairs!—a further tip for me: I apply a thin cost of Aquaphor (Vaseline will work too) and then apply this and it comes out so smooth and even more natural. Make sure you do not apply too much Aquaphor though.Trust me, if you find a right color and you master the application this product will make your daily life better

reviewDescription: I hadn't heard much of this brand until recently. I am doing some routine maintenance on a 2015 Jeep Patriot and needed some user replaceable parts. It fit perfectly and not only improved the air quality in the cabin but also how quickly my cabin heated up (important in winter in Canada).After that positive experience, when I was looking for new wiper blades and saw ones from them (Spearhead Beam Force XTREME), I had the confidence that they make quality products. I read the product specs and reviews and looking at the more than reasonable price I bought them. Ironically the day I installed these one of my windshield washer nozzles broke (unrelated to this install) and so I was only getting a tiny trickle of washer fluid. Well with these new blades that tiny trickle was enough as my windshield is as clean as it has even been.I am a happy customer, sure to buy their stuff again.

reviewDescription: I make use of this phone holder for every ride I take, about five times a week, and it has never let me down. Besides having my phone at my fingertips for answering a call or a text without having to get the phone out of a pocket or a bike bag, it allows me to use an app instead of a cycle computer for tracking my speed, mileage, location and more. I have been so pleased with it that I currently have four of them on a variety of bikes. These hold the phone quite securely and I am never worried about losing it. I have never had a phone come loose or fall out of the holder while using these, not even close to coming out. The holder does feature a locking mechanism which is designed to hold the phone even more securely, but I have never had the need to utilize it. The feature is easily activated with a flip of a switch on the back side of the holder and is maybe useful for extremely aggressive mountain bike riding. It's nice to know it's there if you need it. The holder features the ability to tilt the phone to reduce glare and make viewing easier. If my wife lets me buy more bikes, I will buy more of these phone holders!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2025

reviewDescription: This is the most kick-ass phone holding mount I have ever used. Not only that, their support team is legit. I'm always trying to find work arounds and faster ways to get things done and sometimes that comes back to haunt me. When I received my new Lamicall mount I realized that the ball socket from the old, failed, inferior mount fit the Lamicall receiver so in an effort to save me time and effort I just popped the new Lamicall cradle onto the old ball still mounted on the handle bars. After a couple of months that ball failed. Of course I was racing down a hill and the phone sailed off bouncing down the road. Thankfully it was locked in the Lamicall cradle and totally protected. There was zero damage!I hadn't remembered that shortcut I took with the old ball mount and thus reached out to Lamicall in an e-mail to see if I could get that part replaced. They promptly responded saying "Please rest assured that we will take full responsibility for all quality related issues." In the meantime I happened to be searching in my spare parts bin for something unrelated when I found the original Lamicall ball mount in it's box! That's when I realized my mistake. I shouldn't have cut that corner. The Lamicall ball mound is clearly better designed and I should have used it from the get-go. I highly recomend this phone mount, and I have gone through a gang of them. I'm confident this may be the last one.
reviewTitle: Exceptionally well built product and backed up with great customer support!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2025

reviewDescription: This is a quality phone holder.  There is a lock on the backside that will keep your phone from bouncing out, even under the worst of bumps.  The mounting is very easy and will fit a wide variety of handlebar tube diameters (using the included rubber spacers).  The holder can be articulated into nearly any angle or position needed.  Vibration does not seem to get transmitted to the phone itself (likely due to the rubber mounting spacers I had to use for my bike).  As such I tried using the camera to record video during rides.  This works pretty good, but the mount may block the view of the camera on your phone.  Mine worked fine though,  Getting your phone on and off is a snap,  I have a Moto G Power 2024 that takes this holder to near the limit as far as size is concerned.  If your phone is much larger than mine, you may want to consider a different mount.
reviewTitle: Good quality and build, easy install

reviewDescription: I’ve been using these Camco TST MAX Drop-INs in my small camp toilet, and they work great for keeping things fresh and functional. The 30-pack is perfect for my weekend camping trips—each packet’s a little brick that I toss into the tank after a dump, and it gets to work fast. I’ve got a basic portable toilet (about 5 gallons), and one drop-in handles a full day’s use for two people, breaking down waste and TP like promised. No clogs or sluggish flushes so far after a dozen uses.The orange scent is a big win—it’s strong enough to mask any stink without feeling like you’re sniffing a citrus air freshener factory. I was worried about odors in tight quarters, but these keep the tent trailer smelling clean, even in summer heat. They’re septic-safe too, which is clutch since I sometimes empty at campground facilities—no guilt there. The resealable bucket keeps them dry and easy to grab on the go.A couple notes: the orange dye stains the water a bit, which isn’t a problem but looks odd at first. Also, they dissolve quick—great for action, not so much if you’re pre-treating and letting it sit too long before use. Compared to liquid treatments I’ve tried, these drop-ins are less messy and more convenient, though you’ll burn through them faster in a bigger RV tank.For small camp toilets like mine, these are spot-on—effective, odor-busting, and hassle-free. I’d give them 4.5 stars, rounded up to 5 for how well they fit my setup. Toss one in, and you’re good to go!
reviewTitle: Camco TST MAX Toilet Treatment Drop-INs – Great for My Camp Toilet

reviewDescription: Let me tell you about a game-changing marvel in the world of RV living: the RV toilet sewer treatment tab. If you're a seasoned traveler or a newbie to the RV lifestyle, you know that managing the black tank can be one of the less glamorous parts of the journey. Enter these little miracle workers!First off, the convenience is unparalleled. Just drop a tab into the toilet, and voilà, it goes to work immediately. No measuring, no mess, just a simple, effective solution to a problem every RVer faces. The tabs dissolve quickly and start breaking down waste and paper right away, which means fewer clogs and smoother tank emptying.What really sets these tabs apart, though, is their powerful odor control. Say goodbye to unpleasant smells wafting through your home on wheels. These tabs neutralize odors effectively, leaving your RV smelling fresh and clean. It’s like having a tiny but mighty cleaning crew working around the clock to keep things pleasant.Additionally, these tabs are eco-friendly, which is a huge plus for anyone who loves the great outdoors. They’re formulated to be safe for septic systems and the environment, so you can use them with peace of mind, knowing you’re not harming the beautiful places you visit.Finally, let’s talk about the cost-effectiveness. These tabs are affordable and come in bulk packages, meaning you’re well-stocked for multiple trips. The value for money is excellent, given the convenience and efficiency they provide.In summary, RV toilet sewer treatment tabs are an essential addition to your RV supplies. For anyone who wants to make their RV experience as pleasant and hassle-free as possible, these tabs are an absolute must-have. Happy travels!

reviewDescription: When I went to write this, I didn't think I would say much, but I guess there are a lot of benefits you don't really think about.  I'll really only be comparing the canned Celsius to the powder.At the current time, it's roughly $0.80 per serving vs $1.33/can serving (a Costco case) and up to probably $3 or more at a convenience store.So, it is absolutely delicious. I was kind of surprised the first time I tasted it. With any product's powder packets you can add to water, you can make it as dense or as watered-down as you like (customizable). I put 1 packet in my 40-ounce water bottle because I like a refreshing feeling/taste. In 40 ounces of water, my tastebuds say it's deliciously flavored water, not soda/juice. However, I could see people that hate that taste, and they would just put it in a standard sized plastic bottle to get the ultra-sweet, or non-water feel to it.There are a couple of additional benefits the way I drink it, in my opinion, that tie into each other. Because there is more water, naturally, I am getting more water intake, and it takes me longer to drink. Therefore, instead of getting 200 mg of caffeine at once and crashing, it is spread out over a much longer time period. I feel as though it's a much more sustained energy. And I used to drink 2 cans a day, but now I usually only have 1 (on my non-workout days) because it does what I need it to over a longer period of time. On my workout days, I will still generally have 1 for my workout and 1 for the day which is the same as what I do with the canned versions but the Celsius for the day lasts longer with the powder. I can't really do any of this with the carbonated cans because, for some reason, I just chug them.Additionally, since I am drinking more water, I feel like I eat less. I know caffeine is an appetite suppressant itself, but I am usually pretty content most of the day because I am full of water.  Again, this is in comparison to the cans and I don't seem to get as hungry. I do get hungry, just not "hangry." It's not a miracle drug or anything.Another benefit I just thought about is that it stays colder for longer since it's in my insulated water bottles. I live in Phoenix, so if I am outside in the middle of summer, this is kind of a big deal.The only 2 downsides so far.1. It seems to be that I go to the bathroom (#1, not #2) as much as I breathe. Okay, that's a little exaggerated, but it's a lot. However, I don't ever have to worry about having to pee in case I get popped for a drug test at work. lol2. Also, I now carry 2 large water bottles around because I'll carry 1 bottle for Celsius and 1 for water. This leads to having to wash them both at the end of the day (put them in the dishwasher). Again, both of these "cons" don't pale in comparison to the pros.I now have almost 2 cases of canned Celsius laying around because I swapped to the powder packets immediately. I will drink the cans to get rid of them but will likely never buy (the cans) again.UPDATE: The use of these just keeps getting better. I am travelling out of country for a month, and I don't believe the country I am going to is big on energy drinks. BUT, I can take a month's worth of Celsius with me (only adding a miniscule amount of weight and space in luggage) and not carry 3 cases of cans, which I would never do anyway. Another reviewer had mentioned this already, but I was so happy I didn't have to worry about my Celsius addiction in another country and wanted to let you guys know that they are ultra-portable.UPDATE UPDATE: Over a year later and it's still my favorite drink.

reviewDescription: The CELSIUS On-the-Go Powder Stick Packs in Berry flavor (Zero Sugar, 14 Sticks per Pack, 2.5 Ounce per Pack) have received a lot of positive attention for their convenience, refreshing taste, and effective energy-boosting properties. Here’s a breakdown of what customers typically highlight in their reviews:### **Taste:**Many users enjoy the **Berry flavor** of these powder sticks. It's described as **refreshing** and not overly sweet, despite being sugar-free. It strikes a balance between tart and sweet, providing a pleasant experience when mixed with water.### **Convenience:**The **on-the-go powder sticks** are frequently praised for their portability. They come in individual packets, making them incredibly convenient for people who are always on the move. Simply add one packet to water and enjoy a quick energy boost without needing to carry bulky cans or bottles.### **Performance:**CELSIUS powder sticks are marketed as a product that provides **natural energy** without the sugar crash associated with many energy drinks. The formula includes ingredients like **green tea extract, caffeine, and ginger**, which provide a clean boost of energy. Reviewers often mention feeling energized and alert after drinking, with many appreciating the **lack of jitters** or crashes.### **Zero Sugar:**For those who are watching their sugar intake, the zero-sugar aspect is a significant selling point. Customers often note that they can enjoy a flavorful energy drink without the negative effects of sugar, like an insulin spike or crash.### **Health Focus:**CELSIUS is positioned as a **fitness and wellness product**, so it's marketed as being free from artificial preservatives, flavors, and sweeteners. Many reviews highlight the product’s **health-conscious ingredients**, which include **vitamins and minerals** that may support metabolism.### **Drawbacks:**Some customers mention that the flavor can be a bit **strong or artificial** for certain tastes, especially if mixed with too little water. Also, while the caffeine boost works for many, those sensitive to caffeine might find it a bit too strong.### **Packaging:**The compact, lightweight packaging makes it perfect for tossing in a gym bag or backpack. The 14-stick pack provides a decent quantity for frequent use, though some users might find it runs out quickly if consumed regularly.Overall, **CELSIUS On-the-Go Powder Stick Packs** are highly rated for their **convenience**, **taste**, and **energy-boosting effects**. They're an excellent option for individuals looking for a sugar-free, healthy alternative to traditional energy drinks. If you enjoy berry-flavored drinks and need a quick pick-me-up, this product is likely a good fit. Just be mindful of the caffeine content if you're sensitive to stimulants.

reviewDescription: This is by far one of the best low priced scanners that I have ever used.It's simple, fast and easy to diagnose problems that are keeping you from reaching the ready for testing state.After scrolling thru the readings, mine had no CEL's, it showed the O2 not completed.I then scrolled to the chart screen in live data, scrolled down to the bank 1 sensor 1 and was pleased to see real time data such as a scope shows, everything was fine. Next up bank 1 sensor 2, the first look everything was fine. Back to sensor 1 everything was fine. Sensor 2 on the second look it was flatlined. Again cycled and on the third look, the signal was degraded and fluctuating.Bingo, an intermittent issue.I had already ordered the replacements so they were on hand. Once I had verification from this scan tool I replaced them. You always want to replace the entire bank, even though only one shows faulty, the others will soon follow.With this tool it took less than 10 minutes to resolve my trouble.Thank you for a great product.Don
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2025

reviewDescription: This is an inexpensive, basic scanner.  If one tries, one can spend hundreds of dollars for a scanner with more bells and whistles.  (As an example, I just returned a different IOT scanner that wanted unrestricted access to my WiFi router.)  This scanner does not ask for my personal info.  It does not need A WiFi connection, and does not send/receive email.Also, it draws power from the OBD-2 socket.  It does not need to be charged overnight.  It comes with a very nice user guide that explains how all the screens work.  The display is in black and white, but has good resolution and offers several real-time graphing functions.  The menu and set-up screens are intuitive.  Once I got started, I had no problem navigating through the displays.  I was able to view all the data I wanted to see, and was able to reset all of the codes that were causing lit trouble lights on the dashboard.  In short, this scanner does the job and even offers some additional features that make it easier to use.  This scanner is a keeper.
reviewTitle: Inexpensive, but very good bang for the buck
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2025

reviewDescription: My car was having some engine issues, the light was on, and in order to pass my emissions test and renew my registration I needed to fix the problem.This tool helped me to diagnose the issue, after looking under the hood and using the error codes to guide me it was incredibly obvious and I decided to fix it myself. One of the air intake hoses from the filter to the engine had degraded and was split completely in half, and fortunately it was a readily available part and easy for a novice to replace.It wasn't obvious at a glance, and this tool led me in the right direction.For complete amateurs like myself, be aware that after making a repair you should clear the error codes. You'll then need to drive 60-100 miles to ensure that the repair worked and for the car's computer to register as ready for inspection.Long story short, this tool saved me a lot of time, a LOT of money, effort, and not only helped me solve a serious problem but kept me out of trouble with my registration.Manual is clear and easy to follow and the device is simple enough to use.

reviewDescription: Julius Onah’s 2025 film, “Captain America: Brave New World,” follows a screenplay by Onah, Rob Edwards, Malcolm Spellman, Dalan Musson, and Peter Glanx. The film picks up following the events of the Disney+ television series “The Falcon and the Winter Soldier” as well as continuing on from the “Captain America” and “Avengers” films. In the story, Sam Wilson (Anthony Mackie) now works as Captain America and is aided by Joaquin Torres (Danny Ramirez), the new Falcon. They find themselves drawn into a spy game following the election of Thaddeus Ross (Harrison Ford, replacing the late William Hurt) to the Presidency and the geopolitical ramifications of the discovery of adamantium in the Celestial Island left over from the events of Chloé Zhao’s 2021 film, “Eternals.” The film sets up a race for resources with Japan and the United States as the largest players in the contest. President Ross and Cap have their own rocky history, made all the worse when a trigger sets off Isaiah Bradley (Carl Lumbly) at a White House reception, forcing Cap to help capture his old friend while also figuring out what the President is hiding.The film introduces Sidewinder (Giancarlo Esposito) and Copperhead (Jóhannes Haukur Jóhannesson) as members of Serpent, thereby using an early story idea for the third Cap film before it was changed to “Civil War.” While other Marvel projects have hearkened back to Louis Leterrier’s 2008 film, “The Incredible Hulk,” hoping to demonstrate the importance of the second entry in the MCU through cameos in Destin Daniel Cretton’s 2021 film, “Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings,” and Jessica Gao’s 2022 Disney+ series, “She-Hulk: Attorney at Law,” Onah uses “Brave New World” to tie together the most threads from “Incredible Hulk” with Thaddeus Ross’ prominent role, the return of Samuel Sterns (Tim Blake Nelson) who had his brain exposed to gamma in “Incredible Hulk,” and a brief cameo from Betty Ross (Liv Tyler). Just as “Civil War” was both a Cap film and an Iron Man film, “Brave New World” is both a Cap film and a Hulk film.At times, the political thriller elements struggle to hold suspense since the film’s marketing gave away several of the biggest twists. Harrison Ford gives one of his best dramatic performance, imbuing the character with more pathos than William Hurt had been able to do in previous films (not due to a lack on Hurt’s part, but because of how those prior films used the character). For his part, Anthony Mackie continues to demonstrate why he was the right person to take up the shield and become Cap. He shows mercy, compassion, and introspection even as he’s delivers fantastically choreographed and athletic fight scenes. Shira Haas rounds out the cast as Ruth Bat-Seraph, who Onah reimagines as a former Black Widow. Changes to the character’s origin and costume help with some of the controversy surrounding her inclusion given current real-world events. Further, the character’s initial debut in the “Hulk” comics adds to the role of the Hulk mythos in this movie. Unfortunately, the film doesn’t make her a mutant and thus misses the opportunity to use both her inclusion and the appearance of adamantium to further lay the groundwork for the X-Men. Overall, “Brave New World” is an enjoyable film with Anthony Mackie shining as Cap, but the film struggles to balance several subplots and could have used the political thriller elements to greater effect as an allegory for our own political situation. Ford’s portrayal of President Ross and the parallels to “The Manchurian Candidate” work particularly well.This Blu-Ray/4K steelbook is a great way for Cap fans to add this film to their collection. It includes featurettes about Anthony Macke’s portrayal of Sam Wilson over the years, a look at Sam’s greatest foes, a gag reel, deleted scenes, and audio commentary. I do wish there was more about the effects both practical and digital as well as an inclusion of art cards like Marvel has done in the past. The art on the packaging is particularly nice and recalls some of the current posters for John Frankenheimer’s 1962 film, “The Manchurian Candidate.”
reviewTitle: Fun, but Often Balancing Too Many Plot Threads
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2025
